story:
PaydayReport.com is very excited to announce that we have cut a print syndication deal with historic African American owned Chattanooga News Chronicle. Through this partnership, Payday’s reporting will be able to reach 30,000 print readers on a weekly basis in Chattanooga; providing workers in Eastern Tennessee with labor reporting that is sorely missing.

Now to reach even more readers, we need your help.  Our goal is to spend more time focused on reporting and less on fundraising. In coming months, Payday hopes to create more print partnerships with small newspapers and magazines as well as online publishers throughout the South.

We hope to raise $5,000 to help us meet our budget for the next 3 months.

Also, we encourage our readers to sign up to give $3 a month. Recurring monthly donations allow us to focus most of our energy on reporting instead of fundraising. Payday already receives $1,018 a month in recurring donations from 131 dues paying readers in addition to occasional grants and freelance fees.   (Sign up here to contribute monthly)

Your contribution of twenty bucks today or what you can afford will be an excellent help us get out the story of workers organizing across the South.

The fastest-growing region in the United States for union membership is the South, where nearly 150,000 workers opted to join unions last year. As veterans of the digital media unionization, we know that if unionization in digital media has proved one thing, it is that coverage of workers unionizing leads to even more organizing. There is not a single full-time labor reporter covering the 60 million workers throughout the South.

Payday Report hopes to fill that void. Already, we have shown an ability to have a big impact on several stories in the South:

- Payday was the first publication in the U.S. to break the story of Republicans Kentucky preparing to pass “Right-to-Work.”

- We were the only major outlet to cover how delays by the Obama Administration could stop West, Texas safety reforms from taking effect

--  When six children were killed in a school bus crash in Chattanooga, Payday was the first outlet to report on the school bus company’s long track record of worker intimidation and safety violations.

While the local media focused on placing blame on the school bus driver, Payday was able to shift the conversation to the role of privatized school bus companies cutting corners on safety and workers rights. The reporting lead to a State Senator calling for hearings into privatized school busing

- -Payday Report was the first outlet to expose how the political spending of Alliance Resources Partner CEO Joe Craft was leading to refusal of Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to bring the MIner’s Relief Act. Eventually, our reporting was picked up by other outlets, contributing to the public pressure on McConnell to do something to protect the retirement of 125,000 retired miners and their beneficiaries.

--  For over three years, Payday Senior Labor Reporter Mike Elk has been covering attempts to unionize at Volkswsagen's factory in Chattanooga, Tennessee. This year, we exposed how Volkswagen had intimidated workers against speaking up during the company’s emission scandal, which saw one of the biggest recalls in American history.

-- Finally, Payday Report's weekly newsletter, The Lunch Pail, has filled a vital hole in coverage by providing an overview of all the major victories and losses for organized labor throughout the South.

This coming winter, we hope to do a lot more. We hope to cover the “right-to-work” fight in Kentucky, the coming union election at Boeing in South Carolina, the growing movement of striking construction workers across the South as well continuing our coverage of the stubborn attempt unionizes at Volkswagen in Chattanooga.

To help us expand continue our coverage, we are asking our readers to contribute to our unique winter fund of $5,000. Also, please consider becoming a monthly recurring donor for as little as $3 a month (sign up here to donate monthly).

So thanks for all of our help and happy holidays.

Love & Solidarity,

Mike Elk

Senior Labor Reporter, PaydayReport.com

Member, Washington-Baltimore Newspaper Guild

story:
About The Book 

Full Term is a contemporary Young Adult novel. The first in a trilogy. 

Contemporary means it's set in the modern-day, real world. No magic, no space ships. 

Young Adult means it would be of interest to teenagers, but the book has mature themes and would appeal to many adults, too. 

Blurb 

Sixteen-year-old Mya’s life was hard enough already, dealing with her sociopath step-dad on a daily basis, but when she goes into labour during maths class, things are set to get a whole lot worse.

She hasn’t told her boyfriend, Richard. She hasn’t told anyone; hasn’t got any support in place, and is helpless when her step-dad forces her to give her baby up.

Mya had no idea social services would offer the baby to Richard before putting her in the system, and she certainly never would have guessed Richard would say yes. Now all she can do is fight to get them both back.

About the Author 

Ellie Rose McKee is a writer from Northern Ireland. She has had poems published by Arlen House, Nine Muses Poetry, and Poetry NI; has had short stories included in Women Aloud NI's 'North Star' anthology, The Bramley, and The Bangor Literary Journal; and has been blogging for over ten years.

Current chair of Belfast Writers' Group and one of the winners of a 2019 Margaret Carey Scholarship from the Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators, Ellie also won support from the Arts Council Northern Ireland in 2018.

What the Money Will Be Used for 

£500 is the minimum needed for this project to work. Here is how the money will be spent, in order of priority. 

  • Editing Costs 
  • Licence Fee for the Cover Art 
  • Proof Copies 
  • Printing Costs 
  • Postage and Packing 
  • Marketing

story:
How do I give children tools to recognize "bad people" so they can be avoided? How do I explain the concept of Rejection to a six year old?  How do I convey that all creatures in nature  speak a common language?   I believe I've done that in my book,THE CAT WITHOUT A PURR. This story resonates with audiences of all ages. At readings I've seen adults laughing, crying and gripped by the story. THE CAT WITHOUT A PURR is a story about a kitten who is "different". He faces life without a crucial survival tool: he can't purr.  He can't communicate to humans when he's happy and content.  Oh yes, he can swish his tail rapidly back and forth when he feels good.  But he disappoints those who would adopt him. He is thrown into the world, alone, without basic cat skills.  He makes a devoted friend, a mouse,  who is wise and loyal. This pair go on a quest to find that magical place: home.  They want to be accepted.

I have a complete manuscript of 5600 words.  I need an illustrator, formatting and funds for publishing and marketing.  With the right illustrator this book will be sensational  I have used Smashwords.com to publish an e-book, a memoir (500 plus downloads so far).  I've placed that book on Amazon, too, but I prefer Smashwords, I like the "little guy". I've been studying marketing and business this year and I'm aware of the  difficulty of breaking through the crowd. I've learned Social Media.  I'm on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Pinterest. It's overwhelming! Children's books have a natural market, especially when they are distinctive, profound and fun.  I've been a professional writer for thirty years, a photographer with outstanding credentials and a musician with a CD.  I've even published a centerfold photograph in Cat Fancy Magazine!

THE CAT WITHOUT A PURR will become a beloved classic.  I know it.  When you read it, you'll know it too.

story:
English speaker ? You can find a translation of these texts by clicking here.
(click on the image to enlarge and read)
 

Une Histoire, un Livre

"L’Écrasée", c'est un recueil de poésie ; mais c'est aussi une histoire disloquée, décousue, faite de petits bouts de vie étalés de 2005 à 2015.

L'histoire d'une femme Clara, et d'un homme, Kévin, qui sont en réalité une seule et même personne ; l'histoire de leur rencontre, de leur tentative de vivre ensemble dix ans durant, sans se toucher, sans respirer de peur de se gêner ; et finalement, l'histoire de leur abandon, l'un à l'autre, ou l'un sans l'autre.

"Mais la malédiction n'est l'effet que du coeur ; Nous n'avons pour destin que le bruit de nos âmes"... Il est toujours possible de changer les choses. 

C'est là que vous pouvez participer.

Clara est transgenre. Elle a besoin de plusieurs milliers d'euros pour payer ses frais médicaux. Ils ne sont pas nécessaires pour survivre, mais ils le sont pour vivre - ce n'est pas toujours le plus facile. Clara n'a rien à vous offrir en échange, que ce qu'elle a fait toute sa vie, sans raison, parfois contre sa volonté : de la poésie. De la poésie bancale, ça ne vaut pas grand chose ; mais il y a eu des jours où la vie de Clara ne tenait qu'à un poème bancal.

En offrant à Clara les moyens de vivre, elle vous offrira des poèmes. Des poèmes bancals, mais qui vous toucheront peut-être. 

 

Lisez et Participez

Selon la somme que vous accepterez de verser, vous recevrez des compensations variables sous forme poétique. 

  • "La Belle & La Bête" est un très long poème (plus de 200 vers) sous forme de conte qui traite directement de la transidentité et de "ce que c'est qu'être une femme". Vous en recevrez automatiquement une copie en PDF dès 5€ de dons. 
  • "L’Écrasée" est le recueil principal ; il contient "La Belle & la Bête", ainsi que des dizaines d'autres poèmes (plus de 70). Vous le recevrez en PDF à partir de 10€ de dons, et en format papier (par la poste) à partir de 20€ de dons.
  • "Écris-moi un poème" est une compensation prévue pour les dons particulièrement élevés (250€ et plus). Pour les donateurs les plus généreux, j'écrirais un poème qui leur sera dédié ; sur eux-mêmes ou sur le thème de leur choix. Ils pourront décider, après l'avoir lu, de voir le poème inclus dans le recueil ou choisir de le garder pour eux. 
 

Qui est Clara, et où vont les fonds ?

Clara est née en 1988 dans une banlieue perdue de Paris. A 8 ans, elle commence à écrire des poèmes ; à 11 ans, elle écrit ses premières règles de jeux de rôles et de jeux vidéos. Deux habitudes qui ne l'ont toujours pas quittée, 20 ans plus tard. Aujourd'hui, elle est gérante d'une petite entreprise de jeux vidéos, Inner Seas, qui est responsable entre autres de la création et de la publication de la série de jeux de rôles indépendants "Winter Voices" dont le thème principal est le deuil et le rapport à la famille. Un jeu vidéo contemplatif et inhabituel qui a été salué par la critique pour son originalité et ses qualités artistiques. Un livre tiré du jeu devrait paraître courant 2016. 

Quoiqu'aimant bien les barbes et trouvant la sienne fort plaisante, Clara préférerait idéalement admirer celle des autres et avoir la peau un peu plus douce. C'est pour elle moins une question de genre qu'une histoire de perception et d'identité physique. Après tout, Clara n'est pas spécialement "féminine" - elle aime le bricolage, les jeux vidéo, porter des jeans troués, draguer les jeunes femmes sans défense, sans même parler des sciences et de l'informatique qui sont des sujets qui la fascinent. Mais de nos jours, fort heureusement, rien de tout ça n'empêche d'être une femme. 

Elle a donc décidé en 2014, après dix ans de réflexion, d'engager des procédures médicales visant à la transformer en femme un peu plus "normale". Ces opérations sont coûteuses, et Clara ne gagne pas beaucoup d'argent. Ecrire des livres et développer des jeux vidéos qui parlent des relations humaines, du deuil, de la plasticité de l'esprit et des émotions rapporte étrangement moins d'argent que faire des jeux où l'on tue des dragons. (si vous ne comprenez pas pourquoi, soyez rassurés : elle non plus - même si au demeurant elle adore tuer des dragons) 

Les fonds serviront à l'aider financièrement et à financer ses dépenses médicales diverses et variées. La sécurité sociale française ne rembourse pas ou peu les frais médicaux liés à la transidentité. La France est, malheureusement, un pays très en retard sur la question transidentitaire, au sein de l'europe. 

Une liste non-exhaustive des frais médicaux :

 

  • Chirurgie : 13 000€ (il faut aller au Canada ou en Thaïlande)
  • Conservation de fertilité : 700€+100€/an (il faut aller en Belgique ou en Espagne)
  • Hormonothérapie : 600€/an
  • Laser Visage : 1000€
L'objectif de la levée de fond est à 5000€. Si la levée de fond venait à dépasser 15 000€, l'excédent serait reversé à Inner Seas Editions pour permettre l'écriture et la publications d'ouvrages différents et intéressants. 
 

Le Recueil

"L'Ecrasée et autres poèmes" est un recueil de plus de 70 poèmes écrits pour la plupart entre 2005 et 2015. Le recueil est constitué des 7 parties suivantes :

 

  • "Clara & Kévin" (poèmes autobiographiques)
  • "La Belle et la Bête" (poème unique traitant de la transidentité)
  • "Poèmes pour des passants" (poème écrits pour des gens croisés au fil de la vie)
  • "Poèmes pour Jeux" (poèmes écrits dans le cadre de la création de jeux vidéos)
  • "Poèmes pour Rire ou par Hasard" (poèmes écrits pour des événements divers ou pour le plaisir)
  • "Poèmes d'Adolescence" (une sélection de poèmes écrits entre 12 ans et 18 ans)
  • "Poèmes d'Enfance" (une sélection de poèmes écrits entre 8 et 12 ans)

 

Quelques Extraits

Quand elle revient à elle, quelle n'est pas sa surprise
De se voir revenue dans sa vieille maison !
« Quel mauvais, mauvais rêve. » se dit-elle. Un frisson
La secoue, sur le lit où elle se trouve assise.

Elle regarde ses mains et se glace d'effroi.
Sa peau douce est un cuir où pousse une fourrure
Ses ongles sont des griffes, son torse est une armure
De chair épaisse où son gigantesque cœur bat

Quand sa mère l'aperçoit, elle crie de ravissement
« Quelle Bête magnifique ! Lourde et forte à la fois ! »
Et ses sœurs applaudissent ; et son père, la voyant
Se gonfle de fierté et la prend dans ses bras

« Mais je suis votre fille, ne le voyez-vous pas ? »
Leur hurle-t-elle, terrible, de sa voix de caverne
Rien n'y fait. Quoi qu'elle dise, ils ne l'entendent pas
« Notre fille ? Quelle sottise ! Que sont ces balivernes ? »

 

 

 

 

 

 

(in "La Belle & La Bête")
 

 

C'est un fou somnanbule qui vit dans la lumière
Un zombie de papier – un flasque somnifère
Une loque – disait-elle
Qui se traîne, brisé, le long des monastères
Écumant les querelles
Cherchant le pont brisé où pondre ses ovaires

 

(in "Le presque peintre")

 

 

 

 

 Ses épaules difformes on les dirait pendantes
Pendant qu'elle murmure à ses ordinations
D'une langue ténue, terrible et envoûtante
De son ventre à ses yeux elle n'est qu'inflexions
(in "L'écrasée")

 

 

Les pieds de feuilles, les bras de terre
Elle souriait comme personne
Sourde aux frissons de la lumière
Ma pluie donnée pour sonotone

Elle m'a suivi, trouvé peut-être
Mes mains tressées dans sa couronne
Elle regardait par la fenêtre
Heureuse d'être monotone

 

 

 

 

 

(in "Les Amants")

"La Belle et la Bête" (poème unique traitant de la transidentité)
"Poèmes pour des passants" (poème écrits pour des gens croisés au fil de la vie)
"Poèmes pour Jeux" (poèmes écrits dans le cadre de la création de jeux vidéos)
"Poèmes pour Rire ou par Hasard" (poèmes écrits pour des événements divers ou pour le plaisir)
"Poèmes d'Adolescence" (une sélection de poèmes écrits entre 12 ans et 18 ans)
"Poèmes d'Enfance" (une sélection de poèmes écrits entre 8 et 12 ans)

 
Quelques Extraits
Quand elle revient à elle, quelle n'est pas sa surpriseDe se voir revenue dans sa vieille maison !« Quel mauvais, mauvais rêve. » se dit-elle. Un frissonLa secoue, sur le lit où elle se trouve assise.Elle regarde ses mains et se glace d'effroi.Sa peau douce est un cuir où pousse une fourrureSes ongles sont des griffes, son torse est une armureDe chair épaisse où son gigantesque cœur batQuand sa mère l'aperçoit, elle crie de ravissement« Quelle Bête magnifique ! Lourde et forte à la fois ! »Et ses sœurs applaudissent ; et son père, la voyantSe gonfle de fierté et la prend dans ses bras« Mais je suis votre fille, ne le voyez-vous pas ? »Leur hurle-t-elle, terrible, de sa voix de caverneRien n'y fait. Quoi qu'elle dise, ils ne l'entendent pas« Notre fille ? Quelle sottise ! Que sont ces balivernes ? »
 
 
 
 
 
 
(in "La Belle & La Bête")
  C'est un fou somnanbule qui vit dans la lumièreUn zombie de papier – un flasque somnifèreUne loque – disait-elleQui se traîne, brisé, le long des monastèresÉcumant les querellesCherchant le pont brisé où pondre ses ovaires (in "Le presque peintre")     Ses épaules difformes on les dirait pendantesPendant qu'elle murmure à ses ordinationsD'une langue ténue, terrible et envoûtanteDe son ventre à ses yeux elle n'est qu'inflexions(in "L'écrasée") 
 Les pieds de feuilles, les bras de terreElle souriait comme personneSourde aux frissons de la lumièreMa pluie donnée pour sonotoneElle m'a suivi, trouvé peut-êtreMes mains tressées dans sa couronneElle regardait par la fenêtreHeureuse d'être monotone     (in "Les Amants")

story:
My name is Jason Buzi. In May of this year (2014 as I write this), together with my best friend, we decided to do something to give back to the community in a fun way. One night, we hid cash all over San Francisco and created a Twitter account with the handle @hiddencash to give people clues about where they can find it. We had no idea that what started as a fun game, would have nearly half a million followers just days later, and that we would be making headlines all over the world. Hidden Cash became a popular game throughout the US and expanded to Mexico, Europe, and beyond all in a span of a few months.

I have been interviewed by Anderson Cooper on CNN, by the BBC in London, on Good Morning America, Fox News, and much more. But until now, I have never had a forum to share the inside story of Hidden Cash. There is so much more than has been told in the interviews. This is your chance to find out about Hidden Cash: The Inside Story, as told by the insider. There are lessons here whether you want your idea to go viral, or are interested in marketing, social media, or human behavior. And it's just a unique, entertaining story (I think!). I can tell you it was the most unique, once in a lifetime experience. But this is actually two books in one. In addition to the story of Hidden Cash, I will be share life and business advice that I wish someone had taught me when I was a younger man. It would have helped me avoid a lot of pitfalls and heartache. I want to share my lessons learned on life, business, and real estate, that have enabled me to travel the world, have some amazing experiences, live a lifestyle of freedom, and give back through Hidden Cash and in many other ways. 
Portions of the proceeds will be donated to Feeding America, helping the neediest. Although for reasons the book will discuss, we are no longer doing money drops, I continue to be committed to giving back to the community. This holiday season, we are giving care packages to people living on the streets, and encourage others to do the same. Thank you for listening.

story:
I spent the entire night crying.

And before you go there, no.

Not because I was in my 30's now and I was mourning for my lost youth…

At first I thought someone had slipped a dose of acid into my Aviation cocktail. There was this weird, trippy, muddy-headed dizziness, a warping in my mind that made me close my eyes tightly against it. And when I opened them, I was seated on the huge area rug that Isabelle had dragged up to the roof, just for my party. I couldn’t recall walking over to it and sitting down. I was only on my second drink, so there was no way I was anywhere near drunk and we hadn't opened the Absinthe yet, so I couldn't exactly blame it on that either. So what else could it have been?

"Asshole!" I stood up and yelled across the roof of my three story building. Not my usual language, but really, who drugs you at your own birthday party? "Who slipped me the acid?"                                                                                                                                                                                              


And then he kissed me. Bliss. Ah, blissful, wonderful kisses that erased any other thoughts. And then he was pushing me back gently, down into the softness of the couch, his hands caught up in my hair, his mouth crushed against mine. Hard, deep kisses that made everything seem normal. Because Death doesn’t have makeout sessions, right? He came up for air, pushing my hair from my face…

Should I say it? Tell him what I was really thinking about him? Could he take this life from me? What little of a life it was. Why was he here, and how had I ended up alone with him again?

And what was that feeling? A prickling up the back of my neck, a sharpness through my mind. That whisper wrapping through my psyche.

Milseachd

I fought it, gritted my teeth against it. “I was just telling Liam how you need to stop being such an ass.” And there it was. Out. A giant matzo ball. Did his left eye just twitch? Oh, he did not look too pleased at all.

“Excuse me?” he stood and I backed up a step before I realized that I was even moving.

But my mouth was on a roll. “You need to stop being an ass. You’re cold and unfeeling and could have handled all of this business with me, I’m sure, in a much better way. There had to have been a better way. It might be some kind of same old everyday bullshit for you, but for me this was monumental. Did you forget that? Has it been so long since it happened to you that you don’t remember? What it was like to lose everything, everyone, that meant anything to you. To be ripped away from it all. Or maybe you were never human. Maybe you were always…this.”

“Why is she different Gideon? Liam asked, concern etched across his face. “She’s so different. There’s something about her, so…”

I saw Liam speaking with Gideon. Could see him through the window and the sheer curtains of Elysium. I could hear them clearly, right through the glass, even though a crow and a seagull were having an unceasing argument over head, making a grand racket.

My attention left the window and focused on the gull that kept swooping down at the crow where he sat staunchly perched on the uppermost branch of a tree.

My gaze fell back to Liam and Gideon inside the coffee house, but I couldn’t hear them anymore.

A massive, blustery wind kicked up suddenly, pushing me away from the now hazy window, and dry fall leaves on the ground came swirling into the air. I could feel them against my back, brushing against my bare shoulders. Where had my coat gone? I’d just had my coat on, now I was just wearing some kind of corseted top. The leaves were making my back itch where they relentlessly struck my skin. I closed my eyes as a bundle of orange, red, and brown blew against my face, pushed them away with my hands.

I heard music, heard laughing. I opened my eyes.

It was my old rooftop, and my party decorations, but I didn’t recognize anyone.There was the couch.There was me. And all the people dressed in beautiful black clothing were pointing at me. This me, not the one on the couch. But this breathing, confused version.

I backed away, bumping into something warm and very solid, large, much larger than a person. I could smell it before I turned. Honey-like, hay, sunshine, dust, musk.

Horse.

I turned and ran my hands down his flank. I marveled at his strength and beauty. A Friesian. A horse of war. He was here for me. He was mine now.I climbed onto him using the arm of the couch to boost myself up to his grand height. He wore no saddle and I could feel his muscles and raw power beneath me, my legs, could sense the urgency in the great animal to leave. He began his trek across the roof, knocking aside the ones that laughed at me. Though their mouths were no longer open in cackling amusement, but in shock and awe, and contempt.This horse, my horse, Eyvindur—that word, his name, whispered through my brain, through me—cantered across the rooftop…

And right over the ledge.

No! My heart jumped and then dropped to my stomach. I twined my hands tightly through his silky mane, squeezing my eyes shut—waiting for the inevitable plunge. We dipped, I felt us plummet…then we lifted, remained aloft, and we were flying.I felt pure joy. Overwhelming elation as we soared over the city, hidden in the night, cool briny ocean air ruffling through my hair.

Until I saw them. The people from the roof. They were behind us. They were pursuing us. I let go of Eyvindur’s mane and let loose my bolts at them. Arrows? Where had those come from? One struck, and I watched as the hideous tracker fell from the sky, spiraling downward. Then they were upon us, my bow was ripped from my hands. The maddened creatures pulled and tore at Eyvindur. They scratched at my legs and pulled feathers from my wings.

My wings?

I screamed. The pain was searing. My back was on fire from the shredding of my wings by their claws. I cried out and twisted from their grasp, fell from Eyvindur’s back, tumbling down through the night sky, as the ocean below rushed up to greet me.


Merely a peek into No Time to Cry, Tome One in The Nine While Nine Legacy.

No Time to Cry is an urban dark fantasy novel, with touches of paranormal romance and chick lit.

Isabelle has life right where she wants it after recovering from heartbreak and deceit. She has the perfect apartment, amazing friends, a flourishing career, and financial security.

But one fateful night, the night of her birthday bash, events take place which alter that life beyond her wildest imaginings…and she is no longer Isabella.

She’s thrust quickly into the most secretive inner-workings of Death itself, as well as an otherworldly dominion of ancient Celtic magic, and beings that we were taught as children were only fictional creations of wildly whimsical minds.

She yearns for the now unmistakable simplicity of her old life; this one is full of dangers, unanswered questions and cryptic dreams. And whispers, haunting whispers in her mind that send shivers through her…but in the most agreeable way.

After one particularly anomalous dream in which she learns of the Nine While Nine Legacy, things get truly precarious.

“Nine Will Rise, Nine Will Fall, The Old Shall Replace the New, The New Shall Be the Old"

Now someone sees her as a risk …and wants to eliminate her.

But she falls under the protection of her guardian—unless she leaves his territory—which is the one thing wants the most…and wants the least.

I'm not telling you much more about the book, because the way the book is written is meant to be a journey of discovery and surprises. 

Periodically I will be posting excerpts from the chapters on the blog at my website, but not too much! I don't want to spoil the story!  

Nine While Nine is a compression of the decree asserting the ancient edict that at the apposite time the Choir of Nine that usurped the Nine Realms of Na Daoine Maithe would fall and the original nine would take their rightful place.

The word “while” in this case holds a double meaning. In old high German it is time, though the spelling is weil. In the ancient unwritten language of Na Daoine Maithe, it is as close of a phonetic spelling as can be ascertained, and means eradicate. Nine is also the number of judgement and finality…completeness. 

Nine will rise and Nine will fall,,,,

A war is coming, a new world order, but nothing like what was to be expected!

For more about the story, character bios, my blog, and much much more, go to: www.stasiamorineaux.wix.com/stasia-morineaux


I'm raising money for the production of my book. The funds raised will be going towards cover design, editorial assessment, promotional materials, and a marketing plan, as well as printing.

This novel has to be submitted for editing and art work, as well as for the creation of all promotional items, in just 3 months…so that it can all be ready for the debut in New Orleans this Halloween at the Undead Con!

Any funds raised that go over the goal will go towards further promotions and the publication of Book Two!

My name is Stasia Morineaux.  

I grew up in Southern California, pursuing faeries in the garden, hunting down things that went bump in the night, and seeking spirits in the local graveyard.

After “growing up”, I still do all of that!

I love roaming the rain drenched streets of New Orleans, creating costumes, and playing Just Dance with my family...because that's just silly!

A few years ago I resettled in not-too-far-north-of-Charlotte, North Carolina with my hubby, daughter, and our bevy of creatures…both real and “imaginary”.

Mysterious dreams, copious hours of awesome music, and obscene amounts of coffee fuel my lengthy writing sessions, which consists mostly of paranormal romance, chick lit, urban fantasy, and dark fantasy.

In my spare time I like to relax on my balcony, feet kicked up, listening to the squirrels arguing with the crows in the trees.

For the past 4 years, I've been writing, plotting, and scheming my first novel to be released, No Time to Cry, and the world in which those characters live.

Not just because the voices of my characters are constantly screaming at me to do so!

But also because, books are an excellent way to escape our everyday lives which can sometimes become humdrum in sameness. Or maybe you had a bad day, or maybe you just want to go somewhere that you can’t get to in real life. Books can do that. I love writing truly fantastical stories full of details, so there is an opportunity for an even deeper diversion.

It started for me in high school; I wasn’t part of the “in” crowd. I was quiet, bookish, a wee introverted. So generally at breaks and lunch I could be found in the quad with a good book. My summers tended to be on the lonely side, with friends going on family vacations and such, so I’d spend hours digging through the boxes in our garage plundering the many cartons of written treasures which my Mom had stored away there. Summers were spent by the pool reading, and it didn’t feel quite so lonely; I learned how to let my mind wander and explore all kinds of eccentric worlds and possibilities.

I started creating stories at that time, they never went far at that age, but over the years of gaining experiences, and encountering a wide array of emotions and life scenarios, by my 30’s I was quite primed to get going. I wanted to create something that could let people feel the way that I felt when reading a book. Whether it was connecting to an empowered character, or just losing myself in a faraway land, it always healed any emotional wounds or exhaustion I may have endured that day.

I want to give that to others…exciting adventures, a safe place to escape that maybe, just maybe might bring them moments of joy, or laughter, or thrills.


So why am I launching an Indiegogo campaign for this project rather than the traditional publishing route?

Because as an independent creator I want this story to reach an audience. I don’t want it to bounce around the U.S. postal service or lay around a publishing company’s slush pile for what could turn into years.

I also want it to remain true to my vision.Other than fixing some possible typos and grammatical inaccuracies I really don’t want the feel of my story to be altered in any way.

The publishing world has changed in dramatic ways over the past few years. The old model isn't working terribly well for most authors of the new variety; I believe it's time to explore other avenues for getting our work into the world.

No Time to Cry, book one in The Nine While Nine Legacy is nearly done. With the right marketing plan, it and the rest of the Saga are destined for great things. (and I can keep writing!)

Your help. Quite simply, I need your help and generosity to make this happen.

You won't leave empty handed, you're gonna get some pretty cool rewards!

Even better, is having old friends, and new found friends, joining me on this adventure of a lifetime; The rare opportunity to create something that has the ability to withstand time, to grow into something huge, something that can inspire, intrigue and perhaps enhance lives!

So, please, come join me! You'll be thanked with truly heartfelt gratitude and your name in my books as a supporter and friend on a very special page at the front.

So now's that time! Feel like being generous towards a good cause and a great book? Like being remembered as a believer. and backer before something went big? Then donate now! And may you be showered with good Karma!

Much heart and many thanks,

Stasia

  • Cover art and design
  • Editing
  • Copyright
  • Promotional text creation
  • Promotional/Marketing goods (posters, bookmarks, postcards, etc)
  • Paperback printing
  • Hardcover printing
  • eBook formatting

Any funds that I receive which go over the goal will be put towards promotional touring at writing/comic/horror conventions.

PRODUCTION:
All trade paperback books will be produced and printed by Createspace. All trade hardcover books will be printed via Lulu.com, both are extremely reputable printing sources!
~ Once all editing is completed, I'm estimating around 4 weeks for printing and delivery to me...it's been stated as much less, but I'm leaving room for error.
~ The delivery of the book, on my end, to supporters will take several days as I will need time to pull the rewards together, and then it's up to 1 1/2 weeks for delivery of all goods.
~ I'll also need to consider time for the other rewards to be created and sent to me, I'm allotting approximately 4 weeks for those to be completed and returned to me.
~ I do want all rewards to reach the benefactors prior to my book release in New Orleans, Halloween weekend!
~ In short, once funded, we will work diligently to have No Time to Cry in your hands by mid- October, and all the goodies that come with it! **Of course, such perks as the novella co-writing, and naming of character in Tome Two, will happen at a later date.

Please---share my campaign with friends you think might be into it. Put it on your Facebook page. Send out one of those awful "My friend is doing this cool thing!" emails. You'll get karma points. And if we meet in person, a hug. Possibly cookies!

Risks and Challenges:

I don't really foresee any risks or challenges with this project. The first book is complete, aside from editing. The remainder of the story is roughly plotted out and continues to grow everyday within my head, and I'm already well into writing the second book. I have a solid marketing and promotions plan, that if all goes well, will have me traveling coast to coast for select conventions. I'll be tackling promoting the heck out of this on nearly a full time basis, when I'm not writing.

I've been invited to sit on an author's panel at the ARVLFC UndeadCon.

This is a really big deal to me, and a great honor, as I've been a fan of Anne Rice since I was a teenager, and a member of the ARVLFC since 1990!

So, come this October, I'll be traveling to one of my most revered cities...for fun, adventure, and the debut of my first novel, No Time to Cry ~ Tome One in The Nine While Nine Legacy!

To learn more about No Time to Cry and The Nine While Nine Legacy, head over to my Books page and read up on it!

And if you have the opportunity, come to New Orleans and visit with me. I'll be signing copies, as long as they last, and passing out fun swag!

ascertained, and means eradicate.
Nine is also the number of judgement and finality…completeness. Nine will rise and Nine will fall,,,,A war is coming, a new world order, but nothing like what was to be expected!
For
more about the story, character bios, my blog, and much much more, go to: www.stasiamorineaux.wix.com/stasia-morineauxI'm
raising money for the production of my book. The funds raised will be going
towards cover design, editorial assessment, promotional materials, and a
marketing plan, as well as printing.
This novel has to be submitted for
editing and art work, as well as for the creation of all promotional items, in
just 3 months…so that it can all be ready for the debut in New Orleans this
Halloween at the Undead Con! 
Any funds raised that go over the
goal will go towards further promotions and the publication of Book Two!My name is Stasia Morineaux.  
I grew up in Southern California, pursuing
faeries in the garden, hunting down things that went bump in the night, and seeking
spirits in the local graveyard.
After “growing up”, I still do all
of that!
I love roaming the rain drenched
streets of New Orleans, creating costumes, and playing Just
Dance with my family...because that's just silly!
A few years ago I resettled in not-too-far-north-of-Charlotte, North Carolina
with my hubby, daughter, and our bevy of creatures…both real and “imaginary”.
Mysterious dreams, copious hours of awesome music, and obscene amounts of
coffee fuel my lengthy writing sessions, which consists mostly of paranormal
romance, chick lit, urban fantasy, and dark fantasy.
In my spare time I like to relax on my balcony, feet kicked up, listening to
the squirrels arguing with the crows in the trees.
For the past 4 years, I've been
writing, plotting, and scheming my first novel to be released, No
Time to Cry, and the world in which those characters live.
Not just because the voices of my characters are
constantly screaming at me to do so!
But also because,
books are an excellent way to escape our everyday lives which can sometimes become
humdrum in sameness. Or maybe you had a bad day, or maybe you just want to go
somewhere that you can’t get to in real life. Books can do that. I love writing
truly fantastical stories full of details, so there is an opportunity for an
even deeper diversion. 
It started for me in high school; I wasn’t part of the “in”
crowd. I was quiet, bookish, a wee introverted. So generally at breaks and
lunch I could be found in the quad with a good book. My summers tended to be on
the lonely side, with friends going on family vacations and such, so I’d spend
hours digging through the boxes in our garage plundering the many cartons of
written treasures which my Mom had stored away there. Summers were spent by the
pool reading, and it didn’t feel quite so lonely; I learned how to let my mind
wander and explore all kinds of eccentric worlds and possibilities.
I started creating stories at that time, they never went
far at that age, but over the years of gaining experiences, and encountering a
wide array of emotions and life scenarios, by my 30’s I was quite primed to get
going. I wanted to create something that could let people feel the way that I
felt when reading a book. Whether it was connecting to an empowered character,
or just losing myself in a faraway land, it always healed any emotional wounds
or exhaustion I may have endured that day.
I want to give that to others…exciting adventures, a
safe place to escape that maybe, just maybe might bring them moments of joy, or
laughter, or thrills.
So why am I launching an Indiegogo campaign for this project rather than the traditional publishing route?
Because as an independent creator I
want this story to reach an audience. I don’t want it to bounce around the U.S.
postal service or lay around a publishing company’s slush pile for what could
turn into years. 
I also want it to remain true to my
vision.Other than fixing some possible
typos and grammatical inaccuracies I really don’t want the feel of my story to
be altered in any way. 
The publishing world has changed in
dramatic ways over the past few years. The old model isn't working terribly
well for most authors of the new variety; I believe it's time to explore other
avenues for getting our work into the world.
No Time to Cry, book one in The Nine While Nine Legacy is nearly done.
With the right marketing plan, it and the rest of the Saga are destined for
great things. (and I can keep writing!)Your help. Quite simply, I need your help and generosity to make this happen.You won't leave empty handed, you're gonna get some pretty cool rewards! Even
 better, is having old friends, and new found friends, joining me on 
this adventure of a lifetime; The rare opportunity to create something 
that has the ability to withstand time, to grow into something huge, 
something that can inspire, intrigue and perhaps enhance lives! So,
 please, come join me! You'll be thanked with truly heartfelt gratitude 
and your name in my books as a supporter and friend on a very special 
page at the front.

So now's
that time! Feel like being generous towards a good cause and a great book? Like
being remembered as a believer. and backer before something went big? Then donate
now! And may you be showered with good Karma!
Much
heart and many thanks, 
Stasia

Cover art and design
Editing
Copyright
Promotional text creation
Promotional/Marketing goods (posters, bookmarks, postcards, etc)
Paperback printing

Hardcover printing

eBook formatting
Any funds that I receive which go over the goal will be put towards promotional touring at writing/comic/horror conventions.PRODUCTION: All trade paperback books will be produced and printed 
by Createspace. All trade hardcover books will be printed via Lulu.com, 
both are extremely reputable printing sources!~ Once all editing is 
completed, I'm estimating around 4 weeks for printing and delivery to 
me...it's been stated as much less, but I'm leaving room for error.~
 The delivery of the book, on my end, to supporters will take several 
days as I will need time to pull the rewards together, and then it's up 
to 1 1/2 weeks for delivery of all goods.~ I'll also need to 
consider time for the other rewards to be created and sent to me, I'm 
allotting approximately 4 weeks for those to be completed and returned 
to me.~ I do want all rewards to reach the benefactors prior to my book release in New Orleans, Halloween weekend!~
 In short, once funded, we will work diligently to have No Time to Cry 
in your hands by mid- October, and all the goodies that come with it! 
**Of course, such perks as the novella co-writing, and naming of 
character in Tome Two, will happen at a later date.
Please---share my campaign with
friends you think might be into it. Put it on your Facebook page. Send out one
of those awful "My friend is doing this cool thing!" emails. You'll
get karma points. And if we meet in person, a hug. Possibly cookies!Risks and Challenges:I
 don't really foresee any risks or challenges with this project. The 
first book is complete, aside from editing. The remainder of the story 
is roughly plotted out and continues to grow everyday within my head, 
and I'm already well into writing the second book. I have a solid 
marketing and promotions plan, that if all goes well, will have me 
traveling coast to coast for select conventions. I'll be tackling 
promoting the heck out of this on nearly a full time basis, when I'm not
 writing.I've been invited to sit on an author's panel at the ARVLFC UndeadCon. 
This
 is a really big deal to me, and a great honor, as I've been a fan of 
Anne Rice since I was a teenager, and a member of the ARVLFC since 1990!
 
So,
 come this October, I'll be traveling to one of my most revered 
cities...for fun, adventure, and the debut of my first novel, No Time to Cry ~ Tome One in The Nine While Nine Legacy!
To learn more about No Time to Cry and The Nine While Nine Legacy, head over to my Books page and read up on it!
And if you have the opportunity, come to New Orleans and visit with me. I'll be signing copies, as long as they last, and passing out fun swag!

story:
MY STORY

My name is Luis Felipe Passalacqua, former Medical Illustrator, karate instructor, dancer, horseback rider, arts professor, speaker, writer and Puerto Rico’s first and only Blind Sculptor. I was not born blind; therefore all of my life experiences have given me great understanding in the development of these projects. After working on this bio-fiction for about a year and finally publishing it in Spanish last September, I’m very excited to announce our plans to translate and publish my book in ENGLISH!!! 


Based on my life, the story captures the essence of some extreme and compelling experiences that evoke a life full of contrasts, which will certainly confront your most intimate perceptions. I've dissected the memories of my childhood and entire adult life in order to reveal some provoking, transformative occurrences. It incites the radical, the obscure and mysterious in all of us. We are confronted by an oppressive inequality that demands evolution. It is a path of understanding the dissolution of our perceptions and realities, our freedom. It comes from the core. Arts, science, and belief structures converge in this profound search for independence. 


Your sponsorship is all I need to bring this beautiful                  and influential book to others.


NEEDS  

I’m thrilled to be collaborating once again with Author-House to bring this book to you. Because of its significance and our efforts to bring this project to life, I’m asking for your commitment to help cover the cost of editing and publishing to make this happen. 


  • If the goal of $5000 is achieved, the remainder of $394 will be used for marketing purposes.


OFFERINGS 

  • Unique Limited Edition 24" Sculpture! Created by the author just for this project. Includes certificate of authenticity. See details under Perks.
  • Unique Limited Edition 18" Sculptures! Created by the author just for this project. Includes certificate of authenticity. See details under Perks.
  • Unique Limited Edition 8" Sculptures! Created by the author just for this project. Includes certificate of authenticity. See details under Perks.
  • Unique baseball caps. See details under Perks. 
  • Free E-books and bookmarks.  See details under Perks.

IMPACT

Our hopes are that "he" (English) and "él" (Spanish) , motivate the reader towards self examination as an individual and as part of society, creating awareness of the ignorance, the prejudice and the obstacles that a person faces when segregated, or belongs to a minority. It is our intention to condemn the consequences of such ideas and attitudes that may cause difficulties for some in the rehabilitation, the access to equal opportunities, and the total participation of all that the society to which he belongs, has to offer.

AT WORK!


THE AUTHOR

Luis Felipe Passalacqua, Puerto Rico’s first and only blind sculptor was born in Santurce and grew up in his family’s country house in Guaynabo. He studied at the Sacred Heart University, receiving a Baccalaureate in Sciences, concentration in Pre-Med, and a Post Baccalaureate degree in Medical Illustration from Ohio State University, in 1990. That same year he founded his own illustration company, Worldwide Biomedic Images. In 1995, he loses his eyesight due to meningitis, returning to Puerto Rico in 1996. After the physical crisis, he starts his long journey of exploration of a new world in darkness, facing ignorance, fear and discrimination. 

QUESTIONS & ANSWERS VIDEO



After making the decision to continue as an artist, he studies sculpture at the San Juan’s Art League and later at the Plastic Arts School, also in San Juan. In 2001 He begins a professional career as a sculptor, motivational speaker, arts professor and museum accessibility consultant. Luis Felipe has offered multiple individual and collective exhibitions in and outside of Puerto Rico, represented the island in two international festivals, have been interviewed for various magazines, newspapers, including the Washington Post, radio and television programs and has been awarded different recognition throughout his lifetime. 

PUBLISHED IN SPANISH-September 2014 

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We are striving to start contributions at any amount but there are other ways you can help if you can't afford to sponsor our projects  at this time. We understand.

Help us get the word out and tell your friends & family about our campaign.

  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools, all the social media you are familiar with and of course - word of mouth!!!

 THANK YOU FOR SPONSORING AND HELPING US ACHIEVE OUR GOAL!!!

story:
Howdy, 


Fifty years ago on July 21, Dr. Mary Sherman was murdered. The day the Warren Commission came to New Orleans to talk to witnesses, Dr. Sherman's murder was the headline of the day's paper. She had been involved in a secret medical project in New Orleans that had included Lee Harvey Oswald. The secret project was weaponizing cancer to be used to kill Castro. It is a long and very suppressed story. Part of that suppression was the murder of Dr. Mary Sherman. The rumor spread around was that her murder was some lesbian sex slaying. We beg to differ and are going to show Dr. Mary some love and respect with a faux funeral for her this July 21, 2014. We will have a memorial "second line" service. A jazz band will play in front of the apartment building where she was murdered from 10-11 am on July 21, 2014. 

We are also releasing a new updated edition of the book, Dr. Mary's Monkey: How the Unsolved Murder of a Doctor, a Secret Laboratory in New Orleans and Cancer-Causing Monkey Viruses Are Linked to Lee Harvey Oswald, the JFK Assassination and Emerging Global Epidemics. This book tells the whole amazing story, written by Edward T. Haslam, whose father worked with Dr. Sherman.

Please help us with the expense of the permit and jazz band. 


Thank-you, 


Kris Millegan

Publisher

TrineDay

story:
Why You Should Help

In the United States alone, there are over 100 million people with chronic pain; across the globe there are even more. Perhaps you or someone you know is suffering. I have written “Peace with Pain: Your Guide to Joyful and Productive Life in a Malfunctioning Body” to help all those who live with pain.

I have taught meditation for 20 years, and for more than half that time I have also lived with chronic, disabling pain. It is possible to build a joyful and productive life with the body you currently have. With bite-sized chapters and simple Take Action tasks, anyone can find their way to Peace.

To make this book available to all those who will benefit, I need your support today. Please select one of the gifts, or choose your own donation level. If you cannot give financially at this time, please share this website with everyone you know.

Thank you for helping to release Peace with Pain.

What's Needed & What You Get

  • Your donation will go towards the costs of producing and advertising the book. I've taken a leap of faith and have already hired a book designer who is currently formatting the manuscript and creating the cover art. The release date is not yet set, but we are planning for the 2014 Winter Solstice.
  • By donating through this campaign, you have the opportunity to receive cool gifts, like Peace with Pain bookmarks, signed copies of Peace with Pain and my first book, Worlds of Power, Worlds of Light, and a MP3 of my first to be released talk, "You Can Overcome Stress" as well as meditation tools like a statue of Ganesha (The Lord of Success who overcomes all obstacles) and a thangka of Manjushri (the Boddhisattva of Wisdom) from my own collection.
  • All funds collected will go towards the release of Peace with Pain and getting it into the hands of the people who need it most.
  • Everyone who donates will be emailed a copy of the Sri Yantra meditation tool that my teacher, Rama, gave to his students.

The Impact

Your contribution will help others know about "Peace with Pain" so they can find what they need to live a happy life despite the pain of the body. Although this book is written specifically for people with chronic pain, the tools within it can be used by anyone who is suffering. 

With the explosion of the internet, we have instant access to an overwhelming amount of information. Making excellent books like "Peace with Pain" stand out is a matter of financial resources. Every dollar collected will help more people know there is a way out of the suffering caused by chronic pain.

About Jenna Sundell

Jenna Sundell co-founded Dharma Center in San Diego in 1998, where she and other teachers offer their time as volunteers, teaching meditation and running the meditation hall. She shared the story of meeting her teacher through her first book, "Worlds of Power, Worlds of Light," which is also contains the essential teachings of her Path. To connect with people across the globe, she maintains a blog, www.jennasundell.com and posts on Facebook and Twitter.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help me get the word out -- this is a very short campaign, so time is of the essence. Every post about this project on social media will help build attention. Thank you for pitching in!
  • Please also use the Indiegogo share tools to help this campaign rise to the top of Indiegogo's main page.


If you prefer to donate by check, it can be mailed to: 

Jenna Sundell
PO Box # 1161
Spring Valley, CA 91979-1161

Thank YOU!

story:
Short Summary

After two years of publishing Canada’s freshest literary magazine as a free online edition located at http://dragnetmag.net, we’ve decided to answer the clamouring of our fans and produce a print version. The anthology will feature our favourite pieces from the first two years and eight issues of the magazine. As well as fiction and poetry, it will also feature black and white line drawings on the inside by one of the artists featured in a past issue of Dragnet (to be decided), and a cover by another featured artist. It will be a trade paperback, measuring 6 x 9 inches, and will be 128 pages in length, which gives us room to provide you with lots of Dragnet content!

What We Need & What You Get

Pre-order the Dragnet anthology at a discount to help us print it! We need $1190 up front to print 300 copies of the anthology with a local family-run printing company. You can pre-order the book for $15, $20, or $30 depending on where you are located. Please scroll down in the "perks" section on the right to select any of the anthology pre-order options. The “perks” section also lists other incentives for donating more or less than the cost of a book.

If we make more than the target, the money will go towards our other expenses, which we struggle to pay solely through donations at our launch parties: paying contributors, purchasing marketing materials, paying website costs, throwing events to bring creative communities together—and saving up to produce a print anthology of years three and four! Everyone on the Dragnet team is a volunteer, and all of our income goes toward costs.

The Impact

You get a lovely book to read wherever you want, even if you have no internet connection or way to charge your cell phone or e-reader, we get the chance to produce something we’re really proud of, and our contributors get the wider exposure they deserve.

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out all of the past issues of Dragnet at http://dragnetmag.net and tell your friends about both Dragnet and this initiative! Share this page using the built-in sharing tools. If you are a writer you can also submit to Dragnet through the submit link on the website. We have rolling submissions, so we will get back to you approximately three months before the release of the issue for which you are being considered.

story:
About Me

My name is Susan Wilson and I'm currently serving as Georgetown University's Entrepreneur in Residence.  I’m a 41 year old wife, mother and FORTUNE Top Ten Entrepreneur and I’m frustrated women aren't discussing the personal realities that go with professional success.

By examining the demographics, personal choices and realities of Forbes and FORTUNE Top Ranked women, I hope to paint a more realistic and holistic picture of what success looks like for women today.  And ideally, I hope to uncover trends and insights we can all learn from and appreciate.

Background

Just as males are hardwired to be competitive hunters, females are communal gatherers.  Our complementary genetics are how and why the human species has actually survived - which is an important point to remember btw.  

So a woman's natural preference to collaborate and communicate is actually a gender trait not a choice (or character flaw).  And before this becomes an all or nothing distracting debate, I'll readily admit this isn't true for every female.  So let's continue.  As a direct result of our genetic hard-wiring, females see ourselves in relation to others.  Whether we're babies, girls, teens or women, our personal happiness is directly (and naturally) based on how we see ourselves in relation (and compared) to others - primarily other women.

The Project

I want to create a collection of simple, easy-to-understand infographics about the REAL lives of top-ranked women to shed some light on the personal choices and tradeoffs that come with professional success.  The end product will be a printed guide or manual and a poster that tells a visual story of what the data reveals.

I plan to dig into the personal details of top-ranked professional women so we can understand what works as well as interesting patterns or trends hidden within the data.  This isn't about stereotyping, judging or throwing stones.  It's simply about aggregating data (i.e., the facts) to get to the truth.   For example:

·        Why are some women so successful? Are they smarter? Do they work harder?

·        How important is WHO you know? Is it exponential compared to WHAT you know?

·        How does each woman lead?  Manage?  Mentor?  Do age, status or location matter?

·        Is it possible to be happy AND successful at home AND work?  If so, for how long?

·        Do kids hinder or help a woman succeed?  Babies?  Teens?  What about pets?

·        Does it matter if you come from money?  Do nannies & housekeepers play a role?

The Details

This information has been readily available and in the public domain for years.  It simply hasn’t been aggregated & analyzed in this manner for this purpose.  With your help, I'll take a deep data dive into popular annual lists of successful women including:

·        Forbes The World’s 100 Most Powerful Women for 2011

·        2011 FORTUNE Most Powerful Women Summit

·        Forbes 2011 Highest Paid Female Athletes

·        12 of FORTUNE 500 companies run by women 

The research and data will come from public sources including the U.S. Census, voter records, political donors, court records, marriage, divorce, birth & death records along with facebook, twitter, and LinkedIn.  

Proceeds will be used to fund dedicated research, drafting text and visuals to create infographics (along with revisions), finalizing, printing and distributing the the end-products which includes color infograpics and guides (PDFs and printed), t-shirts, and posters - which I anticipate will take 3-4 months to complete.


Disclaimer

This is not about stereotyping or judging so please don’t misunderstand my purpose.  I'm digging into details to establish a truthful baseline we can all measure ourselves against.  The media today feeds us ½ the story with one-dimensional pictures of successful women (who look fairly good).  But today's technology &  transparency make it impossible to distinguish a person's professional persona from their personal life.  We simply are who we are - personally and professionally.  This isn't news but it is important to understand.

Personal lives were once taboo but the Internet, facebook & twitter have forever changed the world.  Professional personas permeate the media and inundate our personal lives.  Isn’t it time we understood the truth?  It’s out there.  Some people know about it.  It’s just that nobody’s taken the time to aggregate the data to see what it shows.  That’s what I intend to do.

The Role You Can Play in this Groundbreaking & Practical Project

The easiest thing you can do is to simply show your support.  Give $5 or $500.  Or just spread the word on twitter or facebook.  This is about the power of the crowd!  And to prove that, I'm going to share my initial findings with key contributors and open it up to the crowd as we discuss obvious and potential trends as well as interesting anomalies.

We ALL have women in our lives.  Isn’t this a practical project that easily improves your life?  Tell ur friends.  Contribute now.  Let’s see how fast humanity benefits!

story:
WHO AM I? Your average aspiring writer who dreams of using my own fiction writing as a ministry to encourage, inspire and entertain others! As a Christian, I do not want this God-given talent to go to waste.

WHAT IS NEEDED? Your support to e-publish my novel, Faith Wash Over Me. It is a work of fiction I hope will move people to a closer relationship with God. But I cannot do this without money. Any support will help me accomplish this life-changing, self-serving goal!

HOW MUCH IS NEEDED? Approximately $1000. This will include the price of editing (at a discount price from a professional friend) and the cost of e-book publishing (on average $400 - $600). 
 
WHAT DO YOU GET FOR SUPPORTING ME? I will offer up my writing or tutoring services to you or someone you know at a value of $30 per hour. If you don't need tutoring services, I will give you a free download copy of the work. I may even plan to have a blow-out party bash where I can thank my contributors personally! I would love to give you more, such as cash, but then if I had it, I wouldn't need to fundraise for it!
 
ULTIMATE IMPACT? People struggling with faith or questioning God will find encouragement. Others will be ministered to. I will have the chance to hear God say, as far as my talents, "Well done, good and faithful servant."

IF YOU CAN'T HELP WITH CASH? Any support, even your prayers, or just telling others about my goal, is just as powerful!

Short Summary

Hello friends, family, and poetry lovers! I am Ashley Catharine and I am looking for support in publishing my first collection of poems, "The Year of the Mermaid".

All funds raised here will not only go towards self-publishing this amazing book project, but will be contributing to a future BOOK TOUR I am planning for the fall of 2013!

If you want me in your city, donate! I want to come share poems with you! 

What We Need & What You Get

I have set the goal for $1500 which will go mostly to publishing the book. 

Any money left over from the project will be put directly into my gas tank so I can get out and share my poetry with the country. 

The Impact

You could help support art and foster community, as well as helping me realize a dream I have always wanted to accomplish. You can share in my stories, and help me create new ones.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute financially doesn't mean you can't help! Share this campaign, tweet about it, tumble it, facebook, blog, whatever! Want to help me get to your city? Email me at Ashley@thatstarvingartist.com

story:
We are writing a book about the practice, theory, and principles of Forest Farming based on our years of research and successful real-world examples.

Help support our work to document and connect forest farmers and to promote the promise of farming the woods.
 

About Us

 We are an agroforestry professor & researcher (Ken Mudge) and an extension educator and forest farmer (Steve Gabriel). We have been researching and educating students, farmers, and landowners on these systems for the past several decades.

We are excited about Forest Farming. So excited, in fact, that we are writing a book about it through Chelsea Green Publishing with an expected release of Spring 2014. 

 

 What is Forest Farming? 

Forest Farming is an agroforestry practice of growing non-timber crops under the canopy of an existing forest. The practice is both old and new, as historically many traditional cultures around the world have gained their sustenance through forest-based ecosystems.

Forest farming is different from forest gardening, which according to Dave Jacke is "gardening like the forest." In other words, forest gardening seeks to mimic the ways forests work in building a garden in an open space. Forest farming, on the other hand, is "farming IN the woods," using the existing canopy as the context for production.

In the temperate United States, agroforestry currently represents a small fraction of agriculture. That interest is rapidly growing as people look for more sustainable methods of farming.  Forest farming offers woodlot owners the opportunity to grow a wide variety of unique and high-value fruits, nuts, mushrooms, medicinal plants, and more.

The income generation potential is very high for some crops (shiitake mushrooms and ginseng, for example), while others are more useful on a home scale. Landowners can make more of their property productive, and may enjoy tax breaks associated with farming the woods.  

While Forest Farming provides yields to humans, the practice also encourages sound forest management benefitting the larger ecosystem. Forests maintain soil, clean water and air, and provide critical habitat for a wide array of species. Forest Farming provides a wonderful opportunity to mix production and conversation for the benefit of all.  

 Because forests can be more resilient than field crop systems in the face of temperature swings, fluctuations in precipitation, and large storm events, Forest Farms are poised to be critical to our future with the rapid onset of climate change.   

 

About the Book 

The book is the first of its kind. It is a resource for temperate climate forest farming that discusses context, techniques, and design considerations. The book will enable readers to begin farming their woods for hobby or profit.  

Early chapters discuss the history and traditions of Forest Farming including detailed profiles of medicinal, food, ornamental, and tree crops that can be grown in temperate woodlots. The latter chapters include a pattern language, design strategies, and marketing tips to help ensure success.   

You can read more about us, and see a table of contents and excerpts and us by visiting: FarmingTheWoods.com


Connect With Us

A big motivation for writing this book is to encourage dialogue and a greater expansion of forest farming in temperate regions. To this end, we are committed to collecting, telling, and facilitating the stories of established forest farmers and to connect them with new forest farmers. We will do this through three means:

1. Survey: Are you Forest Farming? Visit our website (http://FarmingtheWoods.com) for our survey of existing forest farmers. Help us document the stories and experiences of your work. The information will be entered into a database and presented as a free online directory and map.

2. Blog: Our blog at FarmingtheWoods.com will feature stories of the farms and people we visit.

3. Forest Farming Listserv: The Forest Farming Growers listerv helps practitioners new and old share advice, stories, and resources with each other. Sign up for this free email list at FarmingtheWoods.com.
 

What We Need

 We want to visit and document many real world examples of Forest Farming in the Eastern and Midwestern US. We will interview forest farmers, document their sites, and write up case studies. Much of this information will be presented in the book, but also available as a free online map and database resource at FarmingtheWoods.com.

These free tools will to foster connection and collaboration among all who are learning to farm the woods.   Your generous contribution helps us with travel and research of case studies. The face-to-face interviews and onsite examination of forest farmers and their land will provide crucial information and learned wisdom for the book and our website.

Your gift also pays for the development of the free online database and map. The book will be for sale, but the database will be a free public resource online, available to anyone interested in farming the woods.   

 

What You Get

 We deeply appreciate your support. Your donation will help encourage sustainable woodland use and a thank you perk from us. (see sidebar, right)  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Help to spread the word about this campaign. Like us on Facebook, and share with your friends. If you know forest farmers we should profile, please visit FarmingtheWoods.com and let us know.

story:
Project Summary

"Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World" is an ebook written by bilingual scholar, writer and publisher of Chinese ebooks, Christine Yunn-Yu Sun, from Melbourne, Australia. In June 2012, Christine launched eBook Dynasty (www.ebookdynasty.net) to help English-language authors translate, publish and promote their writings as ebooks to the Chinese world. Her goal is to help the best literary voices reach across all English/Chinese linguistic and cultural barriers.

Originally from Taiwan, Christine has a B.A. in Chinese Language and Literature from National Taiwan University, a M.A. in Journalism from The Ohio State University, and a Ph.D. in Languages, Cultures and Linguistics from Australia's Monash University. Since February 2011, she has helped more than 20 English-language authors from Australia, New Zealand, United States, United Kingdom, Holland and Kazakhstan enter the Chinese market. Now she wants to show other self-publishing authors how to gain a Chinese voice and make themselves known in the Chinese world.

In "Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World", Christine analyses the present and future development of the Chinese (digital) publishing industry and explores what Chinese readers want. She also explains vital and practical issues such as how to find Chinese agents and publishers, how to sign contracts and negotiate royalties, how to choose translators (who also act as editors and proofreaders), and how to build author platforms.

With that said, Christine's book can also benefit those traditionally published authors who desire to better understand -- and become more involved in -- the process in which their books are promoted in the Chinese world. One of the major issues explored in this book is translation, which plays a crucial role in the whole process of creating a successful entry to that market. This insight benefits all authors, no matter what publishing avenue they choose.

Contributions from you will help Christine complete this book and publish it as a valuable resource to all English-language authors. Imagine that by 2015, when the number of Chinese people across the globe is expected to reach 1.5 billion, all of them can become your potential readers. Imagine your writing can benefit their political and economic progress, enhance their social, cultural, scientific and technological growth, enrich and inspire their lives, and, most importantly, encourage them to better appreciate your own world. "Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World" can help you achieve this goal.

 

Use of Funding

Approximately 60% of the requested funding of US$3000, i.e. US$1800, will be used as follows:

  • Surveying the translation and promotion of English-language authors to the Chinese world throughout the past two decades and their performances in that market.
  • Interviewing prominent agents and publishers in the Chinese world, in order to analyse their progress in the promotion of English-language authors to that market.
  • Interviewing those English-language authors, agents and publishers who have already gained entry to the Chinese world, in order to find out their views of this market.
  • Interviewing those English-language authors who desire an entry to the Chinese world, in order to find out their expectations for and (mis)understanding of this market.
  • Sourcing a professional cover design.

The remaining 40% of the requested funding, i.e. US$1200, will be used on the resources required to complete the writing of this book. These include Internet connection fees, web hosting fees, expenses on computer hardware, software and other peripheries, and utilities.

To express her gratitude for your support, Christine will send a personal Thank-You letter to every one who gives a hand. Specifically, a copy of "Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World" ebook will be presented to all those who are willing to fund US$25 or more. For those willing to provide more support, Christine will be happy to further provide:

  • 10% discount to anyone who is willing to fund US$50 and wants to promote their English-language writing as a Chinese ebook;
  • 20% discount to anyone who is willing to fund US$100 and wants to promote their English-language writing as a Chinese ebook;
  • 30% discount to anyone who is willing to find US$200 and wants to promote their English-language writing as a Chinese ebook;
  • Free of charge to anyone who is willing to fund US$300 and wants to promote their English-language writing as a Chinese ebook.

If Christine cannot reach her goal of raising US$3000, then she will still strive to complete "Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World" as an ebook. With whatever support Christine may receive, she will strive to reach this goal. Because it is definitely a goal worth pursuing -- not only for her own desire to give back to the society, but also for all the English-language authors who desire an entry to the Chinese world.

 

The Impact

The completion of  "Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World" as an ebook is a valuable project to Christine, because she has long desired to help English-language authors to gain access to the Chinese world. She has seen a great number of English-language books buried deep in the databases of prominent Chinese agents and publishers. These books will hardly ever get to be known by Chinese readers because they are not deemed "bestsellers". Despite the months and even years of efforts by authors to have written these books, they are unlikely to be published in the Chinese world.

But the emerging success of digital-publishing and self-publishing is changing all this. Today's authors no longer need to rely on agents and publishers to have their books published, and this is the same with those who desire to promote their writings to the Chinese world. The missing link for those self-publishing authors is what this ebook aims to provide. With careful planning, hard work, open and direct communication as well as honest and meaningful collaboration, we can turn publishing into a win-win situation between English-language authors and their Chinese readers. We are talking about a market in which readers are keen to freely read, understand, express and communicate. They are keen to feel the pulse of the world.

So this is a project also valuable to the world's English-language authors who are keen to understand their Chinese peers. A good story can be universal, as long as we let it be read in different languages. Your literary voice can be heard in the Chinese world as long as you make it loud and clear.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For the completion of "Reaching for 1.5 Billion Chinese Readers: A Guide to Self-Publishing in the Chinese World" as an ebook, you can help by sending a word of encouragement to Christine at her blog "Voices under the Sun" (http://christinesunflower.com/). You can tell her what you, as an English-language author, agent, publisher and/or reader, would like to know via this valuable ebook. You can also help by spreading the word and "make some noise" about Christine's campaign.

Finally, Christine would like to thank you for reading this campaign introduction. She looks forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,

Christine Yunn-Yu Sun, Melbourne, Australia.
