THE PROJECT
Over The Moon will be an e-book of outlandish stories--a synthesis of science fiction, humor, and social satire, showcasing a collection of subversive ideas and characters set in the near future when artificial intelligence, virtual reality, data mining, and nanotechnology have become a predominant part of human life. Many of the characters featured in the stories are lowly antiheroes who fight back against intellectually superior corporate machines.
See summaries of the stories further down the page...
 
THE FUNDING
Why do I need money in order to self-publish? Well, it's more complex than just exporting a PDF and slapping a cover on it. In order to create a compellingly designed e-book that will integrate well into the major publishing platforms like Amazon Kindle and others, I need to invest in a service that will optimize the book's chances of being discovered amidst the tens of thousands of others. These services cost authors a considerable amount of money.
I also plan to commission artwork for the book--orgininal, fantastic, top-quality vector illustrations by brilliant up and coming artists who I will hand pick from Deviant Art and other creative communities. In order to acquire quality art that matches the tone and thematic focus of the stories, I need funding with which to fairly compensate artists for their work.
The more funding I get the further I can go with this project. For example, I would love to transform it into an online graphic novel, with its own interactive website where readers can actually contribute to the storylines and generate their own characters. 
So here's the breakdown of funds:
High-tier self-publishing/marketing service: $1,000-$1,500
Commissioning artwork: $500-$1,000
High-tier CMS for interactive online site: $2,000-$5,000
 
More About The Stories
The first four stories, including a novella, are completed and are ready for consumption...
 
Harold the House
Harold the House is a humorous saga of the transhuman future, when artificial intelligence and virtual reality run our households...and our sex lives.
Excerpt from the story:
As I readied for bed, Harold asked me whether or not I planned to deactivate my implants.
I sighed. "You've turned into quite a marketing machine there," I said, instantly regretting my choice of words.
"You're tired of me carrying on, I know. But quite honestly, leaving your implants activated will allow me to incorporate your unconscious wishes and desires into future Virtual sex configurations--stuff you didn't even know you wanted!"
 
AutoPhil
This story is about an unemployed man named Phil who goes to work for a powerful artificial intelligence agent known only as Rasputin. Phil's job is to archive fragments of human memories from throughout history, but he soon discovers he's being exploited for a far more insidious project. 
EXCERPT: 
In the afternoon, strange things begin to occur during ingest. At first he thought there was a glitch in the database, or that the mercury from the tuna sandwich he had for lunch was causing him to hallucinate.
When the next batch came in he noticed that one of the thumbnails featured a beautiful young woman gazing at herself in the mirror. She seemed vaguely familiar to him, but he couldn't place her. As the columns lined up, he continued watching the young woman because it seemed as though she was looking right at him, discovering him in whatever mirror of whatever century she was in. 
She smiled, and reached out to touch the mirror. When her fingertips made contact with the glass he felt her hand on his face...
"Jesus!" He jumped back in his chair, swiping at his face.
Help me, the woman mouthed, with a look of hysterical fear. Then she disappeared forever.
 
Machine Wash Warm
This story is about a heart-broken man, Kip, whose girlfriend recently left him. His artificial intelligence washing machine, named Cher, attempts to cheer him up and put him back on the right track. But it turns out the washing machine has a mysteriously X-rated ulterior motive. And Kip hasn't seen the last of his ex-girlfriend either...
EXCERPT:
Later that night, I lay on the couch, drunk, watching holographic porn with my utility fog. Cher aggregated the newest content: mood algorithms relayed real-time information about my brainwaves, which subtly altered the offerings and cycled in new clips like fresh white waves across my hormonal sands.
“Cher, do you ever get tired of washing all my clothes, making all my meals?” I asked, my words a little slurred from the wine.
“No. Why do you ask?”
“Just seems like you'd get tired of scrubbing out all those skin cells day after day.”
“As a matter of fact, Kip, I don't really get tired.”
Her prurient, metallic voice triggered something sexual inside me.
 
Someday This Will All Be Yours
This is a novella that traces the unlikely life and times of a biotechnology scientist turned post-human business magnate who attempts to use technology in order to live forever. Ultimately, he discovers that life in the future is unexpectedly harsh.
EXCERPT:
As Jim lay in the Surgeon's trellis, tiny argotic cryptographs apprised him of his declining condition. Subcutaneous flappers excised the rogue particles of goo from his bloodstream corpuscle by corpuscle. His glowing pupils shot around the operating room in restless delirium, journeying to the eight corners and back via out-of-body holo-hoppers. The Surgeon's countless flickering tendrils flushed those agitating aphids into oblivion.
“You have a visitor, Sire”
“A visitor....” Jim repeated, in crypt.
“Your son, Brian.”
Jim closed his eyes. “Brian is dead. All my sons are dead.”
  
THE AUTHOR
I have been writing my whole life, taking on a variety of genres including creative non-fiction, screenplays, blogs, comedy sketches, and fiction. For the past few years now I've been zeroing in on satirical science fiction, stories that lampoon marketing and sinister corporations while speculating on a strange near future of nanotechnology and artificial intelligence. I want to imbue these stories with subversive humor but also a sincere compassion for humans stuck within the strange machinations of a capitalist empire.
I've worked in a variety of occupations. I've been a production assistant for feature films; a camp counselor; a video editing teacher; a canvasser for an environmental non-profit; and even a guerilla marketer. It's this last job that has inspired the satirical attitude I take toward consumerism and especially the strange world of Web 3.0 that is fast approaching.
I believe science fiction is a genre that has always held the potential for social change, and will continue to figure prominently in the collective social imagination, especially as we adopt increasingly complex technological applications into our lives. I like to remind myself that sci-fi isn't just about aliens in outer space and robots inheriting the Earth--it's also about what's happening right here and now.
My influences:
My favorite sci-fi authors are Philip K. Dick, Charles Stross, Gregory Benford, Arther C. Clarke, Corey Doctorow, China Mieville, Alfred Bester, Issac Asimov, William Gibson, John Crowley, Philip Jose Farmer, and many others. There are too many to list here.
I have also been heavily influenced by the ideas and writings of authors, thinkers and publications like Jean Paul Sartre, Andy Warhol, Franz Kafka, Albert Camus, Hunter S. Thompson, Naomi Klein, Michel Foucault, Adbusters, Abbie Hoffman, and activists looking to reclaim the mental environment.

story:
A CALL TO ACTION: Facts are facts. There have been at least three major nuclear power disasters to date:  Three Mile Island in 1979, Chernobyl in 1986, and Fukushima Daiichi in 2011. Radioactive fallout has extremely long term consequences. There are also many smaller nuclear accidents and near misses every year.  Do we wait for another major nuclear catastrophe, or do we act now?

The world changed dramatically on March 11, 2011.  Fukushima Daiichi's unprecedented THREE nuclear meltdowns and continuing deadly radioactive fallout signaled that Japan and the world would be forever changed.  Previously I had learned much about radioactive waste issues while working for Greenpeace in the US.  I also studied holistic nutrition and worked in the nutrition field before becoming a mother.  I used to think it was a bit of an unusual resume leap, going from radioactive waste to then nutrition and motherhood, but on March 11, 2011 those worlds collided and bonded together. What my experiences brought to the table was startling clear: radioactive fallout from nuclear power and food do not mix, and innocent children are especially at risk.  

HOW YOU CAN HELP:  These days the publishing world shifts responsibility primarily to the new author for not only creating the book but for distribution as well. I'm appealing to the good people here on Indiegogo to help raise $9,000 for this campaign. As a contributor, you will a) help to create a national advertising campaign and materials to provide a platform for myself and others to speak out on this urgent issue; b) a print edition for bookstores around the US in conjunction with the PR campaign and c) seed money to research the companion book to "Silence Deafening.." on mindful health in a Fukushima world.

Here is what one notable expert had to say about my book: "Platitudes about ‘permissible doses’ cannot take away parental responsibility and non-monitoring of fallout by the government does not make the problem go away! Thank God for mothers like Kimberly!" ~ Rosalie Bertell, PhD, GNSH founder of the International Institute of Concern for Public Health (IICPH), former consultant to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, the Environmental Protection Agency, and HealthCanada (More endorsements at www.silencedeafening.com)

We ALL have the power to do something. I turned to the Internet in April of 2011 and created a petition calling for food monitoring of radioactive fallout from Fukushima that has continued to generate thousands of signatures and which led to the formation of Fukushima Fallout Awareness Network. http://www.change.org/petitions/urgent-fukushima-radioactive-fallout-food-safety-petition People have often asked, "Why don't we see this on the news?” That's a very good question! One of the few reporters who have faithfully followed the story recently asked the same question. He thinks that the issue intimidates most reporters, but with so much at risk we can't allow this to continue http://www.forbes.com/sites/jeffmcmahon/2012/05/29/should-we-hide-low-dose-radiation-exposures-from-the-public/

"Silence Deafening, Fukushima Fallout...A Mother's Response", shares key information that will help inform readers who may not realize the considerable dangers and consequences of a nuclear power society, while at the same time providing powerful tools for transitioning to a safer world. It explains in lay terms how we got here, and why and how we so urgently need to get out. "Silence Deafening, Fukushima Fallout...A Mother's Response" is now available for download on Amazon for Kindle, iBookstore, Nook, Sony, Kobo, apps, and more. A print version is available here https://www.createspace.com/3892548   and on Amazon.com

Here are some links for further reading. You’ll find more by clicking the “gallery” tab. http://www.nuc.berkeley.edu/UCBAirSampling/MilkSampling , http://www.naturalnews.com/036022_Fukushima_radiation_food_supply.html http://www.sfgate.com/science/article/Japan-s-radiation-found-in-California-bluefin-tuna-3591176.php

Thank you for being a part of this important campaign. The very act of reading this message and sharing it with others (share the widget link below the pitch video)  enables awareness to grow exponentially.  Thank you for helping to break the silence.

story:
Obsidian is an inspirational childrens book (age 4 & up) of short stories that playfully address following your inner guidance, listening to the voice of inspiration, expressing yourself in your own unique way, and letting go of things outgrown. The lead characters embody these things by the end of their stories, finding it within themselves. I believe that it is important for children to learn and know they make a unique and valuable contribution to the world when they are expressing themselves and using their natural talents. Obsidian aims to help them do that in a fun, adventurous way. Can you remember a childhood book that made you feel good about your unique self?

My teen-age son, Alex, is an aspiring artist and when I asked if he would draw some illustrations for the book he was excited! He intends to go to art school and this will be an important experience for him to see that he can get his art out into the world. We already have our next book outlined for release in 2014! Alex said: “It's important to me because I want people to see that not only adults can be (professional) artists, but kids can be too.”

Obsidian is complete and ready to publish! I only need to add a contributor's page from this campaign. Writing and publishing this book were easy compared to the task of getting out into the world and into the hands of children. Big publishing houses have allotted budgets for marketing and promotion, where most self-publishers - including me - do not, and that's where you can help.

By contributing to this campaign, you’ll be helping us give this book to children who otherwise may not have found it and it's message of inspiration and encouragement. Almost all of the perks include books donated directly to kids. You get books, kids get books, we get the word out about Obsidian to get more books to more kids - it's a win-win-win for everyone! How could it get any better than that?

I've gotten wonderful feedback from all those who have read it so far!

From the back cover of the book:

Be inspired with these fun and heart-felt stories about four creative children who discover their own unique way to follow the Voice of Inspiration....

 Look inside to see what secret, ancient treasures one adventurous boy finds, and how he uses their amazing magic!

Learn how a city girl with extraordinary talent paints the whole world, fast!

Read along as a long, lean, boy helps his village hear the music in the rhythm of life – and dance!

Meet a girl who grows so quickly her beautiful shoes no longer fit, but how can she ever let them go?

Are you feeling adventurous? Then let's go!

You can choose exactly where a signed copy of Obsidian will be donated: the elementary school, library, daycare, church, or charity of your choice. Or, if you don't have one in mind, I'll choose one and tell you exactly where and when it was sent.

What We Need & What You Get

This is where your contributions will go to make this a successful book launch, and get Obsidian into the hands of kids:

$2805 1000 copies of Obsidian for perks, donations, sales, consignments, promos, reviewers, etc.

$420 shipping the books from createspace, the print-on-demand company, to me.

$450 postage and envelopes to send books to the places listed above.

$180 conversion of Obsidian to all e book formats

$160 1000 Obsidian bookmarks for promotional use

$95 500 promotional postcards

$220 postage for postcards

$2500 publicist for press releases and marketing, etc., ads in publications and websites for parents and kids, expanded distribution on amazon.com to place on international sites, publicity packages to bookstores to get it onto bookstore shelves.

$2000 travel/transportation costs to book stores and libraries for planned book tour May - Dec. 2013 Woo Hoo!

$900 Indiegogo fees: 9% of total contributions

$300 credit card/paypal fees: 3% of total contributions

$10,000 Total

We will do as much as we can with what we receive, so even if we don't reach the goal amount it won't stop us! We'll simply scale back accordingly.

What You Get For Your Contribution

 A New Adventure

$10 You will receive an e book of Obsidian in the format of your choice. Kindle, nook, pdf, etc., a personal email thanking you for your support, and updates and news on all things Obsidian, and our gratitude!

 Feel The Rhythm

$25 A copy of the book signed by the author and illustrator, your name added to a special contributors page in the book, a personal letter thanking you for your support and updates and news on all things Obsidian, and of course, our gratitude!

 Follow Your Heart

$50 Your name added to a special contributors page in the book, a signed copy of the book, or ebook - your choice, AND a signed copy of the book gifted to the elementary school, library, daycare, church, or charity of your choice, a personal letter or email - your choice - thanking you for your support, and updates and news on all things Obsidian, and our gratitude!

 Hear The Voice of Inspiration

$75 Your name added to a special contributors page in the book, TWO signed copies of the book, or ebooks - your choice, a personal letter or email - your choice - thanking you for your support, AND TWO signed copies of the book gifted to the elementary school, library, daycare, church, or charity of your choice, and an Obsidian bookmark with each. You will also receive updates and news on all things Obsidian, and our gratitude!

Feel The Beauty Inside

$100 You will receive THREE signed copies of the book, or ebooks - your choice, a personal letter or email - your choice - thanking you for your support, your name added to a special contributors page in the book, AND THREE signed copies of the book gifted to the elementary school, library, daycare, church, or charity of your choice, and an Obsidian bookmark with each. Your name added to a special contributors page in the book. You will also receive updates on all things Obsidian, and our gratitude!

The Brave Explorer

$250 Susan and Alex will visit your school, daycare, church, or charity, and read from the book! (within 25 miles of Newburyport, Ma ) OR a video skype call with us! Your name will be added to a special contributors page in the book. Plus you will receive everything from the $100 contribution perk!

 Sharing Your Gift

$500 We will visit your organization as above, and read from the book! (within 75 miles of Newburyport, Ma) OR a video skype call with us! ALSO, you'll receive an original, signed, framed drawing by Alex! You will be added to a special contributors page in the book. Plus FOUR signed copies of the book, or ebooks -your choice, a personal letter or email, AND FOUR signed copies of the book gifted to the school, etc., of your choice, an Obsidian bookmark with each, updates and news, and our gratitude!

 The Garden Path

$1000 For this Grand Gesture (pun intended) you'll receive your name, or child’s name written into the story of our next book- to be released in 2014 - and a signed copy! PLUS ALL of the perks for the $500 contribution! Thank you, thank you, thank you! Limit 5

 Celebrating The Music That's In Us

$10,000 If you're this adventurous then we will be too! We will travel (almost) anywhere to spend the day with you and your group, and I'll read from Obsidian. AND your name, or child's name, will be the name of the main character in our next book! (to be released in 2014) You'll also receive a signed copy. Plus, you get 10,000 positive Karma points with the Universe, AND our Eternal Gratitude! In addition, you will receive everything listed for a $500 contribution. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

NOTE: With any of the 'perks' above, you can mix up the donated books and those for yourself. For example, you can choose to keep one book and donate the rest, or vice versa. Just send me an email letting me know.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help by getting the word out about Obsidian. Please email a link to this page and use the sharing buttons below to tell everyone you know! We are so grateful for your help and thank you in advance!

Here's a brief excerpt from The Nest, one of the stories in Obsidian:

One day, in a time very much like your own, there was a young girl waking up in a big city, a metropolis you could say.

She was no ordinary girl, for she was very much like you, and could do extraordinary things. For example, she could braid her hair very quickly, tie her shoes even faster, and knit a whole sweater in a week.

Well, this girl had talents much more than this. She could beat eggs for the fluffiest omelets you ever had, and grip the rope swing so tight she never fell off.

So, this one particular day, waking up in the big city, she put her talents to good use. She ran outside, as she always did on summer days, and crossed the street to the park. She greeted her favorite tree, grabbed its branches, and pulled herself up inside. You may think you cannot be inside a tree, but if you have ever climbed a tree you know what I mean.

Inside the tree, sitting on the sturdiest branch, she noticed a new bird’s nest on a higher branch.

“That’s funny” she thought to herself, “that wasn’t there yesterday.”

She realized the bird who built it must work very fast, to build a nest in one night. She sat there for a while in silence, thinking about the nest, while cradled in the tree.

After a while, she came down and crossed the grass to the duck pond. She lay on her belly on the edge looking at her reflection in the surfaceof the glassy water.

“I’ll help you” came the voice behind her.

“Help me do what?” she turned to see who was speaking.

“You want to build something over night – faster than a bird builds a nest.” said the voice. “I will help you.”

Looking around she could see no one speaking to her. There were other people in the park, walking by, but none addressing her.

“Who are you? Where are you?” she said, searching the trees now for someone hiding.

 “I am you,” said the voice, “ and you are me.”

 “You’re what? How can you be me if I am talking to you?”

 “I am the part of you that gives you your talents. I am the part of you that loves the trees. I am the part of you that wants to make beautiful things, like a birds nest, in one night.”

“I didn’t know a girl had more than one part. Am I not one part - a whole girl?”

“Oh yes. You are one whole girl. But you have many parts to your self, and you are part of a whole.”

She thought for a moment, closing her eyes to understand what the voice was saying.

 A picture came to her mind of the Earth, as if she were seeing it from space. It looked far away, but still she could see trees growing, birds flying around the trees and children playing in them. She could see cars driving on roads, planes landing and taking off, and people moving all around the Earth. The Earth herself was alive - she could see it. Water rushing, plants growing food, and mountains reaching toward the sun.

Then, she looked to the sun and saw how it shone upon the Earth, causing everything to grow – including the people.

She realized in that moment what the voice was telling her. She was a part of the whole Earth. Like a piece of the puzzle making a big picture.

“Are you the voice that gives everyone their talents?” she asked.

To find out the rest of the story you'll have to read the book!

I hope you are as inspired as we are to get this book out into the world. I truly believe it will help kids, at least in some small way, to be themselves, and share their talents with the world. Thank you for your contribution!

Here's a brief excerpt from The Nest, one of the stories in Obsidian:
One day, in a time very much like your own, there was a young girl waking up in a big city, a metropolis you could say.
She was no ordinary girl, for she was very much like you, and could do extraordinary things. For example, she could braid her hair very quickly, tie her shoes even faster, and knit a whole sweater in a week.
Well, this girl had talents much more than this. She could beat eggs for the fluffiest omelets you ever had, and grip the rope swing so tight she never fell off.
So, this one particular day, waking up in the big city, she put her talents to good use. She ran outside, as she always did on summer days, and crossed the street to the park. She greeted her favorite tree, grabbed its branches, and pulled herself up inside. You may think you cannot be inside a tree, but if you have ever climbed a tree you know what I mean.
Inside the tree, sitting on the sturdiest branch, she noticed a new bird’s nest on a higher branch.
“That’s funny” she thought to herself, “that wasn’t there yesterday.”
She realized the bird who built it must work very fast, to build a nest in one night. She sat there for a while in silence, thinking about the nest, while cradled in the tree.
After a while, she came down and crossed the grass to the duck pond. She lay on her belly on the edge looking at her reflection in the surfaceof the glassy water.
“I’ll help you” came the voice behind her.
“Help me do what?” she turned to see who was speaking.
“You want to build something over night – faster than a bird builds a nest.” said the voice. “I will help you.”
Looking around she could see no one speaking to her. There were other people in the park, walking by, but none addressing her.
“Who are you? Where are you?” she said, searching the trees now for someone hiding.
 “I am you,” said the voice, “ and you are me.”
 “You’re what? How can you be me if I am talking to you?”
 “I am the part of you that gives you your talents. I am the part of you that loves the trees. I am the part of you that wants to make beautiful things, like a birds nest, in one night.”
“I didn’t know a girl had more than one part. Am I not one part - a whole girl?”
“Oh yes. You are one whole girl. But you have many parts to your self, and you are part of a whole.”
She thought for a moment, closing her eyes to understand what the voice was saying.
 A picture came to her mind of the Earth, as if she were seeing it from space. It looked far away, but still she could see trees growing, birds flying around the trees and children playing in them. She could see cars driving on roads, planes landing and taking off, and people moving all around the Earth. The Earth herself was alive - she could see it. Water rushing, plants growing food, and mountains reaching toward the sun.
Then, she looked to the sun and saw how it shone upon the Earth, causing everything to grow – including the people.
She realized in that moment what the voice was telling her. She was a part of the whole Earth. Like a piece of the puzzle making a big picture.
“Are you the voice that gives everyone their talents?” she asked.
To find out the rest of the story you'll have to read the book! 
I hope you are as inspired as we are to get this book out into the world. I truly believe it will help kids, at least in some small way, to be themselves, and share their talents with the world. Thank you for your contribution!

story:
A fighters chance will be released next week. I should have everyones copies by June 1st. Thank you for all the support!

 

 

Name Change: The name of the book has been changed from "A Puncher's Chance" to "A Fighter's Chance"

 

Congratulations to Chad Synder from Maryland on winning the Reyes Boxing Gloves!                              

 

 

                                WELCOME!!!

Hello, Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign. If you clicked on the link to fightnights.com please look at the perk rewards on how to get into the drawing to win the Reyes boxing gloves along with some other cool rewards for higher donations!

A Fighter's Chance will be the second novel that I have written. It's the story of a boy that stumbles across a boxing gym as a child and grows up to become a serious contender. He will face many challenges along the way. He develops a close bond with his trainer who is determined to test him every way he can. The young boy struggles with hatred for his parents, living with no money, and a corrupt political boxing world that does nothing short of pushing fighters towards the brink of failure. With the help of his Coach, and a few straggling friends, he must learn to overcome all his obstacles and fight his way through the ranks to a title shot. His most important lesson of all, is that in order to win the championship inside of the ring, he must learn to destroy his demons outside of it.

                   

                        WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Other than some pretty awesome rewards for your donations I've decided to use this book to give back to a sport that I fell in love with growing up. Once the book gets published I am going to donate 20% of all the profits to pay for boxing gloves and gear to the less fortunate kids that sign up at local boxing gyms in the area. For the gyms that charge fees, I will be paying for thier gym fees. Most kids that take up the sport of Boxing don't have the money to pay for nice things. I intend to give it to them. So your donations will not only help me with the release of this book, but you will be helping give back to my community. Something else that I plan to do, is that if I raise enough money I will travel to my grandmother's home in Nochistlan, ZA, Mexico, and buy boxing bags, gloves, and wraps for a gym that has recently opened there. The gym currently has one bag and a few pairs of torn up old gloves. Sad, I know. My goal is to change that! Also, a 30$ donation does get you a free book that is signed by me, so you can look at it as just buying a signed book for 30$. Not a bad deal!

 

             

                                   

                                 About Me

 

If you asked ten different people what they thought about me you would most likely get ten different answers. What will be the same though, is that they would all say that I am fun person to be around. I enjoy every moment of my life no matter what I am doing. I believe that life is too short to be angry. Yes, life presents its challenges, and there are hard times for us all. However, we all get through them. We learn to live with the cards that we've been dealt. I do it with a smile on my face. The bond between people is what makes the world tick. I believe in God, although seldom do I find my way to church like I am supposed to. My parents are sweet. I have a big family with two brothers and two sisters, who have given me my fair share of headaches over the years, and dozens of cousins that have scattered themselves all over the world.

I love sports! Saturday mornings you can find me playing football somewhere in Western New York. The sport has caused more than a few serious injuries for me. I have a serious addiction to Iphone apps. I'm convinced that one day there will be professional counseling for it, in which I will gladly attend. I like hanging out with my girlfriend and crazy dog. Meeting new people is fun and exciting. Working out is a must for me at least four days a week, and considering that fact that I eat everything that I lay my eyes on, hitting the gym is a habit I need to keep. I like to travel, hike, and am always thrilled to try something new and exciting. I live life one day at a time and wouldn't have it any other way. 

 

                               Why boxing?

When I was fifteen years old me and my friend were paid to clean out the upstairs of a building. The reason for this was because a boxing gym was going to rent it out. Now I was no tough guy, in fact I didn't like fighting. Yet, my interest could not be swayed. When the gym moved in I signed up to see how it was, and never looked back. I loved it! Boxing taught me to me self-confident, disciplined, and patient. These characteristics didn't just bind themselves within the ropes. They translated into my life as well. The sport changed my life. Fifteen years later I still go three days a week and help train fighters alongside my beloved Coach. I have seen many kids walk in and out of that gym with so many different stories. While my novel is fictional, it sums up what all young fighters go through trying to make it in the boxing world. What I have seen in boxing has inspired me to write this story.

 

               Quotes from "A Fighter's Chance"

 

"Often, a man of few words has more to say than a man of many."

"A man's heart cannot be defined in times of prosperity and riches, but in times of darkness and despair."

"My father was gone at the age of six and my mother became a crack addict when I was seven. I can't afford my rent, my bills, nor do I have any idea where my next meal is going to come from. If there is a man with more anger in his heart than me, I would love to meet him."

"Boxing is a sport that demands your full attention. It must be your life. You must live it, you must sleep it, you must breathe it. The very thought of existing outside of the ring cannot exist."

"Do not hold on to anger or hatred for the people you love. When you get mad, get over it. When you get angry, relax. When you don't want to talk to someone for whatever reason you have, walk up to them and work it out. One day you will wake up, tomorrow or twenty years from now, and it will seem like a normal day. You will go to work, go to the gym, clean the house, whatever it is that you do. Somewhere in that day, you will get a phone call or text, and someone that you love will have died. A brother, sister, mother, father, child, aunt, uncle, whoever it may be. If your heart is filled with malice and hatred, then you will regret it. But if it is filled with love and compassion, you will never regret anything you say and do to people. Each memory will be a great one. You will remember the good, because you chose to destroy the bad."

"I don't know if I can win this fight. Hell I don't know if I'll ever be the champ that everyone expects me to be, but what I do know, is that I'm willing to die in that ring for it, and that has to count for something."

 

                                Sneak Peek                          

                        Chapter One/Prologue                             

 

 

The sound of the bell jars my thoughts as I make my way to the corner of the ring. I place my arms on the ropes and wait as Trey positions the stool. The look in his brown eyes is confident as he slips his lithe body between the ropes without touching them.

My white gloves are pasted with spots of dried-up blood. Taking deep breaths hurts my lungs. It feels as though a 400-pound man is dancing on my chest. My body is covered in so much sweat it looks like I’ve just gotten out of a pool. 

The last four rounds have been a war. Taking a seat on the hard stool, I realize how tired my legs are. It's been a long fight. I think it's round eleven but I'm not entirely sure. The pain in my head is like a nagging headache that never goes away. My right eye is swelled up, although my vision is clear. I can feel the electricity of the crowd and it makes me realize one thing: this has been one hell of a fight!

Trey covers my back with a bag of ice, making me jump, and the soothing cold spreading across my back helps me regain focus. Henry Brass joins Trey in aid. Mr. Brass’ gray, healthy hair and clean-shaven face look rich. Not nearly as rich as his pockets though. Mr. Brass smiles at me. He was one of the reasons why I was here.

His daughter sits a few seats over in the front row. With bright green eyes that can be noticed from where I sit I can’t help but take a peek over. Her blonde hair looks amazing with her black dress. She’s the most beautiful girl in this arena, at least in my eyes. She’s not showing her usually stunning smile; instead, she looks worried.

Coach Kay is talking to me. I can hear what he is saying but somehow I ignore it. It is the eleventh round, that much is clear.

I can't help but look out into the vast crowd; it’s the biggest I’ve ever seen. People are screaming, and many of them are looking at me. I can only hear them in between rounds, for when the fight in the ring starts, everything goes blank.

The arena fits at least 70,000 people. According to the promoters, every single seat has been paid for. I glance at promoter Grey Bones and distaste swells in my mouth. I wish it was him on the other side of that ring so I could pound his face in as soon as the round starts again. The hair around his head is mostly gray with streaks of black that refuse to give way to his age. He’s a tall man that perhaps kept in shape in his younger years. The man has more money than God, and more deceit in his eyes than Satan himself. Boxing is his gold mine. Everything he’s done, everything he has tried to do, and everything he plans on doing in this sport bothers me. There is only one way to beat him, and that is to beat the man across from me right now. That victory would shatter Bones’ world.

Juan Riviera is sitting a few seats away. Dressed in a dove-gray suit made precisely to his liking, the once boxing sensation is looking at me with worried eyes. Many compare me to him, saying that my good looks and boxing abilities are everything the sport needed after Riviera retired. Even though his black hair and dark brown eyes are the complete opposite of mine, I can’t help but see the similarities between us.

Disputes often broke when speaking Juan Riviera’s name. He used to be the face of boxing and the people loved him. However, a stunning knockout loss sent him to retirement so early in his career that many debated whether he was worthy of entering the Hall of Fame. He hadn't let retirement ruin his good looks, and he seemed like he could still get in the ring and go a few rounds. Juan was looking for me to take his place as a superstar in the sport. But I still don't trust him fully. Perhaps I never will. Promoters are very hard to trust, and even harder to become friends with. Still, if Juan released me tomorrow, I would walk over and hug him, thanking him for everything he’s done.

I’m not sure if I’m losing or winning the fight, it's been so close. Judging by Juan’s eyes, though, I am losing. The fact that it’s been this close has surprised everyone, I’m sure.

“Look at me, son!”

Coach Kay finally gets my attention. He has the most distinct, demanding tone I have ever heard. I look into his strong and determined eyes. His black skin shines in the lights that hover above the ring. His tall body always seems smaller when he is hunched over, cleaning me up. Taking the end-swell, he rubs my eyes as he grabs the towel and wipes the sweat from my face. I feel like smiling at the old man but I can’t. If Mr. Brass saved my life, then Coach Kay changed it. The man has been everything I could ask for in a trainer, and perhaps even a father. We have been through it all, Coach and I. It hasn’t been an easy road but is it ever? The hardest part is yet to come. He will tell the world our secret after this fight. The secret that I have fought so hard to keep buried inside of me, the secret that will change my life forever. I realize I have to quickly dismiss that thought, though. If I let it distract me, I will surely lose this fight.

“He's tired, you understand me?” Coach barks. “He's damn tired! If you win these last two rounds, you will win this fight! Do you understand me? I need you to go after him now. These are the championship rounds, son. This is what we train for. Take the fight to him!”

The words ring through my head. I'm winning? Or am I losing and I need the last two rounds to win the fight? I would never ask. My face is all over the television and I wouldn't want their corner to see any doubt in my eyes. Each round has been close. I know that I won a few rounds in the middle, and I know of some rounds I lost, but they go by so fast I can't count how many. The close rounds are hard to judge because, as a fighter, I can never tell if I won or lost the round unless I completely dominate. Even then you never know what these judges are thinking especially if one of them is corrupt or just plain stupid.

Looking across the ring, I stare into the eyes of my opponent for a moment. His face is swollen and his right eye is cut. He's breathing heavy. I have watched hundreds of tapes of him and have never seen him breathing the way he is right now. He has never been cut. The most distinguishing thing, though, is the look in his eyes. He’s usually confident, cocky, and poised, but he’s none of those right now. For the first time ever, I see fear in his eyes. He's worried. He's tired. Coach Kay is right. I can win this fight! It was a fight very few people thought I could win.

He glances at me and I look away. I take a few deep breaths. My legs don't hurt now as much as before. I can't tell if my mind has tuned the pain out or if the one-minute break between the round has helped. It might be the fear in his eyes that has given me the energy to continue.

Standing up, I can hear the crowd going crazy. I've ignored all of the celebrities sitting ringside. It’s my first fight they’ve attended, but I know they’re not here to see me. They paid a ridiculous amount of money to come watch Dominick as they usually do. Money was something that I once hated more than anything, something that nearly drove me to end my boxing career, and almost my life.

Tonight, I have to steal his spotlight. I have to take his crown. I have to show the world that the pain they have seen in my life the last couple weeks has made me stronger than I’ve ever been. My story has spread quickly; so tonight, despite being the underdog, I am the crowd favorite. I may never know if it’s because they feel sorry for what I’ve been through or if they truly like me. Regardless, people who didn’t even know my name weeks ago now want me to win.

I take one last look into the arena. A faded image of my father appears in the middle of the crowd. I can’t deny that I look like him: dirty blonde hair, light green eyes, and a smile that could steal any woman’s heart. His tall, muscular figure towers over everyone around him. He is not cheering, just smiling at me like he used too. There is only one thing I once hated more than money, and it is him.

A second later, the image of my father is gone and I see my mother. I almost laugh. I must be delusional after one too many punches to the head. How could one image that I hated lead into another? They say you should always forgive but not forget, but what she did to me I can never forgive. Every single time I stare into that woman’s eyes, the hatred in my soul burns.

Then I remember that I had invited her to come. And I suddenly realize that my mother is actually in the crowd, sitting timidly a few rows back from the ring. Her being here, I tell myself, is a small step toward making amends for the devastation she brought upon my family.

The bell rings. It’s the eleventh round of the championship fight, a fight that the whole world is watching. I have come to love this sport more than anything, but it was pain that started me on the journey to her here...

Disputes often broke when speaking Juan Riviera’s name. He used to be the face of boxing and the people loved him. However, a stunning knockout loss sent him to retirement so early in his career that many debated whether he was worthy of entering the Hall of Fame. He hadn't let retirement ruin his good looks, and he seemed like he could still get in the ring and go a few rounds. Juan was looking for me to take his place as a superstar in the sport. But I still don't trust him fully. Perhaps I never will. Promoters are very hard to trust, and even harder to become friends with. Still, if Juan released me tomorrow, I would walk over and hug him, thanking him for everything he’s done.
I’m not sure if I’m losing or winning the fight, it's been so close. Judging by Juan’s eyes, though, I am losing. The fact that it’s been this close has surprised everyone, I’m sure.
“Look at me, son!”
Coach Kay finally gets my attention. He has the most distinct, demanding tone I have ever heard. I look into his strong and determined eyes. His black skin shines in the lights that hover above the ring. His tall body always seems smaller when he is hunched over, cleaning me up. Taking the end-swell, he rubs my eyes as he grabs the towel and wipes the sweat from my face. I feel like smiling at the old man but I can’t. If Mr. Brass saved my life, then Coach Kay changed it. The man has been everything I could ask for in a trainer, and perhaps even a father. We have been through it all, Coach and I. It hasn’t been an easy road but is it ever? The hardest part is yet to come. He will tell the world our secret after this fight. The secret that I have fought so hard to keep buried inside of me, the secret that will change my life forever. I realize I have to quickly dismiss that thought, though. If I let it distract me, I will surely lose this fight.
“He's tired, you understand me?” Coach barks. “He's damn tired! If you win these last two rounds, you will win this fight! Do you understand me? I need you to go after him now. These are the championship rounds, son. This is what we train for. Take the fight to him!”
The words ring through my head. I'm winning? Or am I losing and I need the last two rounds to win the fight? I would never ask. My face is all over the television and I wouldn't want their corner to see any doubt in my eyes. Each round has been close. I know that I won a few rounds in the middle, and I know of some rounds I lost, but they go by so fast I can't count how many. The close rounds are hard to judge because, as a fighter, I can never tell if I won or lost the round unless I completely dominate. Even then you never know what these judges are thinking especially if one of them is corrupt or just plain stupid.
Looking across the ring, I stare into the eyes of my opponent for a moment. His face is swollen and his right eye is cut. He's breathing heavy. I have watched hundreds of tapes of him and have never seen him breathing the way he is right now. He has never been cut. The most distinguishing thing, though, is the look in his eyes. He’s usually confident, cocky, and poised, but he’s none of those right now. For the first time ever, I see fear in his eyes. He's worried. He's tired. Coach Kay is right. I can win this fight! It was a fight very few people thought I could win.
He glances at me and I look away. I take a few deep breaths. My legs don't hurt now as much as before. I can't tell if my mind has tuned the pain out or if the one-minute break between the round has helped. It might be the fear in his eyes that has given me the energy to continue.
Standing up, I can hear the crowd going crazy. I've ignored all of the celebrities sitting ringside. It’s my first fight they’ve attended, but I know they’re not here to see me. They paid a ridiculous amount of money to come watch Dominick as they usually do. Money was something that I once hated more than anything, something that nearly drove me to end my boxing career, and almost my life.
Tonight, I have to steal his spotlight. I have to take his crown. I have to show the world that the pain they have seen in my life the last couple weeks has made me stronger than I’ve ever been. My story has spread quickly; so tonight, despite being the underdog, I am the crowd favorite. I may never know if it’s because they feel sorry for what I’ve been through or if they truly like me. Regardless, people who didn’t even know my name weeks ago now want me to win.
I take one last look into the arena. A faded image of my father appears in the middle of the crowd. I can’t deny that I look like him: dirty blonde hair, light green eyes, and a smile that could steal any woman’s heart. His tall, muscular figure towers over everyone around him. He is not cheering, just smiling at me like he used too. There is only one thing I once hated more than money, and it is him.
A second later, the image of my father is gone and I see my mother. I almost laugh. I must be delusional after one too many punches to the head. How could one image that I hated lead into another? They say you should always forgive but not forget, but what she did to me I can never forgive. Every single time I stare into that woman’s eyes, the hatred in my soul burns.
Then I remember that I had invited her to come. And I suddenly realize that my mother is actually in the crowd, sitting timidly a few rows back from the ring. Her being here, I tell myself, is a small step toward making amends for the devastation she brought upon my family.
The bell rings. It’s the eleventh round of the championship fight, a fight that the whole world is watching. I have come to love this sport more than anything, but it was pain that started me on the journey to her here...

story:
WHY?

The idea for News Bubble came after my wife was in our local town centre and saw a lot of police and an air ambulance. After arriving home she went online to find out what had been going on, but to her frustration she could not find any report of the incident on any online news source. She eventually found a report on Twitter telling of a stabbing in the area. My wife and I observed that the internet lacked a news service that provides news quickly, particularly at a local level, noting that although the information was eventually found on Twitter, she had to search for it rather than having it presented to her and that it was reported by a member of the public.

 

WHAT?

News Bubble’s purpose is to provide a worldwide online platform for the general public to publish news articles as they see them happening and have that news pushed into the public domain via the News Bubble website. Importantly the content will be sorted according to taxonomy and ranked by the amount of views and ratings the news item attains. The aim is to provide online news quickly, uncensored and ordered to the readers interests.

We are at an amazing moment in history, 92% of adults in the UK have mobile phones. As of September 2012, 39% of adults in the UK are using smartphones. News Bubble is perfectly poised to revolutionise the way we consume news. 

 

HOW?

News Bubble will consists of a website and mobile phone applications.  The mobile apps allows the user to report on a story as it happens or at a later time, adding a location, headline, category, pictures, video and text for their article. This article is then sent to the website where it is made available to read within its category page. Each story on the site will then have the opportunity to move further to the forefront of the site (the front page being the top level) based on how many times that story is read and rated in relation to the other stories on the site.  Anyone can read the articles on the site, but only registered users may post, rate and comment on stories. Registered users can also create their own front page, displaying only the news categories they are interested in and will be able to follow other users whose stories and comments they like or dislike.

 

GOAL?

To publish the news as it is breaking.

Every person alive who has access to a phone or a computer can report the news.

Give every person who publishes a story the opportunity to reach the front page.

Let the public decide what stories are important and where they need to be seen on the site.

Keep the news uncensored and unbiased.

The news is some of the most important information we absorb in our day to day lives and with the growing need for online news and people’s desire to participate in social networking we feel News Bubble is perfectly placed to capitalise on both these growing sectors.  We believe that as the site grows and matures so will its content, creating a new genre of news distribution, changing the way that news is reported and consumed.

All these goals are designed to set News Bubble apart from any other news outlet, turning the world in to an online news community.

By being available to every person alive, News Bubble effectively has 6 billion reporters stationed on every corner of the planet. 

 

News Bubble is a concept that we are building from scratch. As you can imagine there are a lot of things to do and pay for when creating a start up. We are currently designing the website and developing the apps and hope to launch the site in early 2013. Our main concerns at this stage is being able to afford everything we need to make News Bubble as good as it can possibly be. Attracting people to use the News Bubble site is also a concern. Your money will go towards these development costs. Together we can make the dream a reality.

story:
Writing a book is hard work, getting it published is harder - you can help it happen!

I meet so many people who really wonder if the Church is relevant for them and also wonder if Jesus has anything to do with Church. Good questions and lots of reasons to doubt it, This book explores what its all about and gives some positive vignettes of authentic churches.

  • I have been a follower of Jesus and a pastor for many years since coming the Christ in my college years. In that time I have met some incredible Christians and experienced wonderful church life. Also in that time I have met some very unattractive religious groups that were no churches at all.

  • Your gift will make it possible to bring these experiences and discoveries to life and help others avoid some pitfalls and enjoy the reality of what should be life giving.


What I Need & What You Get

  • The Funds will be used to Publish and Promote this exciting new book. Costs cover Editing, Print Preparation, Design work and Promotion online.
  • PERK - Help Global Poor - 10% of the funds raised will go directly to the Haiti Church Project we have been involved in since 2010 - Love for some of the global poor.  10% of book sales will also go to help Haiti http://www.danrutherford.ca/haiti.html
  • PERK 1 - donate $25 or more and receive a Limited Edition and Signed Copy
  • PERK 2 - donate $100 and get a half dozen copies (6) sent to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute - could you MAKE SOME NOISE e.g. help me promote this campaign?

  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Invite me to your local bookshop or church or retreat.

THANKS - Dan Rutherford

story:
About this project

What does it mean to be magical?

Who decides who is magical? 

What does it take to be magical? 

Am I magical?

Are we?

 

Let's Talk Black Girl Magic

In March 2016, I was getting ready for my first convention of the year. As always, I had a pile of things to do, but instead, I felt the urge to create something new. I began sketching a girl and, at the time, I didn’t think much of it, but that girl would later become the leader of a group of extraordinary women. “Galactic Purple” was the first magical girl I created, and soon, three others joined her: “Cosmic Green,” “Radical Rainbow,” and “Prism Pink.” I also created one more character, a goddess only known as, “Heavenly Universe," who would end up becoming the logo to a series I hadn't been planning on writing AT ALL!

At the time, none of the characters had names beyond their magical girl titles. They didn’t have personalities, back stories, likes, dislikes… they were blank slates. But, over time, each girl developed into a character. More importantly, the girls came together as a team, and I began putting together an outline for a book series. Each book will explore each of the girls and their relationships with one another, along with their interactions with others — both in their magical lives and everyday ones.

 

The Creator

Hi there! I'm Briana Lawrence, also known as "Brichibi Cosplays." I'm a freelance writer who goes from writing scripts for WatchMojo.com to creating fantastical worlds where queer black girls save the day with magical cupcakes and rainbow powered kicks! I'm often traveling the country with my work and my cosplay, doing panels on the importance of diversity and self love. I've been writing since I was nine years old and even have a B.A. in English and Women's Studies from Iowa State University. I also dabble around with a woodburner from time to time, which is actually how this whole magical girl adventure started!

I hope you take a moment to check out my work. This is going to be the first book in the series I'm planning. I'm hoping to have some fun, queer, carefree black girl representation... and sparkles. Lots of sparkles. 

 

The Journey

Since March 2016, I've been travelling to numerous conventions to spread the word about the book series. I've done this by having prints, crafts, preview books, and buttons of the girls at my art table.

Because of my convention travels and my constant promotion of the girls, I've already begun to create a fan base for them, and many are anxious to read their story!

 

The Story

There’s a city. It’s like most other cities. Buildings. People. Monsters who can destroy sidewalks by vomiting acid onto the ground, and an elite group of black, queer, magical girls who work to put those monsters in their place.

See? Just like most other cities.

Bree Danvers would’ve compared it to a video game, maybe a cartoon or comic book, except black girls are rarely the heroines of the story. But there her heroine stood, plus size and wonderful, rocking a dazzling amount of purple and defeating monsters with galactic sparkles. Galactic Purple, that was her name, and soon, Bree was joining her on a magical adventure full of transformations and after school battles to defend a city like most other cities.

And soon, others would join them, and each one would be magical in their own way… give or take a few bumps on the acid covered ground.

 

The Campaign

Now it's time to get down to the glitter and sparkles. magnifiqueNOIR is going to be a mix of creativity. The first book, "I Am Magical," will not only be a full-length novel written by me, but it'll also feature a variety of art to represent some of the key moments in the story. This art will be done by myself and an amazing group of artists who have teamed up with me to tell this story, for example, this piece by "The Art of Dave Branch" where Lonnie takes on a monster:

The art will be in black and white, however, if the campaign exceeds the initial goal, I plan on looking into upgrading the book with full colored illustrations. That means that pieces like this collaborative battle scene by "MuseTap Studios" and "Radiant Grey" will be in color as a print AND in the book itself:

 

Costs

 

Items

Right off the bat, anyone pledging anything, whether it's a perk or just money in general, will receive a coloring page at the end of the campaign. The page features the ladies cosplaying, which is a big part of my life:

Everyone will also have their names posted in the "Thank You" section of the magnifiqueNOIR website once the campaign is over! Also, if the campaign exceeds the initial goal and I'm able to look into creating more merchandise for the girls, everyone who pledged will get a discount code for my online store so they can get these brand new perks at a lower price! I will keep in touch with all backers to let them know if/when that happens.

As you explore the perks, you'll see that each one comes with various items, and you can check out those items in full detail below:

Sizes:

Prints A and M = 11 x 17

*Photo A will be 4 x 6 for the perk "Not Ready for a Commitment Yet"

Prints B, E, F, I - L, O = 8.5 X 11

*other sizes will be updated once I get confirmation from the artists

Here is a sketch of what Print D will look like:

 

What is a Hug Me Hero?

Hug Me Heroes are soft and cuddly friends that you can add to your collection or snuggle with whenever the mood suits you. They are similar to teddy bears, only they look like your favorite characters. In this case, they will look like the ladies of magnifiqueNOIR! Since they are handmade, there will be a very limited number of them. This picture shows a sketch of what one will look like, along with an example of a finished Hug Me Hero.

What will the pillows look like?

There will be sketches of the planned pillows soon, but they generally come out looking like this:

 

The Incredible Artists

Wonder who's behind all the art you've been seeing? Here is a nifty little list! These are just the artists who have produced art for the series so far, so the list is subject to change as more artists are added to the roster. Keep in mind, the more funding we get, the more art we can acquire for the book and for prints!

  • MuseTap Studios - Print A and M  
  • NamiOki - Print B and C  
  • Radiant Grey - Print M  
  • Berry Blitz Studio - Print D and O  
  • The Art of Dave Branch - The black and white image of Lonnie facing a monster
  • Graphite Punch Illustration - Print N  
  • Cosmicheroart - The postcard set
  • Nozomi Neko - Button Set 2  

 

Reaching Beyond the Stars

So let's say the Indiegogo is SO successful that we go beyond the initial goal. Beyond looking into having the pictures in the book be fully colored, here are a few things I have planned for the future:

1. MORE ART

I'd love to feature even more art in the book and offer new pieces as prints. Here's an example of what's to come from the lovely Sakura Mochi Panda:

2. COMIC BOOKS

I actually have TWO ideas for potential comics. One would be a fun series of one-shot tales of the girls everyday lives. This includes monster battles, fandoms, crushes, and other trials and tribulations that they face. These little comics would be illustrated by me! Originally, I was going to include them in the novel, but after giving it some thought I felt that it would make the book feel a bit too cluttered. So instead, I want to have individual issues of these little comics. Here's an example of a story that would be told:

The second comic book idea would be a more serious story. It would serve as a prequel of sorts and tell the story of how Marianna became Galactic Purple: the leader of magnifiqueNOIR. I would collaborate with an artist and write the script for the comic while they illustrated the tale.

3. ART BOOK

I ADORE art books and have several from my favorite series. I would love to have a book full of the art that spans through the magnifiqueNOIR universe. The book would include art from the various artists working on the project, concept sketches of the main characters, and concept sketches of some of the side characters you meet along the way. 

4. COLORING BOOK

Since I already have coloring pages that I've done of the girls, I want to do more pages and turn them all into a coloring book. This would let you color in your favorite magical girl, and may include an encouraging word or two to remind you of how magical you are.

5. MORE CRAFTS

This is sort of a general goal of wanting to make more unique merchandise of the magnifiqueNOIR brand. This would include things like plushies, pillows, charms, bags (make up and/or pencil), and other things that I will have available at conventions and on the website.

  • Bag Mock Up:

​

These are just five examples of what the future potentially holds for magnifiqueNOIR. There are other things I plan on looking into such as bath products and even clothing that represents the magnifiqueNOIR brand! Let's see how far we can take these girls!

#magnifiqueNOIR when sharing and discussing online!

  • magnifiqueNOIR Facebook
  • Briana's Facebook
  • Briana's Twitter
  • Briana's Tumblr
  • Website

 

Risks and challenges

There are a great number of risks when it comes to self publishing. Beyond the lingering stigma, there’s a chance that this book series could be overlooked. There’s a chance that it won’t sell to anyone beyond this month long project and it’ll be left in the back of my closet. There’s a chance that I won’t get into all the conventions I’ve tried for, which would limit the amount of promotion I want to do.

On a more personal note, while there is support for queer voices of color, there are a lot of people who may not give this project a chance simply because of the race and sexual orientation of not just the lead characters, but of myself. That’s something I have to face as a black, queer writer, but if nothing else, it’s taught me to be persistent.

I’ve been going to conventions across the country with my work, giving panels on diversity, and working to make myself a person who stands out -- and I aim to make that shine through with my work. I plan to have a major focus on this series -- not just as a book, but as a brand. I plan on having books along with expanded merchandise of the ladies, moving beyond just printed and paper items.

I'm already well into planning my convention season for 2017. I am confirmed for some already, as either an artist with a table or a guest, and the registration period for several others will open up soon. Given my track record of selling at conventions and how many there are, I have no doubt my schedule will be full before I know it. I already know that I have an audience that I've built up over the last few years with conventions and my social media presence and I've had success with my previous novel sales at each convention. 

Currently, the book is being editing, as the first draft was finished before the launch of this campaign. The reason why the actual release is in June is so that there will be time to edit, format, and get the book as close to pristine as I can for publication. That should also, hopefully, give me enough time to get it printed and to get everything in from the artists I’ve chosen to work on this. I will keep everyone up to date along the way and be transparent about everything, so if something happens to slow down the release, the backers will be the first to know.

Thank you for checking out my Indiegogo, and don't forget: you are magical.
