I will keep in touch with all backers to let them know if/when that happens.As you explore the perks, you'll see that each one comes with various items, and you can check out those items in full detail below:Sizes:Prints A and M = 11 x 17*Photo A will be 4 x 6 for the perk "Not Ready for a Commitment Yet"Prints B, E, F, I - L, O = 8.5 X 11*other sizes will be updated once I get confirmation from the artistsHere is a sketch of what Print D will look like: What is a Hug Me Hero?Hug Me Heroes are soft and cuddly friends that you can add to your collection or snuggle with whenever the mood suits you. They are similar to teddy bears, only they look like your favorite characters. In this case, they will look like the ladies of magnifiqueNOIR! Since they are handmade, there will be a very limited number of them. This picture shows a sketch of what one will look like, along with an example of a finished Hug Me Hero.What will the pillows look like?There will be sketches of the planned pillows soon, but they generally come out looking like this: The Incredible ArtistsWonder who's behind all the art you've been seeing? Here is a nifty little list! These are just the artists who have produced art for the series so far, so the list is subject to change as more artists are added to the roster. Keep in mind, the more funding we get, the more art we can acquire for the book and for prints!

MuseTap Studios - Print A and M  

NamiOki - Print B and C  

Radiant Grey - Print M  

Berry Blitz Studio - Print D and O  
The Art of Dave Branch - The black and white image of Lonnie facing a monster
Graphite Punch Illustration - Print N  

Cosmicheroart - The postcard set


Nozomi Neko - Button Set 2  
 Reaching Beyond the StarsSo let's say the Indiegogo is SO successful that we go beyond the initial goal. Beyond looking into having the pictures in the book be fully colored, here are a few things I have planned for the future:1. MORE ARTI'd love to feature even more art in the book and offer new pieces as prints. Here's an example of what's to come from the lovely Sakura Mochi Panda:2. COMIC BOOKSI actually have TWO ideas for potential comics. One would be a fun series of one-shot tales of the girls everyday lives. This includes monster battles, fandoms, crushes, and other trials and tribulations that they face. These little comics would be illustrated by me! Originally, I was going to include them in the novel, but after giving it some thought I felt that it would make the book feel a bit too cluttered. So instead, I want to have individual issues of these little comics. Here's an example of a story that would be told:The second comic book idea would be a more serious story. It would serve as a prequel of sorts and tell the story of how Marianna became Galactic Purple: the leader of magnifiqueNOIR. I would collaborate with an artist and write the script for the comic while they illustrated the tale.3. ART BOOKI ADORE art books and have several from my favorite series. I would love to have a book full of the art that spans through the magnifiqueNOIR universe. The book would include art from the various artists working on the project, concept sketches of the main characters, and concept sketches of some of the side characters you meet along the way. 4. COLORING BOOKSince I already have coloring pages that I've done of the girls, I want to do more pages and turn them all into a coloring book. This would let you color in your favorite magical girl, and may include an encouraging word or two to remind you of how magical you are.5. MORE CRAFTSThis is sort of a general goal of wanting to make more unique merchandise of the magnifiqueNOIR brand. This would include things like plushies, pillows, charms, bags (make up and/or pencil), and other things that I will have available at conventions and on the website.Bag Mock Up:​These are just five examples of what the future potentially holds for magnifiqueNOIR. There are other things I plan on looking into such as bath products and even clothing that represents the magnifiqueNOIR brand! Let's see how far we can take these girls!#magnifiqueNOIR when sharing and discussing online!
magnifiqueNOIR Facebook
Briana's Facebook
Briana's Twitter
Briana's Tumblr
Website
 Risks and challengesThere are a great number of risks when it comes to self publishing. Beyond the lingering stigma, there’s a chance that this book series could be overlooked. There’s a chance that it won’t sell to anyone beyond this month long project and it’ll be left in the back of my closet. There’s a chance that I won’t get into all the conventions I’ve tried for, which would limit the amount of promotion I want to do.On a more personal note, while there is support for queer voices of color, there are a lot of people who may not give this project a chance simply because of the race and sexual orientation of not just the lead characters, but of myself. That’s something I have to face as a black, queer writer, but if nothing else, it’s taught me to be persistent.I’ve been going to conventions across the country with my work, giving panels on diversity, and working to make myself a person who stands out -- and I aim to make that shine through with my work. I plan to have a major focus on this series -- not just as a book, but as a brand. I plan on having books along with expanded merchandise of the ladies, moving beyond just printed and paper items.I'm already well into planning my convention season for 2017. I am confirmed for some already, as either an artist with a table or a guest, and the registration period for several others will open up soon. Given my track record of selling at conventions and how many there are, I have no doubt my schedule will be full before I know it. I already know that I have an audience that I've built up over the last few years with conventions and my social media presence and I've had success with my previous novel sales at each convention. Currently, the book is being editing, as the first draft was finished before the launch of this campaign. The reason why the actual release is in June is so that there will be time to edit, format, and get the book as close to pristine as I can for publication. That should also, hopefully, give me enough time to get it printed and to get everything in from the artists I’ve chosen to work on this. I will keep everyone up to date along the way and be transparent about everything, so if something happens to slow down the release, the backers will be the first to know.Thank you for checking out my Indiegogo, and don't forget: you are magical.

story:
Story of My Book

Frameworks for Impact fellows summarizes on how nation can be built bottom up taking the advantage of technological revolutions. It helps to create platform of social entrepreneurs for the experts of various industries who are committed to build sustainable societies to direct their creative thinking. I am connecting dots to start my own government consulting company 5 years down the time line to build small but self sufficient and sustainable communities.

My name is Ramakrishna Doppalapoodi and I am the author of Frameworks for Impact fellows. I wrote it because with the knowledge I gained over the years I spent in understanding what strategies corporate companies adopt in solving their problems good at to propose innovative technology driven solution to help people who want to create positive impact on the world and explain ways to get past the bureaucratic leadership that is crippling the ability to solve the social problems.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover importance of understanding the social context of culture and history rather than just imitating the economic development models of different countries. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for smart communities. Smart communities make tactical use of Industry 4.0 technologies to help decentralize the economy so that more importance is given to the efficient use of local resources and innovation without having to rely on high investments in infrastructure development. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to use various frameworks to contribute to the institutional development to build sustainable communities, considering the notion that sustainability and happiness have to be quantified.

In this book, you'll learn why is emotional investment is important in building nation, how internalizing the concept of social enterprise is more important to interest groups, civic organizations, businesses and governments, and how ancient war strategies are relevant in solving complex problems even today and help us in building smart societies, towns, municipalities, or cities:
  • Ancient India and effect of invasions on India: Beginning from Alexander's invasion in 326 BC, crossing the river Indus he advanced towards Taxila, till British left India in 1948, India was under constant invasion. Renowned economist Utsa Patnaik in her research “Agrarian and Other Histories” mentions that over roughly 200 years, the East India Company and the British Raj siphoned out at least $45 trillion from India. But what was lost is more than wealth, wisdom. But fortunately there are still nuggets of wisdom intricated in the Indian culture and it is wise to glean that wisdom without having to reinvent the wheel.
  • Is democracy a disaster: On June 26, 1975, Indira Gandhi persuaded President of India Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed to declare a national emergency, which empowered her to do whatever she considered best for the country for at least six month. Gandhi announced her Twenty-Point Program soon after the emergency was proclaimed, and most points were aimed at reducing inflation and energizing the economy by punishing tax evaders, black marketers, smugglers, and other real criminals. Prices did come down, production indexes rose dramatically, and even the monsoon proved cooperative by bringing abundant rains on time for two years in a row. But there were pitfalls that can't be filled.
  • How is Social Enterprise relevant: Fundamentally there is less difference among Businesses, Government and NGOs. They all have resources and they have to effectively utilize to make society more livable. Difference is objectives. Businesses are profit driven. NGOs are service driven. Governments have to balance both. Rana Sen, MD in Deloitte Consulting LLP’s Public Sector practice, is among the corporate leaders who are part of major government transformation initiatives across varied and multiple program areas, such as smart city, administration, public health, and human services.
You will love this book if you are consultants in corporate companies working for governments clients, or if you want to experiment with your own capabilities by setting up own organization to solve the problems in society using technology or if you are impact fellow especially political entrepreneur.
Frameworks for Impact fellows is a non-fiction book that speaks to people who want to contribute or take lead in createing positive impact on the society who are looking at smart communities, Gross Social Progress and social capital, emotional investment, and use of Industry 4.0 technologies and frameworks to achieve economic independence for the first time.

The Book - Frameworks for Impact fellows


The book is written in 5 Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters. This part talks about the opportunity gap in building sustainable societies. It also talks about the cultural history and importance of understanding the cultural history, and social background for adopting economic development programs. India case study.

Part [2] contains Chapters [4-6] -talks about the importance of understanding need for NGOs depending on economic conditions, role played by government, and availability of resources. It also talks about the net negative contributions made by NGOs.

Part [3] contains Chapters [7-9] - talks about the objectives of corporate companies and strategies in solving the problems most efficiently. How these private companies without the social enterprise framework introduce more problems in solution of one problem.

Part [4] contains Chapters [10-11] - talks about the role of politicians and increasing challenges they face living the life of leader. How conveniently obstacles for sustainable societies are ignored while appeasing the majority and creating active factions to fight for them.

Part [5] contains Chapters [12-15] - I proposed a new approach to driving impact in our world through combining tools and approaches from successful corporate companies, civil organizations, political parties.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Oct 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Ramakrishna Doppalapoodi is young professional who has work experience in technology consulting in both start and multinational company with international work experience. By combining his many years of corporate experience and grassroots political campaigning to increase voter participation in India, he is now working towards building various technology tools to support governments to foster sustainable growth. As he graduates from Georgetown University in May 2020, his mission is to build smaller units of technology driven sustainable societies that are self-sufficient economies centered around happiness index to make great nation.

He is curious about building institutional frameworks that are both fundamental and crucial for the global sustainability.

In previous life, while Ram spent much of his time on being socially acceptable person by focusing on earning money, and social status, he also learnt the art of decoding the implicit assumptions behind people's opinions. He debated with people for more than just fun, and took the role of devils advocate to understand whys more than just whats and hows of their actions. While he collected amazing experiences both professional and personal, he was able to design mental map of what could be his role in creating the positive impact on the society.


For more information you can connect with Ramakrishna Doppalapoodi at rd1021@georgetown.edu and @ram_doppalapoodi on social.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FrameworksForImpactFellows #WireframingSmartGovernance and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ramakrishna Doppalapoodi

story:
Summary

Copy Cat vs The Bullies is a book about a young cat named Copy who has trouble thinking for himself.  He always followed the other animals and only did whatever they did until one day, Copy started following the wrong kind of kids.  Copy Cat vs The Bullies is a book about being true to yourself and standing up to do the right thing.

About the Author

Blair Kitchen is a classically trained animator (that means pencil and paper like the old days).  He lives outside of Toronto, Canada in a small town called Carlisle, where he works as a storyboard artist and animator for many studios, including Dreamworks, Warner Brothers, Disney, Blue Sky, and many more.  Blair is also the creator and artist of the self published comic series called The Possum (which you can see below!)  To see more of Blair's work, visit www.possumpress.com

What We Need & What You Get

This book has been FUNDED on Kickstarter, so it WILL happen!  We are making a beautiful Hard Cover Edition with a full colour Dust Jacket and 34 full colour illustrations as seen here.  Now is your chance to get in on all of the rewards that were offered in the original Kickstarter campaign!

Studiocomics Press will be printing 600 copies (or more) of this first printing Kickstarter/Indiegogo edition with your help, and once printed, I will be signing and mailing to each backer, personally.

Where This Book Came From

Shortly after my wife, Rochelle and I were married in 2000, I found out that I had a liver condition that would one day require me to have a liver transplant.  In 2012, that day came.  I am an Animator and Storyboard Artist by trade and have a hard time sitting still and not drawing, so while I was in the hospital and recovering, unable to work I wrote and illustrated 50% of this book.  It sat unfinished in my studio as life once again became busy, raising 3 children, coaching hockey and working as an animator and storyboard artist to support my family.  5 years after my initial transplant, problems occurred and I was forced to undergo yet another liver transplant.

Since I found myself, again, bed ridden and recovering, I decided it was time to finish the book I had started in the same hospital it all began in, 5 years earlier.

Now all the artwork is completed and I am once again a busy father and husband, raising 3 (growing) children, supporting my family as an animator and storyboard artist.  Life is good!!

Rewards

Complete POSSUM comic collection

Bookmarks

Watercolour Sketch!

Stretch Goals:

$7500 Total Funding (UNLOCKED!!!)

That means that this book WILL be made! Thanks to everyone who helped us get to this $7500 goal!

 

$10,000 Total Funding (UNLOCKED!!!)

If we reach $10,000 total funding, everyone who is receiving a Copy Cat book, will receive a Copy Cat sticker sheet with 4 Copy Cat stickers on each sheet.   Lets keep this momentum going!!

This is a mock up only. Images may change (only for the better though!!!)

Risks & Challenges

Since 99% of the artwork is completed for this project and it has been successfully funded on Kickstarter, there are very little risks, other than me getting hit by a bus and not being able to sign the books. (In the case of both my wife and I getting hit by the same bus, my children will have to take on the task of mailing all of the books to each of you fine backers, I like our chances of things working out!)

I have put a lot of time, and hard work into this project and after self publishing 5 comic books and being a professional animator for over 20 years, I know what it takes to see projects to completion. I am determined to see this through. Thanks again for reading this far!

See you on the other side!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by sharing on social media and other platforms.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Story of My Book

The L’Enfant Inquiry is the first Agents of Ezra Adventure. Join John Ezra and his partner Davy as they follow a centuries-old trail of breadcrumbs left by the founding fathers, as they move a device designed as a failsafe, against foreign invaders around the nation’s capital. The Agents of Ezra must find the device before it falls into the wrong hands, destroying the very country it was designed to protect.  

My name is J. Howard Harrington and I am the author of The L’Enfant Inquiry. I wrote this book because I felt an energy from the first moment I caught wind of a peculiar moment or odd historical figure in a new town. I knew this energy was a story that had yet to be told. This book is that energy coming to life, and I hope you join me on the adventure.  

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover history you had never heard of, look at things in a new way, and wonder “What if?” more than ever before. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with actual history in an entertaining and leisurely way, as a chance to escape the wall around us and travel somewhere unimagined while having a few pieces of knowledge to take away because it is OUR history after all. 

THE NOVEL :

A secret device to stop the British. A message hidden in the base of the Washington Monument. A mysterious figure that could unlock it all leading to a cascade of clues that unfold a centuries-old plan. But can John Ezra stay alive long enough to uncover what he seeks in time? 

In the first Agents of Ezra Adventure, J. Howard Harrington’s Infinium Agent, John Ezra, is catapulted into a life of secrecy and adventure he would have never expected. From their headquarters deep beneath the national mall, they search for a device that relies on Ezra’s crack team of experts to read between the lines of history. Did an earthquake provide the first clue, or was it just good timing? Why would the nation rebury a man a century after his death in a location more prestigious than all the nation’s presidents? 

The search for answers whisks John Ezra into a brutal game of intrigue, adventure, and gunfight. One which squares him off against an ambitious organization called The Inquiry and their muscle, the Colonel, who stands to gain as much as there is to lose if The Agents of Ezra don’t succeed. Traveling from the posh tree-lined cobblestone streets of Georgetown to a location none of us would expect, Ezra and Davy will confront the shocking realities that have been hidden in plain sight and the possibilities they can unleash on us all.


You will love this book if you love discovering the unknown, are intrigued about secret agencies that exist right below our feet, or are someone that takes life by the horns and seizes adventure. The L’Enfant Inquiry speaks to the secret spy in us all, as well as any armchair adventurers who want to grapple with adventure hidden in our very own history, while also discovering the untold and unnoticed in a new way. 

Ultimately, I hope that The L’Enfant Inquiry inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What else is hiding in plain sight, only hidden by time? 
  • Who among us is secretly working for a secret agency?
  • What other events and plans are boiling just below the surface in our world that could change our lives as we know them?  

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing history both obscure and well known in a modern context will change us all for the better. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in Late April 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this SPRING! 


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

HIGHLIGHTS:

  • At the 5-Book Level: Part of YOUR name will be used in the next Agents of Ezra Adventure as a person or place. (Example: Ezra stopped at the intersection of Harrington and Howard, Jay's voice still coming from the storefront as he fled.)
  • At the AUTHOR CHAMPION Level: A Minor Character will be inspired by you in the next Agents of Ezra Adventure. (How many people do you know that are the inspiration for a character in a book? Now is your chance!)


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book, immortalized in a book forever!
  • If you purchase TWO copies, YOU will be specially acknowledged as an Honorary Agent of Ezra for The L’Enfant Inquiry adventure in my book!
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

J. Howard Harrington is a bestselling author, economist, and thanatologist who takes every opportunity to seek out the untold and find obscure and exotic adventures, whether nearby or in far-off lands. 

Discovering our communal history and making it relatable through the eyes of action and adventure allows all of us to discover OUR history. J. wants all of us to find a connection point to both the world we live in and where we have been and hopes that something great will be sparked in doing so. 

Coming from humble beginnings in the rolling, golden valleys of the Midwest, where adventure and history are only found if you know where to look, J. Howard Harrington developed the ability to find real, historical facts that would have a lasting impact. He has made it his mission to use these incredible discoveries and intertwine them with fantastic adventure, creating a narrative that is hard not to be absorbed by and impossible to put down. 

For more information, you can connect with J. Howard Harrington at jhowardharrington@gmail.com, on his website jhowardharrington.com  and on Instagram at @authorjhharrington. You can also follow him on Facebook at Author J.H. Harrington, where you can keep up with the progress of his ongoing works and get sneak peeks of what is next. 


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheLEnfantInquiry or #AgentsOfEzra and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
J. Howard Harrington

story:
I wrote a book!

Hellu! My real name is Sarah, but I'm also known as Rufi Angel, the webcomic artist and writer of Serpamia Flare. (I'm a storyteller at heart!) 

The Lethian is my first full-length young adult novel, and is a martial-arts fantasy based in a contemporary setting. It's about a teenage girl who takes up a mystical form of martial arts to avenge her murdered sister, and save her kidnapped brother. Here's the blurb on the back cover:

When nine year old Sharie loses her family to the city's most prolific crime syndicate, Baklei, it ignites in her a howling thirst for revenge.

In pursuit of strength, she becomes the first disciple of Jeremiah, a Lethian martial artist. When Sharie becomes a Lethian Novice at sixteen, Jeremiah is called back to the Academy and Sharie must return to the city. Against his orders she jumps into the DKC, Baklei's underground fighting circuit, in her search for her sister's killer. Determined to take back what she lost, she is drawn into a deeper world of drugs, prostitution, and brutality...

If you haven't seen the trailer video at the top of the page, on YouTube, or on Vimeo, please take a look!

The Lethian is around 600 pages of fast-paced action, and it took me three years to write and edit. It does have some violence and a few darker hints of the adult world, so I'd recommend it to readers aged 15 and up. If you like fast-paced action with a touch of depth and fantasy, and a dash of grit and mystery, then this is the book for you!

The book is ready to go, but I need funds to do a print run. Technically I don't have to do a print run at all because I could just make it an e-book, but I'd really gosh darn like to! And so, I humbly ask you to consider taking part and supporting this campaign to help this book reach physical form.

(Here's a brief peek at the novel cover!)


Where your support comes in

I'm printing this book in a softcover trade paperback format, using a local printer in Hong Kong. Here, as in most places around the world, printing a 600 page novel is expensive. The more copies I print, the lower the cost per book, so I am basing my current price estimates on printing at least a few hundred units. I'll adjust according to how the campaign goes! :)

Every bit of support will go straight to printing costs, and if I don't manage to raise the full amount, that's okay - I will still print! If I reach the funding goal early, any extra money will go into printing it with tiny frills, funding new perks or buying choco. 

Want a sample of the writing in the book? No problem! I have a couple of sample chapters from the earlier parts of the novel for you to check out. :) Chapter Two, and Chapter Twelve.

 


What perks are you offering?

The pre-order prices are lower than the pending final prices for the e-book and softcover, so if you pre-order through this campaign then you are getting a nice discount! :)

If that isn't enough and you want some extra goodies to go in your bag, I have some of those, too! Alongside the novel, I am also working on two collections of bonus content - a digital art book, and Off The Record: deleted scenes and outtakes. 



The art book will have both my own artwork and some awesome contributions by very talented artists! It's projected so far to be around 30 pages+. Some completed works I already have include artwork by jjak, Anjing, Deji, BlueTen, thumbjr, kaalashnikov and rtil. The rest are coming along and are still under the hood - once I start getting completions I'll be updating this list! (New additions: Mothtrap, Matt Knab, Alicia, CiciEnixa, Rinkel, Spelledeg, HapyCow, seabiscuit, LeRenardRoux, HeSerpenty, Damatris, Saari, TheD-Wrek, Confettirainbowpony, kara, EcM!)

The art book will be available as a downloadable freebie after the preorder campaign is over, but the everyone who picks up the Lethian Maven Perk during the preorder campaign will instead get a 'deluxe' edition that includes:

- everything in the regular artbook

PLUS

- my rough sketches of characters and scenes
- discarded character designs
- 3-panel gag comics (3koma) starring the characters (sample below!)

Off The Record: deleted scenes and outtakes will not be freely downloadable after the campaign, and it will only be available to those who pick up the Lethian Maven Perk during the preorder campaign. It will be a collection of scenes I deleted from the book, with short commentary by me as to why it was removed. It will include:

- 'missing scenes' that didn't make the cut
- scenes that were just never meant to happen
- a 'director's commentary' about the ending of the story and other alternative endings

There may be extra perks depending on demand, so feel free to voice out opinions!

 Know anyone who might like 'The Lethian'?

I would hugely appreciate it if you could get the word out for this campaign! Tweet it, tumblr it, share it on Facebook, print it on a shirt and wear it to work - honestly, I'll be happy for all the help you can offer. :) 

Helping to get the word out on this project could also win you an art commission, so please check my DeviantArt journal entry here for details!

I didn't write this book all on my lonesome; many people helped out and contributed to make it real. Getting the book out there requires so much more than just me! Thank you so much for your support!

story:
To Bleed or Not to Bleed takes you on an up-close and personal journey with Håvve Fjell’s internationally renowned performance group, Pain Solution. Covering the period from 2003 until 2015, told in the words of the performers themselves, and seen through the lens of award winning photographer Helene Fjell, this book is a must have for aficionados of sideshow, body art, extreme performance, and powerful photography.


This is the third book by the brother and sister team of Håvve and Helene Fjell. Their first book: Ten Years of Pain (Hertervig Forlag, 2003), covered the genesis and early years of Pain Solution. The second book: Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly, (PS Media, 2012) was an award-winning look at the body suspension group Wings of Desire that Håvve founded in 2002. To Bleed or Not to Bleed picks up the trail of Pain Solution where the first book left off. In the last decade, Pain Solution has grown and morphed into something larger than Håvve. The intensity remains but the group has become more playful, funny, whimsical, and accessible with the addition of The Maniac and The Princess of Scars to complement The HeadMaster, Håvve.

To Bleed or Not to Bleed covers the trials and triumphs of Pain Solution through its second, exciting, and challenging decade of bringing their unique talents to the stage. It is the story of a lone performer who grooms two protégés to stand as equals at his side and, in the process, creates something larger than any of them could have made on their own. Håvve’s words (with contributions from The Maniac, and The Princess) combined with Helene’s striking and insightful photos provides you with a rare glimpse into these unique performers who give everything for their art.


With layout of this brilliant synthesis of words and images executed by the acclaimed Trine + Kim Design Studio, this book will be a work of art in itself. After two years of pre-production, sifting through thousands of images, and a painstaking process of converting thoughts and feelings to text, what we need now is your help to make the last, crucial bit happen. Yes, as you guessed, we need a little bit of your money but—in true Pain Solution style—you can expect to get back more than you give!

Who are we?

Håvve Fjell is the founder and driving force behind Pain Solution. Håvve’s uncompromising insistence on keeping it real underlies the essence of the troupe that he founded. Pain Solution, while performing all over the world for 25 years, has never ‘faked’ an act. Håvve insists that everything the audience sees on stage—shocking, amazing, and entertaining—must be real. It has earned him and the troupe that he founded utmost respect in the field of sideshow and body art performance. Additionally, Håvve has worked with psychologists and members of the Mental Health Services in his home country of Norway to help shed a more nuanced light on pain related subjects from pain management to self-harm. For Håvve, Pain Solution is more than a company of performers. Pain Solution is his calling. This is something he needs to do. It is both entertainment and a message to the world about the unacknowledged benefits and little understood power of pain, blood, humor, and entertainment.

Helene Fjell works as a freelance photographer, notably with fine art photography. She has followed Håvve’s work and the development of Pain Solution from the very beginning. Helene is more than a photographer; she has an extraordinary way of displaying the emotions and spirits of the people and surroundings in her photography. Her work is powerful, personal, intimate, and gives a sense of immediacy. In addition to numerous gallery shows in Norway and features in Scandinavian photography magazines, she has had exhibitions as far afield as Japan, Australia, and the USA. Helene’s massive archive of Pain Solution work is central to the production of To Bleed or Not to Bleed. For her previous collaboration with Håvve, Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly, she received an Honorable Mention from International Photography Awards (2013) and was a winner of the 2013 PDN Photo Annual award for photo books.


Trine + Kim Design Studio have been working with Pain Solution since 2007 using their exceptional talent and creativity to carve out a distinct visual profile for Pain Solution. Since founding their company in 1999, they have worked tirelessly producing work for some of Norway’s most notable artists, theaters, galleries and  publishers. They are perhaps most famous for their work producing album covers for groups such as Ulver, Mayhem, Darkthrone, Solefald, Shining, and more. Their attention to detail and exquisite design helped to make Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly the truly beautiful book that it is. Pain Solution is overjoyed to have them onboard again to package the text and images of To Bleed or Not to Bleed into a unique, superbly crafted work of art.

June Ailin Bonsaksen  will be reprising the Project Manager role that she excelled at through the making and shipping of Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly. Every great artist and successful project team should be lucky enough to have someone to help them keep their metaphorical wheels on the rails! For To Bleed or Not to Bleed, June is the person holding everything together and making sure that order prevails. June began working for Håvve as a volunteer in 2007. She quickly moved from running errands and selling merchandise to her position as the Pain Solution Secretary. Since then, she has been the administrative engine at the heart of Pain Solution where she manages the websites, merchandise and book orders, volunteer crews, Wings of Desire suspension events, and PS Media projects with style and grace.

Alan Louis Belardinelli is an American expatriate living in Oslo. He has long experience working with communications including work as a corporate spokesperson, lyric and speech writing, authoring and editing documents and plans, translating Norwegian to English, and proofreading English written by non-native speakers. He is a team leader in the Wings of Desire suspension crew and has worked with Håvve for years on many different projects. Alan edited Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly and has a knack for leaving the author’s voice as intact as possible while making sure that grammar is being reasonably respected and that sense is still being made.


What We Need & What You Get

Living in Norway is a blessing and a curse. While Norway is one of the world’s best countries to live in, it is also one of the most expensive. We have made the decision to produce the book locally so that we can both support local printers and have the highest possible level of quality control. We need your help to pay for printing and distribution of To Bleed or Not to Bleed.

We are proud to say that we have received initial support from The Arts Council of Norway to get us rolling. We used most of that money to upgrade and update our old and slow hardware and software, as well as covering other pre-production costs. We still have a lot of expenses to cover and for this we need your help. 

We are not, however, asking you to give us money for nothing! We are offering you the chance to pre-order your signed and numbered copy of To Bleed or Not to Bleed at a special pre-order price and throwing in some extra perks as well! We know this book will be great. Our first two publications received acclaim and awards, and we feel this will be our best work yet!

The money we raise through this campaign will cover editing, production management, design, printing, binding, and shipping of this one of a kind book. That said, almost the entire cost is printing and shipping.  

Our dedicated designers, Trine + Kim Design Studio, have been working with Pain Solution for years and have previously donated their time and skills at a symbolic rate. This time around, we have calculated a decent, while still modest, fee for their amazing work. 

Alan and June, who love this book, are working at the nicest possible rates doing Editing and Project Management work.  

Neither the photographer nor the author will profit until this project is printed and delivered.


Help us make history!

Your contribution enables us to leave a trace in history. Books that document working sideshow or the life of a modern Fakir are few and far between. This book is important because it is one of the few, and even fewer high quality, records of a little appreciated but powerful art form and the people who dedicate themselves to it.

PS Media is an independent publisher. We formed PS Media so that we could bring our last book out on our own terms and loved the result. Crowdfunding individual projects makes sense for us because this is not our day job. Having our own publishing company allows us to produce work that might not have a chance to see daylight otherwise. The last time around, we had a successful campaign and produced an award-winning work of art. This time, we are aiming for even more.


Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges we faced in making a book for the first time, was the fact that the book ended up being a big, heavy piece of art that cost us a lot more in shipping than we had calculated. Since our friends and fans are spread throughout the globe, shipping of that artifact became a real issue. With the help of our friends we made it work but it was a source of a lot of stress and frustration. This time around, we worked hard to calculate weight and shipping into the budget. We made sure the book got lighter and that the overall dimensions work optimally for bulk shipping.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to support us right now, we hope that you will help us to spread the word about this book! There is famously little money in the underground: we know. Get your local tattoo or piercing shop to order some copies (for the lobby and for you to buy when you have the cash). Get a group of your very busy friends to jump into the campaign as a Giver or Caretaker and ask for a copy for doing the legwork. Get your grandmother to support us and send the perk to your address. Pester your librarian to buy a copy so that it can fall into the right hands some day!


Reviews for Ten Years of Pain

“This really is a remarkable book. My review does not do it the justice it deserves. I literally believe it is the only book that has been able to take such a snapshot. I do not believe that any body modification book collection can be called complete without this book, and I believe this is essential reading for anyone involved in performance or body art as well as those interested in art history and body-art/modification/play-history.”

—Shannon Larratt, BMEzine
Full review

“The exploration of physical pain as such, is nothing new. But with the update Håvve Fjell, with various co-performers, has given it through the past ten years, where the extreme physical experience has taken the shape of an independent artistic medium of the same caliber as painting and video art, Pain Solution places itself—as the bearers of a tradition as old as the species- actually, in all senses, at a point in the outer marginal one have to define as ‘cutting edge’. Pun intended.”

—Tommy Olsson, Kunstkritikk.no
Full review (Swedish)
English (via translator)

To Bleed or Not to Bleed takes you on an up-close and personal journey with Håvve Fjell’s internationally renowned performance group, Pain Solution. Covering the period from 2003 until 2015, told in the words of the performers themselves, and seen through the lens of award winning photographer Helene Fjell, this book is a must have for aficionados of sideshow, body art, extreme performance, and powerful photography.



This is the third book by the brother and sister team of Håvve and Helene Fjell. Their first book: Ten Years of Pain (Hertervig Forlag, 2003), covered the genesis and early years of Pain Solution. The second book: Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly, (PS Media, 2012) was an award-winning look at the body suspension group Wings of Desire that Håvve founded in 2002. To Bleed or Not to Bleed picks up the trail of Pain Solution where the first book left off. In the last decade, Pain Solution has grown and morphed into something larger than Håvve. The intensity remains but the group has become more playful, funny, whimsical, and accessible with the addition of The Maniac and The Princess of Scars to complement The HeadMaster, Håvve.
To Bleed or Not to Bleed covers the trials and triumphs of Pain Solution through its second, exciting, and challenging decade of bringing their unique talents to the stage. It is the story of a lone performer who grooms two protégés to stand as equals at his side and, in the process, creates something larger than any of them could have made on their own. Håvve’s words (with contributions from The Maniac, and The Princess) combined with Helene’s striking and insightful photos provides you with a rare glimpse into these unique performers who give everything for their art.


With layout of this brilliant synthesis of words and images executed by the acclaimed Trine + Kim Design Studio, this book will be a work of art in itself. After two years of pre-production, sifting through thousands of images, and a painstaking process of converting thoughts and feelings to text, what we need now is your help to make the last, crucial bit happen. Yes, as you guessed, we need a little bit of your money but—in true Pain Solution style—you can expect to get back more than you give!

Who are we?





Håvve Fjell is the founder
and driving force behind Pain Solution. Håvve’s uncompromising insistence on
keeping it real underlies the essence of the troupe that he founded. Pain
Solution, while performing all over the world for 25 years, has never ‘faked’
an act. Håvve insists that everything the audience sees on stage—shocking,
amazing, and entertaining—must be real. It has earned him and the troupe that
he founded utmost respect in the field of sideshow and body art performance.
Additionally, Håvve has worked with psychologists and members of the Mental
Health Services in his home country of Norway to help shed a more nuanced light
on pain related subjects from pain management to self-harm. For Håvve, Pain
Solution is more than a company of performers. Pain Solution is his calling.
This is something he needs to do. It is both entertainment and a message to the
world about the unacknowledged benefits and little understood power of pain,
blood, humor, and entertainment.

Helene Fjell works as a freelance photographer, notably with fine art photography. She has followed Håvve’s work and the development of Pain Solution from the very beginning. Helene is more than a photographer; she has an extraordinary way of displaying the emotions and spirits of the people and surroundings in her photography. Her work is powerful, personal, intimate, and gives a sense of immediacy. In addition to numerous gallery shows in Norway and features in Scandinavian photography magazines, she has had exhibitions as far afield as Japan, Australia, and the USA. Helene’s massive archive of Pain Solution work is central to the production of To Bleed or Not to Bleed. For her previous collaboration with Håvve, Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly, she received an Honorable Mention from International Photography Awards (2013) and was a winner of the 2013 PDN Photo Annual award for photo books.

Trine + Kim Design Studio have been working with Pain Solution since 2007 using their exceptional talent and creativity to carve out a distinct visual profile for Pain Solution. Since founding their company in 1999, they have worked tirelessly producing work for some of Norway’s most notable artists, theaters, galleries and  publishers. They are perhaps most famous for their work producing album covers for groups such as Ulver, Mayhem, Darkthrone, Solefald, Shining, and more. Their attention to detail and exquisite design helped to make Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly the truly beautiful book that it is. Pain Solution is overjoyed to have them onboard again to package the text and images of To Bleed or Not to Bleed into a unique, superbly crafted work of art.

June Ailin Bonsaksen  will be reprising the Project Manager role that she excelled at through the making and shipping of Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly. Every great artist and successful project team should be lucky enough to have someone to help them keep their metaphorical wheels on the rails! For To Bleed or Not to Bleed, June is the person holding everything together and making sure that order prevails. June began working for Håvve as a volunteer in 2007. She quickly moved from running errands and selling merchandise to her position as the Pain Solution Secretary. Since then, she has been the administrative engine at the heart of Pain Solution where she manages the websites, merchandise and book orders, volunteer crews, Wings of Desire suspension events, and PS Media projects with style and grace.
Alan Louis Belardinelli is an American expatriate living in Oslo. He has long experience working with communications including work as a corporate spokesperson, lyric and speech writing, authoring and editing documents and plans, translating Norwegian to English, and proofreading English written by non-native speakers. He is a team leader in the Wings of Desire suspension crew and has worked with Håvve for years on many different projects. Alan edited Wings of Desire: Learning to Fly and has a knack for leaving the author’s voice as intact as possible while making sure that grammar is being reasonably respected and that sense is still being made.

story:
What's Our Story?

Music and art can inspire real change.

Based on the transformative power of sharing and creating stories, Saga is connecting people to each other and the planet.

Together, we build communities that promotes openness, creativity and change. We want you to come as you are, and we want you to leave as a changed person. 

In Iceland, we have been told by scientists, writers, politicians and community leaders that our world is suffering from large-scale challenges like climate change. But many feel that these issues are "too big" to change, and that there isn't much we can do to build a more thriving and just world.

But we will not idly stand by and accept this fate. 

We know that a small group of people, driven by shared purpose, can truly catalyze large-scale movements. They always have. Our vision is to help create this community through arts, music and storytelling.

Together, we can re-author our narratives.




Saga Fest

Creating a Cultural Movement and Shift


On May 23-24, the local community is coming together to co-create the founding year of an arts and music festival on the Stokkseyrarsel sustainable farm in Iceland. 

The festival serves as a space where people can collect and share stories, and build authentic connections to each other and nature. It will be focused on vulnerability, community, sustainability and transformation.

Through the efforts of more than 100 volunteers, Saga Fest will feature 65+ artists and musicians from 13 countries, including local showcases of artists and musicians from the villages of Eyrarbakki (pop. 570) and Stokkseyri (pop. 455).

There will be more than 15 workshops for festival-goers to participate in and more than 65 immersive art and musical experiences.

The festival is largely participatory, which means that we encourage people to take ownership of the festival's overall direction and experience.

We are committed to ideating and co-creating the festival in partnership with the local community.

We do this through monthly Town Hall meetings where we invite the local community—farmers, local business owners, educators, youth, government officials and artists—to dream up the festival with us.






Saga Fest Artist Residency

Supporting innovative, community-focused artists 


During the week before the two-day festival, a group of 11 artists from six different countries will come together at the Saga Fest site.

The artists will hold workshops with local youth (aged 11-15) from the Árborg region to create original artwork to be exhibited and performed at Saga Fest. 

These workshops will take place on May 20th in Selfoss and are free to youth participants. The artwork created by the students and visiting artists will be displayed and performed from 3-5 p.m. on Sunday, May 24th at Saga Fest. 

Your contribution will assist us with powering this year's festival. As a founding year supporter, you will be a part of the Tribe that will help make this annual festival a continued reality. 







Saga Summit

Connecting to Others, Purpose and Nature


Provided at no cost to a group of 25 Iceland-based entrepreneurs, artists, chefs, musicians, farmers, storytellers and activists, we gathered this small group of leaders in the village of Ríf located at the base of Snæfellsjökull. 

After six months of work, three facilitators working from the USA, Denmark and Iceland designed and launched a 4-day immersive experience called Saga Summit.

Participants were also encouraged to ideate on projects that they could collaborate on together, and at least four (4) campaigns and projects were created as a direct result of Saga Summit.

Your contribution would go toward supporting these campaigns and projects, and the continuation of existing social enterprises and pop-up experiences that were workshopped during Saga Summit.





Saga Media

Community-Driven Storytelling for Causes


Imagine a crowd-funding platform like IndieGoGo, but supporters submit high-quality audiovisual content instead of dollars. Non-profit organizations would be able to create campaigns around causes and collectively source knowledge and content from people around the world.

This kind of initiative would not only help cut costs for non-profit organizations with limited resources, but it also helps movements tell more inclusive and well-rounded stories. We also believe that all multimedia collected on such a platform should be open-sourced and available for any non-profit to use, free of charge.

Capitalizing on experiences like Saga Summit and Saga Fest, we hope to not only create spaces of story sharing, but also capture stories in various media forms: photographs, audio and film. 


Funding

What happens to my contribution?




Saga is a registered not-for-profit entity based in Iceland focused on creating initiatives that build communities and promote sustainability.


Reaching our goal of $7,500 will help us work toward fully funding this year's initiatives.


Crowd-funding $10,000 will allow us to transition into year two with a built community, collective power and proof of concept. This is our ideal situation and would allow us to be best set up for success.


Every other dollar above $10,000 will go toward providing additional direct support to the local farmers of the Stokkseyrarsel Farm through:

  • Wetland restoration efforts
  • Environmental education programs
  • Improving the farm's sustainable practices and reducing its carbon footprint
  • Organic food production for local community


Founder's Note

Saga Fest was catalyzed after an experience in Jordan freestyle rapping at a cave near Petra. I wrote about the experience on Medium, which you can read here: https://medium.com/@scottshigeoka/taking-the-leap-34074661c688

Unable to ignore a rumbling and intuitive feeling within me, I consciously decided to take the leap and follow my dream path of launching Saga in 2014. The serendipitous and magical experiences that have happened throughout this journey has validated that choice. A group of us has truly come alive this past year, and we have seen this ripple effect into the local community.

Supported by fellowships from Fulbright, MTV and National Arts Strategies, I departed for Iceland in the autumn of 2014. 

We have thankfully received overwhelming support from the local communities of Eyrarbakki, Stokkseyri and Selfoss. 

I am so grateful to ideate, co-create and build this experience alongside a beautiful founding organizing team. This is a group of people who are so committed and aligned to a collective vision. We are family.

Finally, none of this would be possible if it weren't for the generous contributions from the family living on the sustainable Stokkseyrarsel Farm. I am so grateful and inspired by their commitment to the local community and hands-on involvement in the project. A heartfelt thank you to Þórólfur, Svava, Raga and Siggi.

Even if you are not able to contribute to this campaign at this moment, I hope that you will at least take with you the inspiration and invigoration to go out and do something that makes you truly come alive. 

This is exactly what the world needs. Let's re-write our future.

More information: 

www.sagafest.is

Purchase your tickets here:

www.midi.is/event/1/8755/Saga_Fest

Example Press:

"Not Your Usual Festival: Saga Fest," Iceland Review, May 2015

"Saga Fest Wants You to Be Vulnerable," Reykjavík Grapevine, April 2015

"Saga Fest: The Sustainable Festival," WOW air in-flight magazine, March 2015

"Love peace and happiness at Saga music and arts festival this spring in South Iceland," Iceland Magazine, February 2015

"Leaps of Faith: Saga Fest," Arts Entrepreneurs, February 2015

story:
Hi, I'm Rebecca Bruner, A Fresh Voice for Timeless Truths. I write speculative fiction from a Christian world view. While several of my short stories have been published in online magazines and anthologies, Welcome, Earthborn Brother is my first novel-length work of  speculative fiction. This book is a fast-paced, science fiction adventure for middle grade and young adult readers.  Allegorical elements and Christian themes, like forgiveness and loving your enemies, are woven throughout the story.

I've been working on this novel since my son was in fifth grade. Now, he's about to graduate from high school. My dream is to publish Welcome, Earthborn Brother before he graduates in June 2015.  Over the years, many kids of various ages have read the manuscript and fallen in love with the story. You can help me reach my goal of getting this book into the hands of young readers everywhere.

About this Novel:

What if you discovered that your own mother was an alien?

Eleven-year-old Ayden Livingstone only learns that his mother is an extra-terrestrial after she's been taken captive by Reuben Jaeger, a ruthless alien-hunting, government investigator. On his quest to rescue his mother, Ayden must join forces with the father he never knew existed. In the process, the boy will uncover truths about his identity and abilities that he could never before have imagined.

Where the Money Will Go & What You Will Get

  Money raised through this campaign will be used for: 
  • Professional Editing.
  • Cover Design.
  • Professional Book Formatting.
  • E-book Formatting.
  • Printing and Shipping.
  • Promotional Video.
  • Indiegogo and Pay Pal Fees.

In exchange for your support you will receive a variety of rewards including:

  • Copies of the E-book.
  • Softbound Copies of the novel.
  • Autographed copies of the novel.

The Impact

The speculative fiction being offered to our kids today is too often dark and cynical, painting the future as a spiritual wasteland filled with violence and despair. By helping with this campaign, you can promote a young sci-fi lover’s enthusiasm for reading by putting a story into his hands that is both exciting and uplifting. Help make the positive message of hope and redemption in Welcome, Earthborn Brother available to young readers everywhere.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by telling other parents, grandparents, teachers, home educators and science fiction lovers about this campaign. Use Indiegogo's share buttons to spread the word on social media. Most of all, you can pray for the success of this effort to provide young readers with edifying speculative fiction.

You can help me reach my goal of getting this book into the hands of young readers everywhere.About this Novel:
What if you discovered that your own mother was an alien? Eleven-year-old Ayden Livingstone only
learns that his mother is an extra-terrestrial after she's been taken
captive by Reuben Jaeger, a ruthless alien-hunting, government investigator. 

On his quest to rescue his mother, Ayden
must join forces with the father he never knew existed. In the process, the boy will uncover truths about his identity and
abilities that he could never before have imagined.

   Where the Money Will Go & What You Will Get 

Money raised through this campaign
will be used for: 


Professional Editing. 
Cover Design.
Professional Book Formatting.
E-book Formatting.
Printing and Shipping.
Promotional Video.
Indiegogo and Pay Pal Fees.

In exchange for your support
you will receive a variety of rewards including:

Copies of the E-book.
Softbound Copies of the novel.
Autographed copies of the novel.

  The Impact 

The
speculative fiction being offered to our kids today is too often dark and cynical,
painting the future as a spiritual wasteland filled with violence and despair. By helping with this campaign, you can promote a young sci-fi
lover’s enthusiasm for reading by putting a story into his
hands that is both exciting and uplifting. Help make the positive message of hope and redemption in Welcome,
Earthborn Brother available to young readers everywhere. 
  Other Ways You Can Help 

You can help by telling other
parents, grandparents, teachers, home educators and science fiction lovers about this campaign. Use Indiegogo's
share buttons to spread the word on social media. Most of all, you can pray for
the success of this effort to provide young readers with edifying speculative fiction.

story:
ABOUT QUEER SENSE

Queer Sense, in brief, is a model that shows us how cultures, whether it be Iran, Russia, or even Indiana or New York City in the USA, shape attitudes towards LGBT people. The model is remarkable as it describes active factors that are shaping attitudes towards LGBT individuals: 

  1. Social models whether it is a person (Rachel Maddow or one's parent for example) or an institution (the Republican Party or Human Rights Campaign)
  2. The emotional connections we make with those models, aka attachment (close relationship with one's parent or your political party)
  3. The language we use with those social models (homosexual lifestyle versus gay relationships)


WHAT SETS QS APART FROM TRADITIONAL QUEER THEORY?

Queer Sense is the first theory in the literature that not only describes the interaction of three factors that shape attitudes towards LGBT, but it is the only model that specifically gives credit to the power of language. Language is a tool that all people and institutions use when discussing dynamics associated LGBT issues. For example, a church states that marriage is between only a man and woman, a conservative TV host calls gay people homosexuals, a political party candidate states "I'm against any laws that give special attention to gay or transgendered people."

Language is not just expression, but it affects our attitudes on a daily basis whether we know it or not: "That's so gay"; marriage equality; gay union; fag; queer; straight; coming out; bend over and take it; gay rights; homosexual lifestyle; gay agenda ...


WHY CROWDFUNDING?

Queer Sense will change how we think about the influence of culture. It will make people more aware of the necessary factors to foster LGBT acceptance. 

For instance, we can look at schools with Gay Straight Alliances (GSA) which reduce bullying, lower mental health problems associated with alienation of LGBT people and prevent suicide. This is not all though.  A GSA make LGBT people visible, opened conversations to LGBT issues, give an opportunity for LGBT identified students to openly connect to not only other LGBT-identified students but to supportive heterosexual students, teachers, and parents. GSA in school systems foster better awareness of the language used on a daily basis and provide active social models for both heterosexual and LGBT students.




ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Bryce is a Kansan, psychologist, author, and LGBT activist who came out three times in a row when he was 13 years old, but rejection led him back into the closet until his late 20s, or the year of 2000. When he came out in his late 20s he discovered several of his old friends had turned their backs to him because they rejected his gay identity. One very close evangelical friend promised to be his friend if only Bryce "never acted on any tendencies" and lead a straight life. Bryce realized he was alone on a new path that no one else could understand, or could they?
Bryce searched to connect to people in his community who used a positive language when discussing the LGBT community. He traveled to San Francisco where he discovered a culture that was the opposite of the Midwest. Social models who had positive attitudes towards LGBT people were abundant in this culture, a positive language was used when discussing the LGBT community, heterosexual people were overwhelming supportive of LGBT rights, and there was more access to LGBT support groups.
Several years later Bryce reflected on his experiences and developed his model called Queer Sense. Queer Sense is a model that helps us understand how culture shapes attitudes towards LGBT individuals. The striking feature of Queer Sense are the three factors that are constantly at work in any given culture whether it be in Kansas or San Francisco: social models, connections to social models, and the language we use our social models.

WHAT'S THE BEST SENSE? EQUALITY! MAKE SENSE?


THANK YOU

By taking the time to even check out my campaign, means a tremendous amount to me.  Each contribution not only helps you gain more awareness, but your support also will help get me one step closer to my ultimate goal; put Queer Sense in classrooms across the World!

story:
This is a series with an on-going mystery of who is the ruler of a force of supernatural, mythical creatures from myths unknown by most of the world. Four teenagers, randomly chosen are summoned by a greater being known as the eye. Each of the “Chosen” are decided to be mentored by one of the Greek Gods as they are taught the ways of the elements before the first strike of the “Corrupted” is attempted. This series I’m working on has been an idea in my head for months now and my thoughts are that it’d draw a lot of the attention of watchers for Supernatural, The Last Airbender, and even the famous cartoon Naruto. The idea of martial arts in movies has spread along with comedy, superpowers, and mystery; which I‘ve also added into my writing. I have enough ideas for 15+ seasons. My name is Brandon J. Smith. I’m 14 years old and on my way to being, possibly, the youngest screenplay writer ever. I’ve only started recently to put into action typing out screenplays after learning some things from my parents who are getting one sold of their own. I’m constantly working on the sitcom and have already completed 6 episodes. I am currently completed 1 episode every 3-5 days. PLEASE SUPPORT ME IN MY QUEST TO BECOME THE YOUNGEST SCREENWRITER IN HISTORY!

 

The money will be used to:

Acquire a professional web page                                         $1048

Register my screenplay with Writers Guild of America East      $132

Copyright each individual episode as one individual script      $725

Purchase a Mac Computer                                                  $1800

Purchase a copy of FinalDraft screenwriting software               $250

Purchase tickets to a professional screenwriting seminar         $450

Purchase Skype review from Michael Elliott                            $595 

Travel to New Orleans in August 2012 to attend the Script to Screen Seminar by Michael Elliott and to attend the Pitch Session.                  $5000

Please send all of your prayers my way and if you are able to a financial contribution as well. Don’t forget to mention this campaign to all of your friends.

story:
The Story

Three years ago I took a big leap. I decided to turn my five years of blogging at Radical Doula into a book. A book written for doulas, laying out the basics of many of the things I saw missing from traditional doula trainings. Things like race, class, power, gender, sexuality, disability, incarceration and immigration. How all of those things shape the experience of pregnancy in the US, and most importantly, how it should inform our work as doulas. I reached out to my community, to all of you, to get the funding together to get that book printed. 

Fast forward three years...the response has been amazing. I've sold 1500 copies of The Radical Doula Guide, and gotten great feedback from doulas around the world about the impact the book has made on their work. 

I'm almost out of books from the first two printings (the second of which I funded myself from savings), and I'd like to print more and expand this project's reach, so I need your help. 

What I Need & What You Get

I'd like to print another round of books, here are the details:

  • Some books will be sold to individuals and others will be donated to organizations or individuals who can't afford to buy the books on their own.
  • I dream of setting aside a few boxes of books I can give away to groups providing full-spectrum or volunteer doula services, to doulas of color, to queer doulas, to the people who will make this movement better by joining it.
  • It costs about $2,500 just to print and ship a new set of 1,000 books to me for distribution. It is no secret that small self-publishing operations are costly.... 
  • But the great news is I only need 250 pre-orders from this campaign to get that completely covered!

And this is the best part: 

I'm offering a special discounted price for this round of the fundraiser--only $10 a copy (usually they sell for $12). 

The Impact

I'm most excited about the donation part of this campaign. I want to make sure everyone who wants a copy of The Radical Doula Guide has one, regardless of ability to pay.

With your help, we can make that happen! You can purchase donation copies of the guide through this fundraiser and I'll hang on to them to distribute to groups and individuals in need. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, spread the word to friends, family and social media about The Radical Doula Guide. It's a great time to get a good deal on the book if you know folks who would benefit from it.

Sample tweets/facebook posts:

More copies of The Radical Doula Guide = more activist doulas for #reprojustice! Support @radicaldoula's fundraiser: http://igg.me/at/RDGreprint

Help @radicaldoula make sure everyone who wants a copy of the Radical Doula Guide can get one: http://igg.me/at/RDGreprint #doulas #reprojustice 

Make sure doulas understand the political context of pregnancy & birth! Support @radicaldoula's fundraiser: http://igg.me/at/RDGreprint 

What Readers are Saying

“As a “primer” pointing outward to further exploration, The Radical Doula Guide is lovingly crafted and inspirational. It’s definitely a must-have for any (personal or institutional) collection with a focus on reproductive justice issues.” -Anna J. Cook, the feminist librarian

“A must read for anyone interested in doula work or in the birth and parenting community!” -Jillian L. Schweitzer

“An easy-to-understand, inclusive, and short introduction to diversity, privilege, and power issues relevant to providing full-spectrum pregnancy support. I bought a copy because it feels good to have this kind of book within easy reach on my shelf, even though I’m just now exploring an interest in birth activism. The sections on ability, size, and age gave me food for thought.” -Goodreads reviewer Zigforas

"This lil primer covers BIG issues that all my other doula training books seemed to have missed. So glad to have found words for my misgivings with other hetero-normative, gender essentialist, "colorblind" readings. Highly recommend to doulas and future doulas." -Goodreads reviewer Jenna Walthour

4.39 out of 5 stars on Goodreads!
