story:
hi, i am Elsa from Estonia and i am writing a book in English.

truth being said . . .

I NEED A TRIBE TO BIRTH THE BOOK IN ME.

i don't think we need to do this important work alone. definitely not in isolation. but instead together to support one another.

HERE'S WHAT I CAN OFFER.

i will bring you real stories from real people with real lives which all sum up my broken life only to show how everything in our life has gifts to give.

no fiction. only the unspoken.

i will tell unique stories never told before.
stories that touch our humanness, our brokenness.

the book LOVE OR FEAR: THE JOURNEY INTO THE UNKNOWN is an epic story of the clash between the mind and the heart, and how fears learn to love.

by reading my words you might, and possibly will, unlock your potential, your unapologetic, unpolished truth. and your honesty will come out and play.

 

speaking about our experiences gives a voice to the voiceless parts within ourselves.

BY MATT KAHN

who's it for?

most importantly, its for people who seek a message . . . 

  • of hope
  • of faith
  • of trust

and its for you if . . .

  • you seek to be seen
  • you seek to be heard
  • you seek to be honest
  • you seek to feel relaxed
  • you seek to speak your truth
  • you seek to unravel judgement
  • you seek to love deeper and be loved
  • you seek to be fearless in your choices
  • you seek to balance the mind and heart
  • you seek to cut negative voice in your head

and as a bonus . . .

  • you seek to have healthier relationships in all areas in your life - with partners, friends, family, and coworkers.

buy the book →

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

the promise

the first draft of the book is 30% written with an extra 70% to go.

when the first draft gets finished, then draft by draft i will refine it to up-level the reading experience for both of us.

yeah, it's a long journey but one worth taking.

once ready, i will publish it, i will ship it.

hopefully, in 2022 or at the latest in 2023, you get to hold the book in your hands. i will do my best to make it happen.

the invitation

i hope you'll join me . . .

LETS BRING THIS BOOK INTO THIS WORLD.

i tried doing it alone, and it got me here → I NEED A TRIBE.

i truly believe ...

→ together its easier
→ together we are better
→ together there's magic

i think we can help each other.

LET'S HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER →

buy the book →

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

can you ship it?

the book LOVE OR FEAR: THE JOURNEY INTO THE UNKNOWN is my roadmap to see how fears learn to love.

this book is the breath i breathe. it's my life's work.

it's the message i need the most.

it hurts to see how we hurt ourselves.
and i am here doing something about it.

my intention is to tell stories that whispers these words to the pain within us all . . .

 

its okay. your pain is okay. whatever happened, happened. you've done nothing wrong.

FEEL THE WORDS

 

in celebration for that, my book starts with a line, here's my story, and it end with a line, what's your story?

and i say yes, with the support of a tribe, I WILL SHIP IT.

buy the book →

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

risk it - i need your help

if this Indiegogo campaign will reach the minimum, then i get to swap my dying laptop, and while i write the book, on monthly bases i will bring you 1 to 4 real stories from real people with real lives on how fears learn to love.

if this campaign will smash the minimum, then i have a shot at working with a good editor who will help make the book worth your attention, your time, and your money.

if this campaign will not reach the minimum, backers will be charged, and backers will get all their perks. the book will be written and shipped as promised. but getting a new laptop to exchange the dying one is under question. also, i don't get to work with an editor.

PS.

BECOMING A MEMBER OF THE TRIBE, TO RECEIVE STORIES BY EMAIL, IS OPTIONAL. YOU GET TO SAY YES OR NO WHEN BACKING UP THE CAMPAIGN.

buy the book →

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

book synopsis

in the book LOVE OR FEAR: THE JOURNEY INTO THE UNKNOWN i will tell a story of an orphan, me - elsa saks, who at age 8 got adopted into an emotionally dysfunctional family environment; who in her mid-twenties took her 75-liter backpack and left the known, in search for love, for meaning in life.

first, for 2.5 years, she traveled with money. then, for the next 3 years, she traveled with no money.

it was then when in the magic of the unknown she met the world of infinite generosity.

fearless, then fearful she did what only few have ever done.

  • 6 years
  • 33 countries
  • 4 continents
  • few language skills
  • hundreds of helpers
  • 10’000 km on a bicycle
  • 36 months moneyless through 27 countries

this video illustrates the joyful side of the adventure i took between the dates june to november 2015. the story covers my first five months through six countries on a bicycle in central america.

buy the book →

the tribe

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

the book LOVE OR FEAR: THE JOURNEY INTO THE UNKNOWN is my first step towards the vision i have for the project LOVE OR FEAR: BE HEARD. BE SEEN.

the project LOVEORFEAR.CO brings a message to this world that fear is only here to make us better. that fear is not your enemy. that fear is a beauty within you that asks to be loved as only you can love it.

in LOVE OR FEAR we bring our fears into the light where they belong.

the mission

we go where's fear and lead with courage.

 

the vision

fears learn to love through a simple power of storytelling.

the project LOVE OR FEAR: BE HEARD. BE SEEN. is the home where blame ends, minds relax and hearts open.

in LOVE OR FEAR . . .

→ your thoughts are safe
→ your feelings are safe
→ your story is safe

 

its okay. your pain is okay. whatever happened, happened. you've done nothing wrong.

FEEL THE WORDS

 

no story is too big.
no story is too small.

in LOVE OR FEAR, your fears are loved.

come as you are. be who you are.

lets bring our fears home into the light where they belong.

 

we connect → we speak up + we feel → we heal


we will do it together because together we are better.

how to join?

when you back up the project you can choose, yes or no, to enter the mailing list to receive real stories from real people with real lives on how fears learn to love.

or you can sign up in LOVEORFEAR.CO right now.

by joining you become a member of the tribe LOVE OR FEAR.

once you've signed up, you'll get 1 to 4 stories in a month. in those stories i invite your honesty and truth to come out and play.

  • i will say the unsaid
  • we will play with intentions
  • we will tap into new perspectives
  • we will kickstart new beginnings

i will refrain myself from telling you what to do. instead, i will share what i have experiences. simple as that.

join the tribe →

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

stories loved

here's a list of recent stories loved by the tribe.

  • risk it.

  • comfy-privileged

  • fifteen days. tick-tock. tick-tock.

  • shared gifts

sign up now →

LETS HEAL THROUGH STORIES, TOGETHER.

who's the girl?


i am elsa from estonia.

i am a writer. a traveler. and a lover.

i am also, a proud gay woman who happens to be happily single.

i spent my first 8 years in an orphanage. then, the next 18 years at a home wherein 5 years at a corporate job. and then, the next 6 years abroad. from which 10’000 km on a bicycle, and 36 months moneyless through 27 countries.

my certifications are my lifelong experiences.

i have no diplomas. no fancy papers. just life itself, the greatest teacher of all.

my hearts desire is to listen and to see how fears learn to love.

ps. this one is a state-secret ― the project LOVE OR FEAR is what i need the most. each day i show up to go where’s fear and lead with courage, hopefully, together with you.

pss. currently i live in Estonia at my parents home.

how to back it up :)

€10 STORYWEEK

WHAT: 7 STORIES (AUDIO + TEXT)
HOW: EMAIL
ONE STORY: ~10 MINUTES
ALL STORIES: ~70 MINUTES
LANGUAGE: ENGLISH

do you feel heard and seen by you?
and what about others, do you feel heard and seen by them?

i didn’t. not by me. not by others.

and do you know who you really are?
what about others, do they truly know who you are?

again, i didn’t. i had no clue whatsoever.

here, through honesty, i help you to see you, and as a byproduct, it helps you to see others too.
 

get the StoryWeek →

€25 THE BOOK: LOVE OR FEAR

LANGUAGE: ENGLISH

hi, i am Elsa from Estonia and i am writing a book in English.
truth being said . . .
I NEED A TRIBE TO BIRTH THE BOOK IN ME.
i don't think we need to do this important work alone. definitely not in isolation. but instead together to support one another.
HERE'S WHAT I CAN OFFER.
i will bring you real stories from real people with real lives which all sum up my broken life only to show how everything in our life has gifts to give.
no fiction. only the unspoken.
i will tell unique stories never told before.stories that touch our humanness, our brokenness.
the book LOVE OR FEAR: THE JOURNEY INTO THE UNKNOWN is an epic story of the clash between the mind and the heart, and how fears learn to love.
by reading my words you might, and possibly will, unlock your potential, your unapologetic, unpolished truth. and your honesty will come out and play.
 
speaking about our experiences gives a voice to the voiceless parts within ourselves.

of hope

of faith

of trust

you seek to be seen

you seek to be heard

you seek to speak your truth

book synopsis
in the book LOVE OR FEAR: THE JOURNEY INTO THE UNKNOWN i will tell a story of an orphan, me - elsa saks, who at age 8 got adopted into an emotionally dysfunctional family environment; who in her mid-twenties took her 75-liter backpack and left the known, in search for love, for meaning in life.
first, for 2.5 years, she traveled with money. then, for the next 3 years, she traveled with no money.
it was then when in the magic of the unknown she met the world of infinite generosity.
fearless, then fearful she did what only few have ever done.

6 years
33 countries
4 continents
few language skills
hundreds of helpers
10’000 km on a bicycle
36 months moneyless through 27 countries

come as you are. be who you are.
lets bring our fears home into the light where they belong.

who's the girl?

i am elsa from estonia.
i am a writer. a traveler. and a lover.
i am also, a proud gay woman who happens to be happily single.
i spent my first 8 years in an orphanage. then, the next 18 years at a home wherein 5 years at a corporate job. and then, the next 6 years abroad. from which 10’000 km on a bicycle, and 36 months moneyless through 27 countries.
my certifications are my lifelong experiences.
i have no diplomas. no fancy papers. just life itself, the greatest teacher of all.
my hearts desire is to listen and to see how fears learn to love.
ps. this one is a state-secret ― the project LOVE OR FEAR is what i need the most. each day i show up to go where’s fear and lead with courage, hopefully, together with you.
pss. currently i live in Estonia at my parents home.

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Maham Kazmi and I am the author of It’s All in Your Mind which focuses on amplifying the impact of life-changing diagnoses and treatment on emotional wellbeing through the perspective of patients, caregivers, and physicians.

I wrote this book because I know how it feels to be overlooked. I have been the patient after a childhood accident left me on bed rest for months. I have been the caregiver when I had to take on more responsibilities and support my mother when she was sick. I am now working towards becoming the physician while seeking to change the emphasis that is put on emotional health.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the overlooked importance of emotional intelligence in healthcare. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for mental health. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you empower both yourself and the ones you love during times of difficulty and illness.

In this book, you'll learn about mental health in the realm of medicine and illness. You'll hear stories of people like...

  • Seth Rotberg, whose story emotionally coping with Huntington’s and eventually using his story to make an impact on others’ lives, highlights that one must embrace their life-changing diagnosis and use it as a catalyst to build upon their identity or work towards change. 
  • Sanath Kumar, whose story as the caretaker of his son Raghav (diagnosed with the rare disease GPX-4) focuses on the vital role of caregivers and how the light at the end of the tunnel is oftentimes perceptive and requires resilience to find.
  • Devon Werner, whose journey started as a caregiver for her mother and went on to become her physical therapist in the neuro-intensive care and trauma unit. Her story is inspiring as she applies her personal experiences to make a difference with patients specifically by employing transparency and genuine/personalized connections with patients.

 

You will love this book if you are, in any way, dealing with illness whether it be as the one directly affected, a loved one, or the person on the other end of the dynamic treating and working to heal the person. Additionally, the book tackles complex topics of psychological wellbeing and resilience and may be a good fit for people who are dealing with personal and emotional setbacks.

It’s All in Your Mind is a nonfiction book that speaks to patients, caregivers, and physicians who want to look at the intersection of physical and mental health in a new way to promote holistic healing.
 

The Book - It’s All in Your Mind


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1: “The Patient” contains chapters 1-5. This section focuses on how psychological wellbeing plays a crucial role in a patient’s recovery and quality of life while also empowering patients to find resilience, further their identity, and make an impact on others’ lives. 

 

Part 2: “The Caregiver” contains chapters 6-9. This section includes stories that highlight the importance of caretakers in the patient-physician dynamic and explain how they are the patients’ top advocate. These chapters also highlight sources of resilience to prevent caregiver burnout. 

 

Part 3 “The Physician” contains chapter 10-16. From exploring how physicians can move towards more compassionate and empathetic treatments for greater connection with patients to combating the stigma around physician burnout, this section examines the treatment and maintenance of mental health from a professional perspective. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021. 
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author 

Maham Kazmi is an incoming freshman at UCLA, studying Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology. She has a great interest in mental health advocacy as seen through her work leading Modern Divergence, an international nonprofit with over 200 members across 23 countries. From hosting podcast sessions to forging partnerships with organizations like Mental Health America, she has been able to make the change she wants to see in the world.

Her decision to write this book stems from her desire to draw more attention to the mental and emotional side of medicine primarily because in the future she wants to work with and positively impact patients as a physician.

Outside of her academic and work life, Maham lives with her parents, teen brother, younger sister, and cat. She loves going out with her friends, eating cold sugary snacks like snow cones, and scrolling through TikTok. 

For more information you can connect with Maham at mahamkazmi03@gmail.com.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • DM me with your shipping address and PayPal/Venmo information for the shipping fee!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it! I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

 

Please use #itsallinyourmind and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!


Tag: 
Instragram - @mkk.kaz/ @newdegreepress
Facebook - Maham Kazmi/ @NewDegreePress 
LinkedIn - Maham Kazmi/ @NewDegreePress 

 


Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

story:
Story of My Book

Coloring Ivory: The Intersection of Minority Politics, Business, & the Law is a book that combines personal stories and case studies within various areas and shows examples where minority politics, business, and the law intersect. 

My name is Irene Chun and I am the author of Coloring Ivory: The Intersection of Minority Politics, Business, & the Law. I wrote this book because I never saw myself represented or considered in minority politics in America and felt overlooked and not represented in the media, as well.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how minority politics, business, and the law not only influence each other but also depend on one another. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the intersection of consumerism, politics, and the law. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you learn the potential of changing heteronormative sects of society with the liberalization of information and voice that social media and technology has brought to this area.

In this book, you'll hear stories such as...

  • Considerations of feminism in the South Korean film industry, what defamation law has done to encourage intersectionality, how the South Korean legal system has failed or supported artists 
  • What minority influencers on TikTok, Youtube, & Instagram believe their contribution and influence is to corporate culture and national politics 
  • What it meant to be poor and without access to medication
  • Growing up as a minority creative and seeing particular identities over others
  • Asian Americans' positioning in American consumer culture and politics 
  • The relationship between identifying as disabled and being a part of corporate culture
  • Debating whether corporate marketing of disabled and other minority bodies is an indication of changing ideologies in more conservative sects of society, whether it is an act of good-will or simply for profit 
  • You will love this book if you are a creative, a business owner, or a minority justice advocate! 


Coloring Ivory: The Intersection of Minority Politics, Business, & the Law is a nonfiction book that speaks to creatives and business owners who want to look at their customer base and politics in a new way.

 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring 2021:

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Irene Chun is a senior at Georgetown University studying Interdisciplinary Studies in Law and Society (Government & WGST) while minoring in Regional Asian Studies and Disability Studies, and a student fellow in Global Performance Arts & Politics. She has spent the majority of her professional career in the government and research, working at the Department of Homeland Security, the UN, the House of Representatives, and various research centers like the Institute for the Study of International Migration. She has served as research assistant and teaching assistant to a number of esteemed professors at Georgetown University, ranging from business, law, sociology, to disability studies. Irene also is the CEO and founder of an educational consulting firm in New York City creating pro-bono educational plans and providing tutoring services for undocumented, mentally and learning-disabled minorities from pre-K to 6th grade. 

Irene wrote this book as a way to expand upon her initial thoughts regarding the intersection of business, minority politics and law that she had developed over time as a researcher and student. By mixing case studies with personal stories regarding how business has affected her life as a minority and what it means to be a minority creative, she politicizes the entertainment industry and social media. She asks the reader to reevaluate their understandings of what it means to be a minority and whether corporate interests are moral or in a gray area of moral responsibility. 

When not working or studying, she can be found at art museums, cooking, and taking photos of her friends on film cameras. As a pre-COVID travel enthusiast she hopes one day soon to be able to backpack from Amsterdam down to Greece as originally planned with her friends. 

For more information, you can connect with Irene at iyaec29@gmail.com and at @iy.chun on Instagram.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use#colouringivoryand tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
Thanks again,
Irene Chun

story:
The storyline

The Underdog Paradox chronicles the journeys of five entrepreneurs overcoming extraordinary adversity en route to building a brighter future for themselves and their communities. My name is Jamie Russo and over the past decade I’ve traveled from inner city schools to refugee camps, hospitals to prisons. Along the way, I’ve met some of the human beings behind the greatest comeback stories.

  • Marcus Bullock was 16 years old when he was sentenced to eight years in adult maximum security prison. Two decades later, Marcus is the founder and CEO of Flikshop, the mobile application keeping families connected to incarcerated loved ones.
  • Lual Mayen grew up in a refugee camp on the outskirts of Northern Uganda. After fleeing the violent civil war in South Sudan, Lual taught himself to write code and build video games. Today, he’s the founder and CEO of Junub Games, a mobile gaming company that builds games for peace and social impact.
  • Shavini Fernando was hiking through the hills near her hometown in Sri Lanka when she suddenly lost her breath. Rushed to the hospital, Shavini was notified by doctors that she had severe pulmonary hypertension and less than two years to live, due to a hole in her heart. Today, Shavini fights for her life, building medical devices at Oxiwear that monitor oxygen levels for patients with PH.

The Underdog Paradox is for anyone that enjoys a good underdog story. It is a book that will inspire modern day changemakers, activists, and aspiring entrepreneurs. Theses stories provide proof: no matter who you are, where you’re from, or what you want to be, you have the power inside yourself to put a dent in the universe.

 

The book contains five parts

Part 1 is about Hope. On November 15th, 1991, during the Second Sudanese Civil War, the Bor Massacre occurred, killing an estimate of 2000 civilians in Bor. The massacre was carried out by Nuer fighters from SPLA-Nasir, a faction of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army (SPLA). They were led by Riek Machar from SPLA and a militant group known as the Nuer White Army. That day, a woman made a narrow escape with her husband and two daughters. For 250 miles, she and her family traveled on foot in search of a place for refuge. The woman and her husband arrived at a small village called Aswa at the border near Northern Uganda. Her girls did not survive the trip. On that day, she bore a son. She named him Lual.

Part 2 is about Resilience. One evening, after watching the nightly news with his then five-year-old son, Marcus’s son asked him a question he thought he would have a ton of time to answer. Marcus thought the complicated questions typically came at eight or nine years old. But in that moment, Marcus’s son lay awake in bed and asked his father with a straight face, "Daddy, why did you go to jail?" He knew this question was coming, but in that moment it felt so rushed. Marcus cleared his throat, looked his son in the eyes, and told his son about the time that he was sentenced to eight years in adult maximum security prison when he was just 15 years old.

Part 3 is about Authenticity. Clarence grew up in a broken household in Atlanta, Georgia. His father abused drugs and alcohol, which his mother worked hard to keep her four children fed. “My father beat my mother every day for the first 15 years of my life,” Clarence recalls. “I sold drugs just to have enough money to eat and buy clothes.” Clarence lacked passion in the classroom and skipped school regularly, but made up for his lack of discipline on the basketball court. Eventually, basketball became Clarence’s ticket out of Atlanta. Later on, basketball offered Clarence opportunities that almost nobody would have ever seen coming.

Part 4 is about Humility. Manu moved from South Eastern France to the United States alone when he was 17 years old. Like many other international students, Manu struggled financially. He was restricted to working on campus, taking as many jobs as he could. He tutored classmates in math, physics, and computer science. He was an indoor soccer referee. You name it, Manu did it. Years later, while working at a prestigious consulting firm, a student contacted Manu, saying, “I’m $500 short on my rent this month. I’m going to get evicted, and I’m thinking about dropping out of school. Can you help?” In that moment, a fire began to burn inside Manu’s mind. It was a message that would completely transform Manu’s life, forever.

Part 5 is about Wisdom. Shavini Fernando was hiking through the hills near her hometown in Sri Lanka when she suddenly lost her breath. She was rushed to the hospital, where she was shuttled into emergency surgery. A few hours later, the doctors emerged. They notified Shavini that she was suffering from severe pulmonary hypertension and that an MRI revealed a hole in her heart. With less than two years to live, Shavini made it her life’s mission to find a solution. The story that follows is nothing less than extraordinary.
 

What I need to get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • My editor
  • Cover design
  • Layout design
  • Copyediting
  • Promotion efforts

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

 

I am offering exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. Here’s what you get:

  • A signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Your name appears in the acknowledgements section of my book “with Special Thanks to”
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript
  • The opportunity to give me feedback when I’m selecting my cover
  • A personal thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • And more!

 

About the author

Throughout my life, I have always enjoyed helping others. In my work, I have propelled under-resourced communities through organizations like BUILD, DEFY Ventures, SEED SPOT, Pursuit, and WeWork Labs. Along the way, I discovered extraordinary people sacrificing everything to build a brighter future.

For more information, you can connect with me via email jamierusso@hey.com and twitter @jamierusso.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please tag me and my publisher New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jamie

story:
Her Story

After 39 long years, Rebecca is finally turning 40.  We can't believe it. She's grown so much and has graciously and courageously made it through each birthday!  As she approaches this major milestone, she continues to embrace all that life has to offer and pursue her dreams. Her latest dream involves writing...and some of you know that my sister is a very gifted writer.  For her 40th birthday she is dreaming of participating in a creative writing workshop that is about discovering your own unique and powerful story.  It seems she may delight the world with the tale of Rebecca Ann Trobe. 

I LOVE this idea and thought I'd campaign on her behalf and give all of you an opportunity to help make this happen for her. 


The Details of the Workshop

Sharing Your Life Story: From the Page to the Stage

Everything in your life, from the mundane to the extraordinary, is a story waiting to be told. This workshop is an invitation to discover your own unique and powerful story. Michel de Montaigne, the great personal essayist, said, “Every man has within himself the entire human condition.” The intention of this workshop is for you to delve deep into your own personal narrative.

Writing from your deepest source, gain insight and self-understanding that can bring peace and healing. You will then make your words leap from the page to the stage, sharing them orally to uncover the power of story to transform your life and your listeners.

Through improvisation, writing exercises, and group discussion, you will find your authentic voice, along with an honest, organic way to express your truth. Ann Randolph creates a supportive, fun, and dynamic space to create. All levels are welcome. This is a workshop for those seeking to explore personal essay, memoir, solo performance, or the sacred practice of journaling.


What We Need 

The cost of the workshop is $800.

If you want to help celebrate Rebecca turning 40 -- donate to the workshop fund!  

Any contribution helps us reach our goal!  Give what you can...THANKS!  :)


Other Ways You Can Help

Send cards and birthday wishes to the birthday girl -  the big day is August 2nd

Everything in your life, from the mundane to the extraordinary, is a story waiting to be told. This workshop is an invitation to discover your own unique and powerful story. Michel de Montaigne, the great personal essayist, said, “Every man has within himself the entire human condition.” The intention of this workshop is for you to delve deep into your own personal narrative.

Writing from your deepest source, gain insight and self-understanding that can bring peace and healing. You will then make your words leap from the page to the stage, sharing them orally to uncover the power of story to transform your life and your listeners.

Through improvisation, writing exercises, and group discussion, you will find your authentic voice, along with an honest, organic way to express your truth. Ann Randolph creates a supportive, fun, and dynamic space to create. All levels are welcome. This is a workshop for those seeking to explore personal essay, memoir, solo performance, or the sacred practice of journaling.



What We Need 

The cost of the workshop is $800.
If you want to help celebrate Rebecca turning 40 -- donate to the workshop fund!  
Any contribution helps us reach our goal!  Give what you can...THANKS!  :)


Other Ways You Can Help
Send cards and birthday wishes to the birthday girl -  the big day is August 2nd

story:
ALERT: Although the novel was written for young adult (YA) readers, and the protagonist is a young adult, those who have read and critiqued it are over 30 years of age. They all called it a "good read" for any age level.

About the novel

The Dark Triumph of Daniel Sarkisyan is set in the little known, first Republic of Armenia (1918-1920). It’s a novel full of suspense, mystery and intrigue.

Daniel and his ten-year-old sister Mariam are alone in the world. They’ve been scrambling to survive the squalor of Yerevan, the new capital city which has been overrun with war refugees. When Daniel finally lands a job with the rich and powerful Gagik, he feels lucky. He quickly changes his mind. Within days, Gagik proves to be selfish, violent and just plain mean. Within a week, Daniel is caught in a dangerous, downward spiral of deceit, corruption and treachery. Within months, and against his will, he’s embroiled in espionage and murder.

Set against the deadly clash between the Ottoman Empire, the Soviet Russian Army, and the ill-fated optimism of a struggling new republic, Daniel races against time to protect his sister, uncover Gagik’s diabolical plot, and maintain his integrity in the face of overwhelming odds.

Note: Most of the research and outline has been completed for the sequel.

How the funds will be used

There are some things I can do myself (design of printed books, conversion to ebooks, and basic website design), but I need your help to finance a modest run of 100 books ($10 each, printed on the local university’s Espresso on-demand machine), website domain name, hosting, and ecommerce set-up ($750), Armenian translation ($600), a consultation with a book publicist ($600) and Indiegogo and transaction fees (depending on achieving the goal) for a total of $3,500. (As of January 22, US$1=C$1).

Note: You don't need a PayPal account to contribute; you can use a credit card that goes through PayPal.

About the Perks

Because of the limited options available in Indiegogo's Perk format, I will be sending an email to all backers when the project ends to confirm their language of choice (English or Armenian), and format for ebooks (epub or pdf). These are the approximate deadlines for publishing:

  • English: ebook in March 2013 and printed book in April 2013
  • Armenian: ebook in May 2013 and printed book in June 2013

What people are saying

After completing several drafts, I sent the novel to five well-read friends (two are Armenians) for a critique. They all responded enthusiastically and urged me to find a way to publish it. Here are their comments:

I liked that it was a historical setting, not a history lesson. Great story! I kept wondering if he was going to get caught! Great ending, too! —Terry W.

I've just now finished reading your novel and had to write to you to tell you that I think it’s great! As I knew next-to-nothing about Armenian history, I’m so impressed with all the research you did to contextualize the timeline, the characters, and the story. I now have a better understanding of some of the historical basis for why society in Armenia is as it is today. The story is engaging and the characters are both interesting and well-developed. It was easy to imagine them, and care about them/loathe them. —Pauline S.

It was full of suspense. Even when things were quiet, and you were describing characters or situations, I wanted to know: What’s going to happen next? —Lilia A.

When reading anything, I am very picky. I look for two things: content that keeps my attention, and that gives me new information. Your novel gave both of this to me, and even more. It was so interesting that I even read at night. I like it very much. I was surprised where you could find that much information (even many Armenian writers cannot do that), and I had the feeling of being proud to know you and being your friend. —Kamo M.

I just loved it! I kept rooting for Daniel, and hissing at that awful Gagik. I know it’s written for ‘young adults’, and I’m much, much older, but I really enjoyed it. I could picture everything so clearly and was carried away by the exciting story. Mariam was adorable—so feisty. I was sorry when it ended, and am looking forward to hearing more about Dani and Mari soon! —Linda M.

Read an excerpt.

Why Armenia?

I made several trips there as a volunteer for an international development agency, working with Armenians who were (and are) trying very hard to develop a civil society. I made many friends, know first hand the problems they are up against, and admire them greatly. The initiative for this book came from an effort to help a friend who has few resources and few prospects in life, and who will share in the profits of this novel. I stumbled across a YouTube video of a UCLA history professor, Richard Hovannisian, saying, “A lot of us don’t know about the founding of the first Republic of Armenia.” I certainly had never heard of it, and thought, What a fabulous setting for a suspense novel!”

Where in the world is Armenia anyway?

The book contains 3 maps, including a map of 1920 Yerevan, but here’s the 1919 map of Europe and Eurasia, showing Armenia (in orange) and Wilsonian Armenia (in apricot), as explained in the novel.

story:
Short Summary

When my partner had an accident and was in a wheelchair for a long time, and thankfully not forever I was required to care for him, our two beautiful children and earn an income. I became a Work At Home Parent and I have never worked so hard in a job before.

All our living expenses were now up to me whilst caring for my beautiful family. I spent many sleepless nights trying to get my business out there and even resulted making myself so sick I had to be hospitalised. I made a successful home business and now I want to help other work at home parents do the same. I want to published them at low prices to help get their businesses out there. I want to provide them with invaluable information from professionals that we wouldn't usually get to speak to. I want to provide them an ongoing community of never ending support and I want this to always be free to readers.

My dream is to create an online magazine to showcase and publish other WAHPs at very low rates (under $5) to help get their businesses out there as I know how hard it can be. This will be a monthly edition showcasing other work at home parents work and talent as well as including many editorials of successful WAHPs, interviews from some of the most known WAHPs, How Tos and much much more. Our content is being grown by the day by amazing people wanting to contribute to this magazine and help other work at home parents.

It is important that this magazine is an electronic and not printed edition as we are aware of the effects on the environment. We want to move forward with saving paper for future generations and our way to be able to contribute is making this an electronic publication and never printed to paper.

Your contribution small or large will be helping thousands of work at home parents trying to make an income for their families whilst still being able to stay at home with their much loved children. As this is an ongoing project you will be able to view your ongoing contribution and know you were a part of this amazing issue.

What We Need & What You Get

To get this project off the ground successfully we require $5,000.00 for software to develop the online magazine, set up a fully functional website where our writers have access to add content via the blogs section, a forum to interact with our readers and themselves, the plugins to have the magazine viewable from computers, electronic readers and mobiles. We also require a computer to replace the dinosaur I use now to run the software required to put this all together. We also require a small amount to be used to help us get the word out there to as many people as we can.

This is the first magazine of its kind to be published in Australia only. Not only do we have a great range of writers willing to contribute and share their wisdom we have features like no others. Small fees (less than $5.00) for WAHPs to be published, free classifieds, a monthly catalogue showcasing WAHPs products included in the magazine every month. We also have some fabulous individuals such as personal trainers, business advisers and more to confirm in the coming weeks willing to contribute and help.

If the full amount is not raised we can still use smaller amounts to pay for yearly internet hosting, software and advertising costs. All money raised no matter how small can help to make this magazine get started.

What you get? We want to help you and thank you for any contribution you can make! All contirbutors will be announced and thanked on our website and in our publications. We understand without your help this cannot happen and we will forever be grateful! Different perks will have more involvement with the magazine, please see below for more details.

The Impact

It is extremely hard starting your own business from home and letting the world know what you are doing. Advertising rates are so high most work at home parents can not even consider this option. We give the opportunity to advertise and showcase their businesses at free and very cheap rates. We understand how hard it is being WAHPs outselves and I want to make this easier for people starting out. There is so much talent to be shown from WAHPs, we want to find these people and share them to the world, as well as providing an ongoing supportive community to help them keep going with their journeys.

By contributing you are making this happen and helping thousands of parents. Not only by helping to get their business out there, make an income for thier families when it wouldnt be possible otherwise and stay at home with their children. You are also helping the readers find these talented people and purchase more affordable items that can cost huge amounts in department stores. WAHPs are known for finding ways to save on costs of production and passing these savings onto their customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute funds we understand. Believe us we do, otherwise we wouldnt be putting this campaign out there. There are other ways you can help though, that are free and require only your time. Help us spread the word about what we are doing and that we are accepting contributions for our start up costs. Indiegogo have numerous share tools that make getting the word out there easy.

Are you a WAHP who loves writing and helping others? We are always looking for parents wanting to write and be published with us. Any ideas you have that can help us help other work at home parents we would be grateful to receive so please get in touch with us.

story:
What's the Story Here?

Midnight Breakfast is the culmination of five years of discussion, collaboration, and elbow grease on the parts of Rebecca Rubenstein, Nevan Scott, and F. Taylor Pavlik. Our vision is to publish the kind of fiction, nonfiction, and interviews that spark a conversation and to deepen that conversation with visual art inspired by the authors' work. We want to build a diverse community of talented artists, and we want to pay them. Because art is hard work and we believe it should be compensated. This is why we need your help.

It would be easy to tell you the concept for our magazine and hope you get excited enough to support it, but we figure it's far better to show you. We've created and self-funded what we're calling Issue Zero, which you can enjoy enjoy here, featuring new writing from Jason Diamond, Eric Anthony Glover, Kima Jones, Matthew Salesses, and Benjamin Samuel; an interview between Lauren O'Neal and Callie Collins about Callie's experience co-founding the new independent press, A Strange Object; and illustrations accompanying every piece by Lyndsey Lesh, Jason Novak, Lara Odell, Nancy Smith, and Kristen Tomanocy.

Our plan is to publish six beautifully-illustrated pieces per month and to continue to make Midnight Breakfast free to read. We're betting that enough of you want to help us support the work of writers and artists like those in Issue Zero that we can make this plan a reality. If we raise our goal of $12,000, we'll be able to keep Midnight Breakfast alive for a year. All of the money you donate will go towards supporting the work of writers and visual artists and towards maintaining the website.

What Can I Do?

Donate! Even the smallest donations can make a huge difference. For those of you who can afford a little more, we've got loads of amazing perks from our generous friends and supporters in the literary community and beyond. (And as an extra token of our appreciation, for all donations over $20 we'll throw in a Midnight Breakfast bookmark, a temporary tattoo, and a thank you on the site.)

Another way you can help is by getting the word out. The more people who know about our campaign, the better our chances of succeeding. Post about Midnight Breakfast and link to our campaign (igg.me/at/mbfast) on Facebook or give us a shout-out on Twitter.

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please shoot us an email at hello@midnightbreakfast.com.

Thank you for taking the time to check out Midnight Breakfast and for your support. It means the world to us.

***

The Personalized Postcards Perk

Interested in our Personalized Postcards perk? Here's how it works:

If you select the Personalized Postcards perk, you'll be matched, at random, with one of the writers listed below. If your donation's absolutely, 100% based on a specific writer on this list, upon completing your donation, you may email Rebecca Rubenstein at rebecca@midnightbreakfast.com and request that writer. We cannot make any guarantees, but we'll do our best, and donors who specify will be matched on a first-come, first-serve basis. (To increase your chances of getting a postcard from the writer of your choice, donors who choose to email may send a list of up to 5 names. Please include your own name in the email. This perk is also transferable, so you can pay it forward and gift it to someone else, if you'd like.) If you do not wish to email and would like to be surprised, all the more power to you; every single writer on this list is amazing, and we would be thrilled to get a personalized postcard from ALL of them.

The following writers are participating in our Personalized Postcards perk: 

Our brilliant Issue Zero contributors Kima Jones, Jason Diamond, Matthew Salesses, Lauren O'Neal, Benjamin Samuel, and Eric Anthony Glover. 

We also have the participation of such excellent literary minds as: 

Rick Moody, Chris Abani, Jami Attenberg, Roxane Gay, Lincoln Michel, Megan Abbott, Saeed Jones, Yiyun Li, Jerry Stahl, Elissa Schappell, Gina Frangello, Isaac Fitzgerald, Ron Currie, Jr., Peter Orner, Laura van den Berg, Elliott Holt, Matt Bell, Maud Newton, Michele Filgate, David Gutowski, Melissa Febos, Owen King, Steve Almond, Joshua Mohr, Conner Habib, Wendy C. Ortiz, Ashley Ford, Sari Botton, Kelly Luce, Jonathan Lee, Erika Anderson, Julia Fierro, Sean Carman, and Alexander Chee.  

***

Where'd the Thank You perk go? 

Because we're only allowed to list X amount of perks at one time, we had to remove this one from the campaign page to make way for our very exciting Web Design Consultation perk. But worry not! If you'd like to donate and simply receive a hearty thanks from us on the site, it's still possible. Just donate by clicking on the pink Contribute Now button, then shoot us an email at hello@midnightbreakfast.com to let us know that you've "selected" the Thank You perk, and we'll make sure you get your dues. Even if you can only give $1, we'll love you forever, and we definitely want to be sure to thank everyone! (Also, we'll still hug you if we see you!)

***

Speaking of which...

A huge thanks to everyone who donated their time and resources to give us the incredible selection of perks we have to offer.

Our campaign video was made with the help of so many individuals. We'd like to thank Adam Stepinski, for directing and editing, as well as the participation of the literary rock stars featured in the video itself: Isaac Fitzgerald, Brian Spears, Jill Meyers & Callie Collins, Oscar Villalon, Colin Winnette, Seth Fischer & Ashley Perez, Lisa Lucas, Lauren Eggert-Crowe, Zoë Ruiz, J. Ryan Stradal, Cat Richardson, and Lauren O'Neal.

story:
Hi, my name is Evie.

I came late to my creativity, not taking myself seriously until I was in my early thirties. It was then that I realised why I'd always felt out of step with the rest of the world. But once the penny dropped, that was it. I began to create with a fever that has stayed with me for the last 15 years. 

I paint, write, sew and photoshop images, sometimes I do all these things together. 

I have become successful with my work in my home country, but the market here is very small so financial success has not followed the recognition.

Two years ago I published my first full length novel with a small indie publishing company called Evernight. I am working on novel two in the series, but am struggling to find the time to devote to it, because the need to support my family takes too much from me.

I'm hoping to raise funds that will allow me to give the second book in my series all the time and attention it deserves. The first book took me three years to write because I had to squeeze it in around the edges. It would mean so much to me to be able to just write, to give all my creative energy to this project and to see my characters birthed into the world.

The first book in my series has recieved rave reviews. I have included some of the highlights for you to look at if you like.

As far as debut novels go, this is by far one of the best.

All and all, Lunacy and the Vampire is a great read, though kind slow moving at first, it has a truly action packed ending. Fans of Krestley Cole's Immortals After Dark series', with definitely enjoy taking a crack at this. I for one am looking forward to reading more books from the realm of the Dominion.

Rating : 4 stars

Nocturne Romance Reads Reviews

This book was so good, I can't tell which part I liked best.It had action and romance and sex and everything one can expect from a good paranormal book, including some great world building and a strong-headed heroine who is a "beanne sidhe huntress" very deadly and set to kill vampires in order to protect humanity.

The only thing that doesn't make this book justice is the cover, but as we all know one shouldn't judge by it. This one is a keeper, can't wait for Dominion #2.

Rating: 5 stars

Denyse Cohen - Author.

Lunacy and the Vampire is filled with characters that evolve from the beginning of the story until the end. A true example of the other side of a coin, from hate to love and the fine line between may not stem the tide. I love the storyline and Luna’s pain is apparent with every word. The final battle and ending will take the reader’s breath away.

Rating: 4 stars

Coffee Time Romance & More

Highly Recommended Read! Don't miss out!

The author took a complex concept, and did a great job of painting an intriguing world around it. It’s not your everyday vampire story, which now days, is a good thing. I loved the idea of the quickening for bringing forth the beating of long silent hearts. There’s something hauntingly poetic about that, but don’t get me wrong, the characters in the book are warriors, bad-ass for sure.

All in all, the book was thought provoking, steamy, gritty, action-packed, and well done. I hope to be reading more from this talented author

Rating: 5 stars

The Talent Cave Reviews

I. Loved. It.

I really hope that we get to see more books in this world with these characters. These are not your childhood fairies. There are gruesome, dark, evil fae. And the good fae are ass kicking, name taking soldiers for the cause. The vampires are not sweet and sparkly. They are vicious, brutal warriors. This book is not for the faint of heart. If you are looking for a romantic vampire/fairy story, move it along. If you want a gritty, down and dirty, action filled story of destiny and love that defies all odds, then THIS is the book you need to read.

Rating:5 stars

Love books, book reviews.

story:
STRETCH GOAL -- $125,000!

We are so very happy we made our initial goal, but we have so much more to do. Help us reach and record for prosperity great leaders of peace around the world for the Living History experience.  We recently met with the revered South African social activist, Archbishop Desmond Tutu -- see his comments below:



The Dalai Lama Foundation is thrilled to develop the Living History of the Dalai Lama -- the world's first and only comprehensive online interactive history highlighting the Dalai Lama's lifelong journey to advance the cause of world peace.


****  SPECIAL OFFER  ****     TICKETS TO SEE THE DALAI LAMA IN 2015 !

All contributors making donations between now and the end of the campaign on Wednesday, December 3, will be automatically entered in a random drawing to win two tickets to see His Holiness the Dalai Lama during his tour of the United States in 2015.  Travel and accommodations are not included, and the date and location of the event will be determined after the Dalai Lama releases his 2015 itinerary.  See our Updates for more details. 


The Dalai Lama is one of the most recognizable leaders and advocates for world peace.  Among his many honors and awards, 25 years ago, he won the Nobel Peace Prize.  His commitment to selfless contribution in support of peaceful coexistence is an inspiration to millions of people around the world.  And now, the Living History project will bring the words and actions of this extraordinary man to future generations.

This project, and the efforts of the Dalai Lama Foundation, which the Dalai Lama has endorsed, promise to put into action many of the ideas for peace supported by His Holiness.


“I welcome all those who will join us…in our efforts to advance the cause of genuine peace in the world.”

                                                                                - Tenzin Gyatso, the 14th Dalai Lama



The Living History will include:

  • A website portal that brings the experience of the Dalai Lama directly to you, whereever you are located.
  • A chronological presentation of the major events in the Dalai Lama's extraordinary life.
  • An interactive map showing the many places around the world that the Dalai Lama has visited and spread his message of peace.
  • A searchable data base of rarely seen videos and photos of the Dalai Lama, as well as his speeches, talks and writings.
  • Success stories of people, groups and organizations that were inspired by the Dalai Lama.
  • A community where users can share stories, as well as post photos and videos through their social media.

As His Holiness approaches his 80th birthday, we know that now is the time to create the Living History. 

Tenzin Tethong, former Prime Minister to the Central Tibetan Administration 


Thupten Jinpa, principal English translator to the Dalai Lama



Paul Blackthorne, television and screen actor


Your Generosity Makes the Difference.

We cannot accomplish our goal of creating the Living History of the Dalai Lama without your support.  Please join the many friends of the Dalai Lama and contribute generously.


Gingger Shankar, Grammy nominated musician



Peter Coyote, screen actor and Buddhist scholar

The money raised in this campaign will be used to create the Living History.  If we raise amounts over our goal, we will enhance the interactive content, and produce an even more exciting and complete experience.  In the event that we are fortunate to raise more than we can use for the Living History, we can start to advance several other goals, including our Incubator for Peace: a program for social entrepreneurs to collaborate and further their organizations' advocacy of peace.



Our Heartfelt Thanks

Your support is so meaningful.  To thank you, we are offering a variety of gifts that we hope that you will enjoy.  All of our gifts are available in an unlimited quantity unless specified as a limited edition.  Many of these gifts are exclusive for this campaign and cannot be found anywhere else.  For example:


$25 Perk -- Peace Quote by the Dalai Lama

Here is a sample image of this fantastic digital postcard that includes an inspirational quote for a peaceful, inspirational life!


$50 Perk -- Selection of 14 Mobile Wallpapers

Have a selection of mobile digital Wallpapers at your fingertips!  Choose among your selection of 14 Wallpapers that are available for iPhone and Android mobile devices.

$75 Perk -- Valentine Popov Print

For a donation of $75, you can receive this fantastic color print of His Holiness the Dalai Lama created by artist Valentine Popov.  Unframed, this print is 11" x 16".  There is a limit of 175 pieces.


$85 Perk -- Custom USB Drive

A beautiful wooden 8GB USB drive, laser engraved with a quote by His Holiness the Dalai Lama:  "Work for Peace"


$100 Perk -- Olivier Adam Limited Edition

You can receive a 12" x 18" limited edition print of His Holiness the Dalai Lama conducting some ritual prayers as he prepares to give the 33rd Kalachakra Empowerment in Leh, Ladakh this past July, 2014.  This is a pigment print of museum quality on Hahnemulhe Fine Art Pearl paper, hand printed by the fantastic photographer, Olivier Adam.  There are only 10 copies of these amazing signed and numbered prints available.


$108 Perk -- Shambhala Sun Digital Subscription
Get a year's digital subscription to the Shambhala Sun, beginning in January 2015. The Shambhala Sun is the world's leading Buddhist magazine, bringing a contemplative view to all the important issues in life.

$150 Perk -- Dalai Lama Notecards

$150 Perk -- Original Meditation and Relaxation Music
Download an original album of music for meditation and relaxation.  This unique perk features music selections from Grammy nominated artists Nawang Khechog and Ried Kapo Ku, world-renowned cellist Michael Fitzpatrick, and Oscar nominated artist, Gingger Shankar.  It's a wonderful compilation!!

$200 Perk -- Olivier Adam "Offering" Print

This is a wonderful limited edition print by the talented and generous Olivier Adam.  It's known as "Offering", and shows an offering of light and flowers in the sacred place of Mahabodhi Temple for the last day of Kalachakra Initiation given by His Holiness the Dalai Lama in 2003 in Bodhgaya.  This is a 12" x 18" pigment print of museum quality on Hahnemuhle Fine Art Pearl paper, hand printed.  There are only 10 copies of these amazing signed and numbered prints available.


$200 Perk -- Your Name on a Prayer Flag
This perk will fly your name high on a prayer flag in Dharamsala, India, home to His Holiness the Dalai Lama.

$350 Perk -- Anderson Water Color

Here is a fantastic original water color painting of a seated Buddha by the celebrated artist David Kimball Anderson.  It measures 10" x 11".  The one shown here is pink, but each one is a little different, appearing in different colors.


$500 Perk -- Garry Bailey Dalai Lama Print

Enjoy this water color pencil digitally enhanced print of His Holiness the Dalai Lama by renowned artist, Garry Bailey.  Unframed on watercolor paper mounted on a 16" x 20" matte.


$1000 Perk -- Me&Ro Silver Tibetan Mirror Pendant 

Created exclusively for this campaign by Me&Ro, "3 Tibetan Mirror", a unisex pendant in silver, 1" diameter, on an 18" chain.  The mirror represents consciousness and the element for space.  Whatever appearances arise as reflections, be they beautiful or ugly, inherently good or evil, the mirror passes no judgment on them.  In the Tibetan Book of the Dead, Yama, the Lord of Death, holds up a mirror of karma in which all one's deeds are reflected.  The mirror of karma represents the clarity of seeing all of one's actions in the nakedness of pure humility.

$1000 Perk -- Two Tickets to Wisdom 2.0 Conference

You and a friend can be part of the next Wisdom 2.0 Conference in San Francisco on March 1, 2015.  Wisdom 2.0 addresses the great challenge of our age: to not only live connected to one another through technology, but to do so in ways that are beneficial to our own well-being, effective in our work, and useful to the world.  General admission tickets only; travel and accommodations are not included.


$1000 Perk -- High Plateau Tibet Photo, by Lisa Kristine

"High Plateau Himilayas", is a 16" x 20" photograph of Tibet by Lisa Kristine, the Lucie Humanitarian Photographer of the Year, 2013.  Framed size is 21" x 25" (shipped unframed outside of the continental United States).

From Lisa:  "For centuries, the Buddhist Kingdom of Tibet has been land-locked by the mountainous mass of the Himalayas.  While moving through such landscape one morning, I saw a woman walking to her fields.  What struck me was the dancing, ever changing light on the colossal land mass along with the golden glow of river.  I also noticed the joyous expression on the farmer's face.

On the rooftop of the world, in a country so vast, the remoteness and climatic extremes pose unique challenges for the farmers, or Rongpa, who call it home.

Here is a rare place where one can walk for days on end, witnessing the ancient and sophisticated culture without having the experience marred by the dross of modern civilization."



$2500 Perk -- 10k Gold Me&Ro Tibetan Mirror Pendant with Diamonds
For a donation of $2500, you can have this stunningly beautiful Me&Ro 10k gold Tibetan Mirror pendant with diamonds that was created exclusively for the Living History campaign.  The pendant is 5/8" in diameter, on an 18" gold chain.

The mirror represents consciousness and the element of space.  Whatever reflects in the mirror, whether beautiful or ugly, good or evil, the mirror passes no judgment.  This a really special pendant that you will cherish. 
 

$5000 Perk -- David Kimball Anderson Buddha Mound
For a donation of $5000, you'll receive a remarkably beautiful bronze sculpture from the celebrated artist, David Kimball Anderson.  These sculptures are known as "Buddha Mounds", and are approximately 8.5" x 8" each.  Each sculpture is unique, coming in a different bronze patina of blues, greens, grey and black.

$10,000 Perk -- Tahitian Pearls

Single opera length strand of 10-11mm circle pearls from Tahiti.  The strand features 108 dark Tahitian black/green color pearls of exceptional lustre.  The pearls have a very slightly marked circle skin.  Only one available, and comes with a jewelry valuation certificate appraisal.

Also - you will join the Founders Circle of the Living History project, and your name will be listed in the credits of the Living History Program.


$10,000 Perk -- The Erudio Project in South Africa

For a donation of $10,000, you and a friend can join the Dalai Lama Foundation's partner in South Africa, the Erudio Project, to expand their Technology for Peace program.  This program works in remote villages in underserved communities to provide much needed technology and education to expand the world view of local children.  Join the team as they set up a new computer lab, then work with the tribal children and educators to teach basic computer skills and help launch the kids into the computer curriculum.

Additionally, you will get to work with the local community to see other programs that have been developed, including sustainable farming, HIV/AIDS education, the after-school soccer program and more.  Accommodations and meals will be provided as will transportation from Capetown to Richmond.  Travel to Capetown is not included.

Also - you will join the Founders Circle of the Living History project, and your name will be listed in the credits of the Living History Program.


$15,000 Perk -- Trip to Dharamsala, India

You and a guest will join a key member of the Dalai Lama Foundation for five days in Dharamsala/McLeod Gang -- home to the Tibetan Government in Exile, and His Holiness the Dalai Lama.  

Stay at the beautiful Chonor House, which is located adjacent to the Dalai Lama's temple, or Norlinga House, which is located in the beautiful park ground of the Norbulingka Institute.  Here you will have a guided tour of the Institute created to continue the traditions of Tibetan artists.  You will have the option of taking a workshop in either wood painting, wood carving, or thangka painting.  You will visit the Domaling Nunnery, the first nunnery ever to offer a full Buddhist curriculum for nuns.  Then, head up to listen to the chanting monks of Gyuto Monastery, the temporary residence of His Holiness, the XVIth Karmapa.  Afterwards, you will explore the ancient empire of Kangra.  This day long visit will include a visit to Vahreshwari (which is one of the more revered temples in India), and also Kangra Fort, which is believed to be the most ancient fort in all of India.  Of course, no trip to Dharamsala would be complete without a visit to Tibetan Children's village and the Main Tibetan Temple located near His Holiness' residence.

Also - you will join the Founders Circle of the Living History project, and your name will be listed in the credits of the Living History Program.

Travel to and from Dharamsala is not included.


 

About the Dalai Lama Foundation

“May this natural wish be my small contribution to world peace.  I pray for a more friendly, more caring, and more understanding human family on this planet.”

The mission of the Dalai Lama Foundation is to support the development of our shared global capacity for ethics and peace, based on a non-dogmatic ethic of compassion.

The Foundation has been established with the Dalai Lama’s endorsement and advice.  As stated by the Dalai Lama, 

“I am happy to endorse and lend my name to this effort because it promises to try to put into action many of the ideas for peace that I support.”

The Dalai Lama Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization incorporated in the State of California in the USA.  Tax ID 680492149.


Special Thanks

We want to extend our special appreciation to those artists and friends that helped put this campaign together and who generously shared their images and time in this effort:  Olivier Adam, Don Farber, Michael Collopy, and Marcus Oleniuk.  Also thanks to Nawang Khechog for the use of his music.

You and a guest will join a key member of the Dalai Lama Foundation for five days in Dharamsala/McLeod Gang -- home to the Tibetan Government in Exile, and His Holiness the Dalai Lama.  
Stay at the beautiful Chonor House, which is located adjacent to the Dalai Lama's temple, or Norlinga House, which is located in the beautiful park ground of the Norbulingka Institute.  Here you will have a guided tour of the Institute created to continue the traditions of Tibetan artists.  You will have the option of taking a workshop in either wood painting, wood carving, or thangka painting.  You will visit the Domaling Nunnery, the first nunnery ever to offer a full Buddhist curriculum for nuns.  Then, head up to listen to the chanting monks of Gyuto Monastery, the temporary residence of His Holiness, the XVIth Karmapa.  Afterwards, you will explore the ancient empire of Kangra.  This day long visit will include a visit to Vahreshwari (which is one of the more revered temples in India), and also Kangra Fort, which is believed to be the most ancient fort in all of India.  Of course, no trip to Dharamsala would be complete without a visit to Tibetan Children's village and the Main Tibetan Temple located near His Holiness' residence.
Also - you will join the Founders Circle of the Living History project, and your name will be listed in the credits of the Living History Program.
Travel to and from Dharamsala is not included.
 
About the Dalai Lama Foundation



“May this natural wish be my small contribution to world peace.  I pray for a more friendly, more caring, and more understanding human family on this planet.”




The mission of the Dalai Lama Foundation is to support the development of our shared global capacity for ethics and peace, based on a non-dogmatic ethic of compassion.
The Foundation has been established with the Dalai Lama’s endorsement and advice.  As stated by the Dalai Lama, 
“I am happy to endorse and lend my name to this effort because it promises to try to put into action many of the ideas for peace that I support.”
The Dalai Lama Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization incorporated in the State of California in the USA.  Tax ID 680492149.


Special Thanks
We want to extend our special appreciation to those artists and friends that helped put this campaign together and who generously shared their images and time in this effort:  Olivier Adam, Don Farber, Michael Collopy, and Marcus Oleniuk.  Also thanks to Nawang Khechog for the use of his music.

story:
Hello, My name is Carolyn Wysinger and I get high off the community like Fed Hampton Jr...I love the people, I love serving the community. I been in community leadership all of my life. But I have been working in the LGBT community since 2008. I have been an event promoter, a community organizer and burgeoning political figure dedicated to positive visibility of LGBT people especially Masculine of Center Womyn.

I'm also a writer. I have been writing since I was 9 years old. For me writing stories has always been easy for me because they wee simply me writing down my daydreams. I got my BA and MFA in Creative Writing. When I came out I started writing more and more stories about my experience as a black lesbian. But one day my non-fiction side took over and I started a blog. My blog was a daily journey through my life and the music follows me and my experiences. I always got such a great response from the community about my blog posts that I decided to compile them into a book. Glover Lane Press loved my writing and agreed to publish the book. "Knockturnal Emissions: Thoughts on #race #sexuality #gender #community" was born!

My book has brought such joy into my life. It has given me a platform to start conversations in places I never thought I would be.  Funding this campaign would mean I would get to go into even more places in other states and talk about my experience as a Black, Masculine of Center, Lesbian Womyn. It would also mean that I would get to produce my next book which will be my first published fiction piece. It is a collection of linked short stories that centers around a lesbian rapper. The books is structured like an album and the stories live inside of the songs. I am very excited and the stories are already generating buzz as I read them at open mics.
 

Carolyn's Bio

Carolyn Wysinger is 30 something soft butch raised in Richmond, Ca.  She is a social entrepreneur whose goal is to build bridges within our community which extend out into society at large. She is an educator, activist, writer and event coordinator. She earned her B.A. in English from California State University, Long Beach and her M.F.A. from Antioch University.

  Her desire to advocate for social justice started at an early age in school government and church leadership. As an adult she learned how to use those same tools to build within the LGBT community.  She has made her presence felt in the community through promoting social events and volunteer work/workshops at conferences and retreats such as BUTCHVoices and Black Lesbians United.  She is a contributor to the Queer Women of Color Media Wire and she is proud that her first book “Knockturnal Emissions: Thoughts on #race #sexuality #gender & #community” was recently published in Glover Lane Press. Her goal is to create new things and be able to say she left this world better than she found it.


What We Need & What You Get

Money raised through this campaign will travel and expenses for promo stops in
     -Atlanta
     -Los Angeles
     -Portland
     -Houston
And other possible areas
      Las Vegas
      East Coast
 In each of these cities I will be doing a promotional even as well as community retreats &/or trainings that will extend my activist work in the community.

The public has demanded that I hurry up and release this fiction book that I am always reading from. So money raised will also go to production costs of the next fiction book with the working title "A Day in the Life..."

I would LOVE if you would contribute even just a little bit. But if you can't I understand. I just ask that you tweet, FB share, IG screen shot this to evvveryone you know!! The more participation we get the more we send out the message that QPOC stories matter! That we have a voice and it needs to be heard!!! If I raised all of this on multitudes of $25 contributions that would still be awesome because that shows a huge mass of people looking for these stories!!!
