story:
DENIMSKIN: A LITERARY & ART REVIEW

A forthcoming literary & art review to be printed quarterly, featuring the new works of today's unvoiced American artists.

What is DenimSkin?

DenimSkin is the shadow of the city, where America’s underground poets, storytellers and visual artists create in defiance of conventional form and content. Free from the need to satisfy the editorial demands of “establishment” media outlets that cater to an audience of conventional tastes, DenimSkin refuses artistic boundaries.

In contrast to the familiar, safe and sterile, DenimSkin pursues a provocative, spontaneous, visceral style unrestricted by form, content, or meaning.

Question everything. Begin anywhere.

DenimSkin is the shadow, planting the bombdeath of bourgeois art in the back pocket of the city.

What DenimSkin will look like: 

DenimSkin will be published in collaboration with Hip Pocket Books in a 5.5" x 8.5" dimension and will feature:

- poetry
- short fiction
- non-fiction
- black&white visual art 
- excerpts
- essays
- reviews & interviews

If you'd like to submit your own work or want to get a better idea of the work we're looking for, you can visit the submissions page of our website at: www.DenimSkinInk.com.

When is it hitting shelves?

DenimSkin will be released quarterly with an initial release date of late March/early April 2014 with a sales price of less than $6! But you can score a copy for free just by contributing, and that's only the beginning. To see what else is up for grabs just check out our perks!

Where you can find it:

DenimSkin will be sold throughout the New York City metro area. You will be able to find copies in bookstores, cafes & bars, record stores & art galleries, and other similarly themed establishments. 

DenimSkin is based out of New York City but can be distributed nationwide and will also be available for purchase through the DenimSkin website for those of you outside of the NYC area at: www.DenimSkinInk.com.

Why We Need Help & Where Your Help Goes

While the minds behind DenimSkin are out to produce a raw unrefined product, it needs the professional attention that it deserves.

This means shelling out the money to get the desired product we want; the real deal. The quality of the review represents the respect for the art that it contains. We are putting our money into this as we speak but funding a quarterly review is no easy task but it is one worth taking on. 

We have gathered all of the right people to ensure that DenimSkin is the best possible product it could be. All we need is some help with funding things such as:

Printing fees
We have a publisher & press on board and waiting
How many we press depends on you!

Securing Copyrights 
A full year's worth.
These protect the works of contributing artists from theft. 

IndieGoGo's 4% fee

Distribution, Marketing, Promotion, Publicity & Press
This ain't as easy or as cheap as it sounds. We'll conduct an underground campaign of "guerrilla marketing" among traditional ways. Public open readings, skin escaping from subterranean shadows, a shout on a platform. It will find you. 

Release parties, a domain name, our website and facebook pages—they will provide info on when and where you can get your own DenimSkin.

PARTY!  A release party for each issue, that's four parties a year, full of food, drinks (adult drinks of course), live music, and readings in a bomb location where DenimSkin's contributing artists can bend ears and bring rain.

Don’t worry, you’re wearing DenimSkin. Our perks above are small tokens of our appreciation for your generosity, and provide an element of creative control if you get too excited and want to be a guest editor or associate publisher.

We also have a great vidoeography crew lined up just waiting for the party and any readings DenimSkin finds itsself at.

***Remember! You're funding a year long endeavor of four high-quality, full-length reviews. We know it may sound a bit expensive but a year is a long time when it comes to this and our funds will need to keep us going in order to fulfill our goal. Should our search for funds end too soon, we’ll still pursue the completion of our project on your platform.

Love Denim But Short On Skin? 

We get it, we're broke too, that's why we're asking for your help not only for funding but for spreading the word about DenimSkin.

We'll still hold you in high regard if you...

Read DenimSkin when it is released.

Spread the word about DenimSkin; take a page out of our book and use guerrilla marketing to get the word out. You can use IndieGoGo's share tools as well.

Send us your own work by visiting the submissions page of our website at www.DenimSkinInk.com.  

Tell all of your more financially endowed family and friends about this campaign.

Find us at www.DenimSkinInk.com.

story:
***CLICK HERE TO VISIT THE CURRENT FUNDRAISER. 
THIS IS AN OLD PAGE.***


"I don't quite have the words for the fellowship, the guidance, and appreciation for what this weekend was. I loved the camaraderie, the poetry, the discussions. I am honored to have been a part of it." ~ Amoja "MoMan" Sumler, Arkansas poet

 "When I heard about the TWH Retreat I knew I had to attend. You see, I had prayed for specific things to happen at the end of 2013 and in 2014. TWH Retreat happened right on time! Call me sentimental, I'm certain there're others who feel as I do. I'm loving this sweet feeling of warmth and gratitude."  ~ Lorraine Currelley, Poets Network & Exchange

Who We Are

The Watering Hole is a grassroots movement that began as a Facebook Group created by fellows of Cave Canem South Workshops. We all had varying backgrounds---some of us M.F.A. and Ph.D. candidates, some on the spoken word tour circuit, some closet poets; however, all of us were searching to fill a void. We needed a community of poets who understood the cultural framework of our work; who could breakdown Plato, Roger Bonair-Agard, and Biggie in the same breath; who believed in the power of a united writing community; and who were passionate about getting our voices into the world as a team. We were starved for a craft-oriented poetry community of color.

We all also had issues accessing poetry communities of color that did exist for two major reasons: either they were way too expensive (high tuition, airfare, hotel, and time off from work and family), or they didn't stress the importance of craft and revision.

We draw much of our inspiration from those three-day Cave Canem South workshops, which were hosted by Dr. Kwame Dawes, editor of Prairie Schooner; and led by Nikky Finney, a National Book Award winner; Patricia Smith, who was inducted into the International Literary Hall of Fame for Writers of African Descent; and Frank X Walker, co-founder of the Affrilachian Poets.

What We Need & What You Get

We need incorporation and non-profit status in order to be able to access arts grants, which could fuel our initiatives for the next decade and more. That would help us keep retreats and online master classes affordable and accessible for all of our participants, better support our facilitators, and finally, finally, finally be able to provide scholarships, as well. 

We're grateful for any level of support. Whether you donate $5 or $5,000, every donation allows us to apply for arts grants and say that x number of people believe in The Watering Hole and have a personal investment in our growth and future. The larger the number of contributors is, the better our grant applications look.

If we're able to raise $5,000, we'll be able to pay the fees for incorporation and non-profit status, respectfully support our world-class retreat facilitators, and bring in special a guest speaker at the retreat.

$8,000: Historical fieldtrip with guided tour at the retreat, free tote bags, and other swag for all retreat participants, plus 5 partial need-based scholarships will awarded

$10,000: Select sessions will be recorded, so that retreat participants can access them when they leave and TWH members who aren't able to attend can access them, as well. Plus, 10 partial need-based scholarships will awarded.

We have fantastic perks, including seats in Online Master Classes, Laptop/Notebook Stickies (pictured below), journal subscriptions, Brand New T-shirts, autographed book bundles, scholarship donations, even manuscript critiques. We even have a sponsorship option for those who would like to promote a business.

Laptop/Notebook Sticky

These are the old versions of the T-shirts. 

The new ones have the same wording but a brand new look!

The Impact

The Watering Hole is growing from the 3-day winter retreat we hosted in 2013 to a 6-day retreat at the end of this year, December 26-31. It's what our members have been asking for. Our goal is to keep the retreat price below $50 per day for classes, workshops, and lodging. This is unheard of! Retreat participants will have more time with the facilitators, more focused attention from one facilitator in particular, more time to write away from the responsibilities and distractions of home, and most of all more time with each other. The camaraderie among participants is, in our experience, the most transformative part of a writer's retreat. 

This is why we need incorporation and non-profit status. We have a notebook full of ideas for building an affordable and accessible poetry community--a safe space where poets of color can learn and grow. Consistent funding through arts grants could support those initiatives and offset the cost for our members.

Risks & Challenges

With any movement this large and this grassroots, there are always logistical challenges. If we don't reach our goal of $5,000, we are determined to still continue with our winter retreat and continue working towards achieving incorporation and non-profit status. This will simply involve strict cutbacks. We are find-a-way poets, who have a history of achieving the seemingly unachievable. We are experienced, impassioned, and able to handle all situations. We have already secured the retreat space and facilitators, and we have numerous poets who are dedicated to our mission. All we need are the funds to make it happen.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please, spread the word. Your daily word-of-mouth support is just as valuable as your donation. Put some noise behind this project! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Shout out for the irreplaceable support of Jennifer Bartell, John S. Blake, Lorraine Currelley, Teri Elam, Saafiya "Shyne" Pearson, Amoja "MoMan" Sumler, and April Wright <--Poet-Dreamers, Poet-Doers
    Shout out for the guidance and mentorship of Tara Betts, Remica L. Bingham-Risher, Kwame Dawes, Nikky Finney, M. Ayodele Heath, Lita Hooper, Tyehimba Jess, Patricia Smith, Frank X. Walker, L. Lamar Wilson <--Those who reach back and lift up

story:
Join us in helping save thousands of children!

 

Have you ever wanted to make a real difference in this world? One that will change people’s lives not only now, but for generations? Have you been looking for a campaign to support that truly makes a lasting difference? Here is your chance! The Institute for Self Reliant Agriculture (SRA) is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization that is focused on helping end hunger and malnutrition in the developing world.  We are a trusted Guidestar Exchange partner!

http://www.guidestar.org/organizations/27-1213552/institute-self-reliant-agriculture.aspx

SRA has been in Operation since 2009 and is working with Governments, Universities and other NGO's in an effort to combine our abilities and help as many people feed themselves and emerge from poverty as possible.

Currently, we have several projects we are working on. In cooperation with the Government of Piura and the National University of Peru, we are creating a new program that will benefit over 600 families (over 3,000 individuals- the largest portion are children) in the city of Huarmaca, Peru, a very poor region of the country. They currently have malnutrition rates as high as 80%. We have other programs in Ecuador and Kenya, and we are working on helping as many families as we can. You can get more information about each of our programs on our website. www.feedtheworld.org

Before the age of 5, children are most vulnerable to debilitating disease and permanent damage from malnutrition. We have been working with a limited number of families and have been able to reduce malnutrition rates by over 30% in the first year! Many government programs have not been able to achieve 1/10th of that reduction with many years of work. This is a chance to save the lives and futures of thousands of children!

These programs require donations in order to achieve success. With your support, we can make a difference which will last many lifetimes!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is a multi-phase program to raise $100,000 as our contribution toward the program. As soon as we are able to do that, the Government of Piura will contribute and additional $500,000 dollars toward the program. This first phase ($15,000) will be used to help qualify over 600 families that will take part in the program, have a nutritiontist and agronimist teach the first set of classes and will provide the initial set of quality seeds for their first planting.

You can get a better idea of how unique we really are in our approach to helping families and why our program is so badly needed, by visiting our website.

As a thank you for your support, we have put together some incredible, once in a lifetime perks! How would you like to be able to see first-hand the progress we are making and the power of your support? There are two perks that will give you that incredible experience!

The Impact

We have learned that the best way to pull people out of hunger and poverty is not by giving them food, but by empowering them to solve their own problems. We have developed a program called the Small Scale Agriculture Model which has been in development for 25 years. This program is so basic and effective that we literally have many governments, Universities and other Non-profits wanting to partner with us to implement our model in their programs. We have found that by growing people as much as we grow food, we help people solve their own problems. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are a young organization and don't have a lot of connections to get the word out. Even if you can't contribute, if you can help spread the word of this great campaign, we would be very grateful! We have a section on our website that talks about other ways you can contribute, from donating airline miles to volunteering, there are many things you can do to make a difference. Please use the Indiegogo share tools as well as your own social networks!

 

NOTE: The trips to South america will be set up according to the winners availability. We will pay for flights from Atlanta, GA to the destination country, all lodging and food during your stay and an experience you won't soon forget. VIP treatment all the way!

All mailable perks( shirts, books, hand made items, etc) will be sent at the end of the campaign so we can send it all at the same time.

story:
Video Credits - Music 'Come Out of Your House' by Alex Butler 

Who are we?


We are a group of journalists who all live in the glorious North East.

We're a canny bunch.

And we love our region so much that we think it's about time we showed it off.

That's where Northern Edge comes in.
 

Our Story


Northern Edge is a new lifestyle and culture magazine for everyone who wants a fresh perspective on the pioneering people, lush locations, and exciting goings-on around the North East.

We are a group of aspiring (and often perspiring) journalists, and we are creating Northern Edge as part of a project for our graduate qualifications.

When asked what we, a notably unique, curious, enthusiastic and mismatched group of people, had in common, we all answered the same: our passion for sharing the exciting happenings in our region that don't get publicized enough.
Northern Edge creates a fusion of festivals, history, food and drink, local businesses and fashion, all declaring just how canny the North East is.   

Far more than just a 'What's On' guide, Northern Edge aims to take you off the beaten track a little, by talking to people and going to places that you might not have noticed before. With diverse content, a team armed with keyboards and all the enthusiasm they can muster, and a shared love of the region, Northern Edge aims to bring the hidden gems of the North East direct to you.  

Our articles have been written, photographs snapped, and pages designed - and this is the point where we need a hand.

Does the North East need us?


Of course! The North East is one of the most diverse, interesting and creative places in the UK - just ask Creative Boom. Boom! From the Baltic to tattoos, local heroes to the beating heart of new music, there's never been a time when this part of the country has had so much to shout about.

So what do WE need?


We need £1,230 to cover printing and distribution costs for our first issue. We would be eternally grateful if you could donate as much as you can to help us create a fantastic magazine!

Or if you're a business--a music venue, a new brewery, jewelers, restaurant, sports club, recycling centre, craft shop, whatever!--you can book with us to advertise your own passion.

You can donate as little as £2 and claim a reward for your generosity. It honestly couldn't be easier to help us out, with the option to pay using either a credit card or PayPal.

Even if you can't afford to pledge any money we would greatly appreciate it if you could share our campaign by email or social media so we can reach as many people as possible.

story:
Quel est ce projet, et d'où vient-il ?

« Vivant, j’écoute ce qui vient à moi et donne de la place lorsque cela résonne. »

Ces choses qui résonnent, j’ai pris le temps, années après années, de les cultiver et elles sont devenues de grandes passions. Encore aujourd’hui, il y a des passions qui montent, alors que d’autres leur laissent la place dans mon emploi du temps. On ne trouve jamais le temps, on le prend.

Aujourd'hui, je m'apprête à prendre six mois pour vivre une expérience qui m'est venue du coeur et qui va m'amener jusqu'aux frontières de l'Europe ! Car à vouloir partir plusieurs mois à l'étranger et après avoir fait un tour de Bretagne à vélo en 2008, l'idée est venue assez naturellement de pouvoir entamer un tel périple. Vous pourrez découvrir plus en détails l'histoire de ce projet sur mon blog à cette adresse : http://jonglavelo.com/tour-deurope-a-velo-2014/itineraire/

Même si le parcours peut encore légèrement évoluer, j'en ai maintenant une idée plutôt précise, et j'ai quelques chiffres qui font rêver !

  • Je partirai de Toulouse, puis traverserai l'Italie, la Slovénie, la Croatie, la Bosnie, le Monténégro, le Kosovo et la Serbie, la Bulgarie, pour atteindre Istanbul en Turquie. Ensuite, je reprends vers le nord avec à nouveau la Bulgarie, la Roumanie, la Moldavie, la Ukraine, jusque Kiev. Et enfin, la Pologne, la République Tchèque, l'Allemagne, les Pays-bas, la Belgique et la France. Soit 18 pays !
  • 6 mois de voyage, de début mars 2014 à début septembre. 
  • Plus de 8 250 kilomètres de parcours
  • Presque 80 kilomètres de dénivelés 
  • Une moyenne d'environ 100 kilomètres par "jour de vélo"
  • Côtoyer 5 mers 

Et la jongle, dans tout ça ?! 

Et oui, car je suis également jongleur professionnel ! Je partage ma passion dans des spectacles, en déambulations, sur scène, avec du feu, du lumineux, voire même avec des feux d'artifices !

Cela fait maintenant 9 ans que je pratique le "bâton du diable" dont vous pouvez voir une démonstration ci-dessous. Ma plus grosse performance est d'avoir participé à la scène ouverte de feu de la Convention Européenne de Jonglerie - le plus gros événement de jonglerie au monde. Lors de ce spectacle, j'ai donné tout ce que j'avais devant environ 2500 jongleurs du monde entier (la convention en a rassemblé plus de 6000).

La jonglerie aura une immense place dans ce voyage car dès lors que je poserai le pied à terre, ce sera dans l’idée d’aller vers les habitants, spontanément. J’aurai énormément de joie à proposer des spectacles, à donner le sourire et à témoigner de mon parcours et mon aventure. Je compte également emporter deux bâtons du diable supplémentaires afin de pouvoir faire des initiations à tous ceux, grands et petits, qui voudront essayer. Cet Art est une merveille, aussi bien dans la simplicité de sa fabrication que dans l’immensité des possibilités que ça ouvre. Et une fois touché, il me faut le partager !

Enfin, la jonglerie est à l'origine même de ce projet, car j'atteindrai Kiev à la mi-juin, précisément pour participer au Kiev Fire Festival - un des plus gros festival de feu et de jonglerie de feu au monde. J'y serai attendu, et je ferai tout pour y arriver dans les temps ! C'est l'objectif d'origine de mon voyage !

Comment suivre le déroulement du projet ?

Il y a deux solutions très efficaces à cela : d'une part, j'aurai une mailing list, à laquelle vous pouvez vous inscrire et dans laquelle je donnerai régulièrement des nouvelles. Mais plus encore, vous pouvez vous rendre sur mon blog à l'adresse suivante : www.jonglavelo.com
Vous y trouverez toutes les informations, des photos et même des vidéos !

Pourquoi j'ai besoin de vous ? 

Pendant ce voyage, un de mes objectifs est clairement de vivre avec aussi peu que nécessaire, et j'ai estimé ma moyenne de frais par jour entre 5 et dix euros par jours. 

Mais avant de partir, il faut encore que j'achète tout le matériel - à l'origine inexistant - que j'emporterai avec moi. Comme j'ai prévu de pouvoir être totalement indépendant si aucune opportunité ne s'offre à moi, j'aurai ce qu'il faut pour faire du camping sauvage. 

J'ai donc eu l'idée de proposer un projet de crowfunding, qui vous permette à la fois de me soutenir, d'avoir de supers contreparties et que je puisse partir avec du matos qui ne me lâchera pas en pleine campagne de Moldavie ! ^^

Avec ces contreparties, j'espère vous faire vivre un peu de mon aventure, vous donner un peu du goût des paysages et des rencontres ! Car en m'aidant, vous faites partie de ce projet et il vous appartient un peu aussi :) 

Cela dit, si vous ne pouvez pas m'aider financièrement, je vous serai déjà très reconnaissant si vous partagiez autour de vous ce projet. Une autre façon de m'aider est de me dire si vous connaissez des personnes sur mon parcours, pour compléter ma liste de contacts ! Ce serait super :) Enfin, je vous ajouterai volontiers à la mailing liste, si vous souhaitez recevoir des emails pour suivre l'aventure, par simple demande. 

Merci !!

story:
About Me

Hello my name is Robert and I've been writing for the past 20 years mostly fictional. I come from a family that does not pass judgement on you because of your Race, Gender, or Religion and  until recent I've had the pleasure of getting to know people outside their normal whom we know as LGTB.  For the most part i had never put any thought into what others did with their lives until I heard the story about Co-KO a A young Trans Gendered Woman murdered because of her gender.  Upon reading the story, a friend of mine knew Co-KO personally and had told me about a close friend of Co-KO's that almost experienced the same ordeal, but escaped from harms way and lived to tell the story her name is Lisa, Lisa Cole a 28 year old Trans Gendered female that did not want to go public with her ordeals in fear that this guy has not been caught and still fears for her life to this very day.   Although Lisa still remained traumatized from her ordeal, she entrusted in me to write her story to inform people to make better decisions and to know what and who they are getting their selves into a relationship with.


What We Need & What You Get

My mission on Indiegogo is to raise 8,000 for the

Editing, Publishing, and Distribution, and Promotion

Book Launch celebration along with candle light gathering with food and fun.

Book tour to California Northern and Southern, Texas, Chicago and several Midwest States.


The Impact

I believe this would have a monumental impact on the LGTB community if we continue to make progress on our goals on society not allowing what others say or feel about us make a difference.  To write fiction is pretty easy, but to write about something as serious as this is matter is takes a lot of having compassion for people a whole.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Just your undivided attention on this projects helps by telling everyone you know about the book.

  • Please do not forget to tell all your friends about our cause and book via Facebook, twitter, and any other social media site you log in to.  you have my deepest gratitude for infinity.
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

CHECK OFTEN THE UPDATES FOR NEW SURPRISES AND USEFULL IMPORTANT NEW GIFTS! (I actually have a new gift/surprise at the updates section, which is really usefull!)

(First of all I would like you to know that is first time that I present a project in crowdfunding sites, so in case you have any advices in order to make it better, please dont hesitate to contact me to let me know. Your advices are valuable!)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So.....this is the MAGIC PROJECT PART 1 = THE MAGIC BOOK  AND NOT THE ENTIRE MAGIC PROJECT!!!

IN ORDER TO HAVE BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ENTIRE MAGIC PROJECT PLZ FIRST READ THE DESCRIPTION ON THIS LINK

http://magic-project.weebly.com/the-magic-project.html

AND AFTER THAT READ ABOUT THE MAGIC PROJECT PART 1 - THE MAGIC BOOK IN THE TEXT BELLOW!

WHO AM I...


Hello!

My name is Korina, I am from Greece and I am a Medical Doctor. My life was never easy as until 19 years old my life was full of abuse. At 17 years old have tried to run away from home but they have found me with police's help and the abuse was even more. At 19 I left home in order to study and my life started to get better.

All this abuse since the age of 2 years old, has made me to find refuge in imagination, which has lead me to have the idea of the Magic Book and the Magic Project. 

Also the thing that i had so much abuse, made me to want to fight violence and abuse wherever I see it. So when I first worked as a doctor in a prison and saw how the prisoners are treated, I made denunciations at Strasburg at the department of human rights of prisoners. This was equal to me making denunciations for the Greek ministry of health and ministry of justice. Ofc the "system" has turned against me and they had me to go through a court with the fake accusation that a prisoner has died bc of one pill that I gave to him, while he died from Heroine. Thank God, even If it was all set up and even if I had no money for lawyer and I had to interrogate the witnesses by myself, the result was that I AM INNOCENT (is a big story how the truth shined). You can imagine that this has lead to receive a very bad attitude from the classical medical communities in my country which has become even worse when I started to treat autism WITH BIG SUCCESS through the antidoting of vaccines. Ofc this is by default a proof that autism comes from vaccines, if i can treat the autism by antidoting the vaccines right? So you can imagine the result...

Is like there is an open "war" going on from that classical medical communities which explains how a medical alternative doctor can be very very poor.

story:
My name is Trevor O'Donnell and I'm a 19 year old cyclist from Barrie, Ontario. This year was my second season racing cyclocross and with great help from coach, recently retired United Health Care Professional Team Davide Frattini. I have the great honor of being selected to represent Canada and travel across the world to Belgium to race at this year's Cyclocross World Championships In Zolder, Belgium.

The plan is to Fly out to Brussels, Belgium, on Christmas Eve where we will stay with the coaches through Cycling Canada. The entire project will be six weeks. The first two weeks with be spent racing and training throughout Belgium and the Netherlands along with the final two weeks. In the middle two weeks the coaches are arranging a camp to be held in Spain to further more prepare us for worlds. During this time the other athletes and myself with gain tons of experience with training and racing in Europe. Which will help prepare us for our future careers along with major Cyclocross World Cups in the future. This is the list of races I will be attending:

December 26th, Zolder World Cup

December 27th, Hansgrohe Superprestige - Diegem C1

December 29th, Bpost bank trofee - Azencross C1

January 1st, Bpost bank trofee - G.P. Sven Nys C 1

January 3rd, SOUDAL Classics - Cyclocross Leuven C1

January 24th, Hoogerheide World Cup

January 31st, World Championships


With cyclocross not being an Olympic sport there is no funding from the government towards a National program. I am committed 100% to the sport while working as much as I can to fund and support myself. But coming up with this amount for this amazing opportunity in such sort notice is difficult. Even with an extremely supportive family doing the best they can to support me. I am not an only child and with my mother living with Multiple Sclerosis is unable to work, we are a single income family. So I am left to reach out and ask for any extra support in order to make this happen.

This is a list of the approximate funds I will need:

Return flight: $1300 CAN

Christmas camp: $1050 CAN (plus food)

Spain project: $1000 CAN  (includes all transportation)

Worlds camp: $900 CAN  (plus food)

National team clothing: $505
Short sleeve & long sleeve jersey
Skin-suit
Bib shorts
Wind vest
Socks
T-shirt


 This is why I am asking and am in need of your help to support to make this trip possible. All donations of any denomination will be greatly appreciated!

Donations can be securely made through this page or via email at todonnell396@hotmail.com.

Thank you for your time.

Trevor O'Donnell

story:
APRIL’s mission is to connect readers with independent literature and the authors and publishers of this vitalizing work. The largest way this mission is accomplished is through APRIL Festival, an annual small press festival held in Seattle.

This work cannot be done without your support. APRIL is 100% volunteer run so every dollar you give goes directly to buying program essentials as small as a stamp to as big as an event venue.


APRIL Festival hosts approximately 10 events over the course of a week.


These events can range from Happy Hour readings with a focus on local writers, to the always popular storytelling competition, A Poet, a Playwright, a Novelist and a Drag Queen. Typical APRIL events provide opportunities for small press writers to collaborate with artists of other mediums, from local visual artists who create work in response to small press books for a pop-up art show called Vignettes, to performers creating original theatrical work to showcase alongside readings in the All Made Up Fiction Showcase. And the APRIL Festival always culminates with a Book Expo on the last day, hosting small presses from near and far, from the tiny handmade houses to the biggest of the little guys, which gives folks in Seattle and the surrounding area the opportunity to encounter this incredible work in person, speak to publishers directly, while simultaneously allowing small press publishers to gain audiences they might not otherwise reach.


Here are just a few of the writers and publishers we have hosted over the last few years:


Graywolf, Octopus Books, Dzanc Books, Shya Scanlon, Wendy Xu, Big Fiction, Jac Jemc, Mike Young, Scrambler Books, Michelle Penaloza, Elissa Washuta, Pacifica Literary Review, The Shipping Group, Two Sylvias Press, Matthew Simmons, Future Tense, Lauren Ireland, Magic Helicopter, Matthew Rohrer, Sasquatch Books, Wave Books, Coffee House Press, Matthew Dickman, Minor Arcana Press, Rebecca Brown, Peter Mountford, Heather Christle, Chin Music Press, Emily Kendal Frey, PageBoy Magazine, Yeti Press Comics, Jai-Alai Books, Short Flight/Long Drive, Dorothy


APRIL Press


"They combine up-and-coming local talent with brilliant out-of-town authors and put on events that get copied by other, inferior arts organizations. This is how you lead: by example."


"The book fair was the best book fair that I have been to hands down."


"Was it a reading? A biographical sketch? A religious ceremony? A complex thesis on the troubling relationship between writers and readers? A meditation on the relationship between an artist and her muse? A love story? An elaborate work of fan fiction by one of Seattle’s most brilliant writers? Yes. It was all those things. And wasn’t it just great?"


"We believe everyone is a reader and we want to connect readers with writing, expose them to new stuff, make converts to independent literature."


"On the whole, this year's APRIL Festival ran like a well-oiled machine, but a machine that makes wild deep-truth piñatas."


"This is no series of sedate readings. APRIL wants to bring in people who wouldn’t usually find themselves at literary events, with parties, live music, chapbook-making workshops, and the intriguing “A Poet, a Playwright, and a Drag Queen” competitive storytelling session."


"At the APRIL book festival, I met a reader. Not a student, artist, teacher, or writer (I asked!)—just someone who enjoys reading. It felt kind of like glimpsing an exotic bird or maybe something more slow-moving, like the time I saw a sloth in Costa Rica."


Fund a Need


To give you a sense of what things cost to bring you this most epic of small press adventures, then please consider reviewing our fund a need below. This is also represented in our donor levels to the right. It is important to note that you can become a monthly donor and join The Inner Circle. Monthly billing is available by contacting Amber Nelson at amber@aprilfestival.com.


$25 – Just $25 supports independent literature by helping to fund APRIL props like balloons, raffle tickets, crazy masks, and all the other weirdo shtick you’ve come to know and love from APRIL events. As thanks for your support, APRIL’s very own Willie will make you your very own meme!


$50— It costs APRIL $50 per person to attend each free event during APRIL Festival. By supporting APRIL at this level, you help keep APRIL accessible to all. In thanks, you’ll receive your very own APRIL Tote or APRIL T-Shirt as well as personal phone reading from an APRIL small press author.


$120 or $10 per month— For $120 you can support things like the average cost of hosting local and visiting authors! Approximately 40 authors participate in APRIL every year, and in thanks for you supporting them, the APRIL staff will be your small press matchmaker—delivering 2 APRIL Small Press books to your doorstep.


$300 or $25 per month— Your support at this level is a significant contribution that allows APRIL to produce larger events like A Poet, a Playwright, a Novelist and a Drag Queen. In thanks for your incredible generosity, an APRIL author will write you fan mail!


$500 or $41.67 per month— Show our Writer-in-Residence the greatness of Seattle’s literary scene. You know what they say? GO BIG OR GO HOME. As a thanks for your incredibly generous support, you will get an exclusive opportunity to brunch with the APRIL Writer-in-Residence and the APRIL staff.


$1000 or $83.33 per month—You can make APRIL dreams come true! Major Donors support APRIL by offering the flexibility to bring you even more of the programming you’ve come to love and expect from APRIL. As a token of our gratitude for your incredible generosity, $1000 donors would be invited to a SECRET and EXCLUSIVE private reading and dining experience—an event so private and exclusive that even POTUS would be jealous.


$5000 - Matches 5 years worth of donated volunteer hours! For this incredible generosity, you will be a lifetime APRIL VIP and you will be invited to the $SECRET and EXCLUSIVE private reading and dining experience.



Our Mission

APRIL’s mission is to connect readers with independent literature and the authors and publishers of this vitalizing work


Our Vision

As motivation for our programming, APRIL envisions:

  • an increase in readers seeking out writing that is new and pertinent to them—writing that takes chances in both publication and performance and has greater potential for relevance in their lives;

  • readers actively reconsidering their definition of literature, its forms and its position in the arts;

  • independent literary producers—authors, publishers and writers of all kinds—thriving, with increased publicity and heightened reader engagement;

  • a reading public connecting as a more interactive social body—one that encourages creation and collaboration.

APRIL Values

  • literature as an indispensable element of our shared culture;

  • writing that takes risks, strikes out on a new path, negotiates from its own rubric, and speaks to a greater need;

  • the multiplicity of today’s literary arts–how literature manifests itself in books, online, hand-crafted chapbooks, zines, collaborative writing projects, conceptual readings, interpretive performances, and more;

  • creative possibility as a quality that sustains the literary arts and encourages growth;

  • unique, personal, and meaningful literary experiences that feed enthusiasm and promote active engagement and literacy;

  • communication as a crucial and gratifying element of human interaction.



APRIL is fiscally sponsored by Shunpike.

100% of the proceeds of the sale of this book will be donated to the Foundation for Space Development (developspacesa.org) to support their efforts in driving Space Awareness, Outreach & Education in Africa.

"I have always been told I am a mine of Useless Information"

In reality, I have found much of this "useless" information very valuable in my career.

I've used it to engage in meetings, to entertain friends & family and to break the ice when meeting new people.

The book is categorized by, & tackles burning questions in, S.T.E.A.M subjects:

Science

Technology

Engineering

Arts & Culture

Mathematics

Questions are answered in 3 levels of detail (from basic to advanced) with simple answers & easy to understand analogies. 

Original artwork from contributing artists make the book both unique & the knowledge memorable. 

This makes the book suitable for ages 8 to 80 to 800!

With the knowledge from this book you will amaze your friends, family & colleagues with your broad general knowledge & ability to provide simple answers!

 HAMMAN TIME on 5fm

The idea for this coffee table book came to me as a result of a weekly Radio appearance I make on the Nick Hamman show on 5fm national radio in South Africa.

Every Tuesday I pose a "Burning Question" that is space related, which listeners then get to call in, email or tweet their answers too.

I only have 4-5 minutes to give them the correct answer and additional background to what sometimes seems a very complex question.

From this I have learnt to condense the answers into their very base and simple concepts and communicate this over the air.

This has made me realize how useful it can be to understand the basic principles behind things, whether that is Einstein's Time Dilation equation from Special Relativity or the reason why we called the moons of Mars "Fear" & "Terror" (Phobos & Deimos from Greek Mythology).

Some of the questions I have answered on radio include:

  • Why is the Moon moving away from the Earth at 4cm per year?
  • Why should you not drink Champagne in Space?
  • How fast are we going & why can't we feel it?
  • What colour is the sun? (No, it's not yellow or even the Orange you see in Space pics)
  • "What is Dark Matter & Dark Energy and what do they do?" Bonus if you know why it's called Dark too!
  • Where does Space begin, why & what is the name of the Space boundary?
  • Why do we say we are looking back in time when we look at the stars?
  • Why does the moon Librate?
  • When is a year a measure of distance?
  • What is the difference between a Meteor & a Meteorite?
  • How many moons does Mars have, what are their names & why are the names just wrong?


PUBLISHING

I have decided to self publish the book initially with a run of 8.5" x 11" Hardcover and 6" x 9" Softcover editions.

I intend for the book to be as graphical and illustrative as possible and envisage a 50/50 space on the page split between graphics and text.

The number of pages and the sizes of each edition will be determined by the amount raised. This is why I have selected a flexible funding option.
I have created what I hope will be innovative perks, from a simple attribution through to the dedication and I thank you for supporting my effort to keep minds, young & old, inquisitive.
Who am I

I am a modern generalist!

I work mainly in aerospace & technology industries as a "Disruptionist" (I try and change the way things are done, especially by incorporating new technologies) with over 20 years of Entrepreneurial & C-level experience. 
My roles have included: 
Space Burning Question (weekly on 5fm - current)
Facilitator of Space Awareness Outreach (current)
Project Administrator of the AFRICA2MOON Mission (current)
Co-Founder of the Foundation for Space Development  
Business Developer & Consultant to various AeroSpace sector Organizations (current)
Editor of the Space Daily SA (current)
Organizer of IAC2011 
Running Multinational Technology Businesses. 
I studied Aeronautical Engineering at the University of the Witwatersrand from 1989 to 1993.

100% of the proceeds of the sale of this book will be donated to the Foundation for Space Development (developspacesa.org) to support their efforts in driving Space Awareness, Outreach & Education in Africa."I have always been told I am a mine of Useless Information" In reality, I have found much of this "useless" information very valuable in my career.I've used it to engage in meetings, to entertain friends & family and to break the ice when meeting new people.The book is categorized by, & tackles burning questions in, S.T.E.A.M subjects:ScienceTechnologyEngineeringArts & CultureMathematicsQuestions are answered in 3 levels of detail (from basic to advanced) with simple answers & easy to understand analogies. Original artwork from contributing artists make the book both unique & the knowledge memorable. This makes the book suitable for ages 8 to 80 to 800!With the knowledge from this book you will amaze your friends, family & colleagues with your broad general knowledge & ability to provide simple answers! HAMMAN TIME on 5fmThe idea for this coffee table book came to me as a result of a weekly Radio appearance I make on the Nick Hamman show on 5fm national radio in South Africa.Every Tuesday I pose a "Burning Question" that is space related, which listeners then get to call in, email or tweet their answers too.I only have 4-5 minutes to give them the correct answer and additional background to what sometimes seems a very complex question.From this I have learnt to condense the answers into their very base and simple concepts and communicate this over the air.This has made me realize how useful it can be to understand the basic principles behind things, whether that is Einstein's Time Dilation equation from Special Relativity or the reason why we called the moons of Mars "Fear" & "Terror" (Phobos & Deimos from Greek Mythology).Some of the questions I have answered on radio include:
Why is the Moon moving away from the Earth at 4cm per year?
Why should you not drink Champagne in Space?
How fast are we going & why can't we feel it?

What colour is the sun? (No, it's not yellow or even the Orange you see in Space pics)

"What is Dark Matter & Dark Energy and what do they do?" Bonus if you know why it's called Dark too!

Where does Space begin, why & what is the name of the Space boundary?

Why do we say we are looking back in time when we look at the stars?

Why does the moon Librate?

When is a year a measure of distance?

What is the difference between a Meteor & a Meteorite?

How many moons does Mars have, what are their names & why are the names just wrong?



PUBLISHINGI have decided to self publish the book initially with a run of 8.5" x 11" Hardcover and 6" x 9" Softcover editions.
I intend for the book to be as graphical and illustrative as possible and envisage a 50/50 space on the page split between graphics and text.

The number of pages and the sizes of each edition will be determined by the amount raised. This is why I have selected a flexible funding option.
I have created what I hope will be innovative perks, from a simple attribution through to the dedication and I thank you for supporting my effort to keep minds, young & old, inquisitive.

Who am I





I am a modern generalist!


I work mainly in aerospace & technology industries as a "Disruptionist" (I try and change the way things are done, especially by incorporating new technologies) with over 20 years of Entrepreneurial & C-level experience. 


My roles have included: Space Burning Question (weekly on 5fm - current)
Facilitator of Space Awareness Outreach (current)
Project Administrator of the AFRICA2MOON Mission (current)
Co-Founder of the Foundation for Space Development  Business Developer & Consultant to various AeroSpace sector Organizations (current)Editor of the Space Daily SA (current)Organizer of IAC2011 Running Multinational Technology Businesses. 

I studied Aeronautical Engineering at the University of the Witwatersrand from 1989 to 1993.

story:
THANK YOU!

The Rise of the Sharing Economy is now live. Please pop over to TriplePundit.com to check it out!

Ready to help save the world?

What can alleviate our economic and environmental problems while building community at the same time? The "sharing economy" is a new economic model based on accessing resources rather than owning them.

Sounds's amazing, but how do I get involved?

It's really simple:

Let's say you need a pickup truck to move some furniture. Your neighbor lends you his truck, and you pay him for the time. Now, extend that model to anything and use web-based social networking to connect with the entire world - not just your neighborhood. That's the sharing economy.

In a sharing economy, anyone can run a small business on the side, and you can have easy access to hundreds of things you never had before -without the financial, environmental, and time cost of ownership.

For our original intro video:  WATCH HERE.

So what's this campaign all about? What's it got to do with me?

For starters, wouldn't you like a stronger local economy, community, and environment?  By helping us mainstream this concept through media, you'll get all that.  

More specifically - we have a whole bunch of great perks lined up for campaign supporters. We think the perks speak for themselves - free driving credit, parking spaces, bikes...  100% of your support comes directly back to you in sharing economy perks.

This article series will help advance the sharing economy by mainstreaming its media coverage

TriplePundit and Shareable are teaming up to co-produce an article series on the sharing economy. We believe that one of the most sustainable ways to get widespread prosperity is to increase the volume and diversity of people sharing products and services.

We want to explore how. We decided to crowdsource the funding for this series to prove just how deep the opportunities run in the sharing economy. 

We've teamed up with some of the leading companies in the sharing economy to offer perks - discounts on their services in return for supporting our campaign. It's a win-win...

Here's what we plan to cover: 

  • Case studies on interesting sharing companies
  • How established companies are getting into the game
  • Is sharing an opportunity or a threat for companies that are used to the consumer model? 
  • How sharing can increase economic growth while lowering consumption
  • Government policy - help and hindrance
  • How to scale a sharing economy start-up
  • How to develop a sharing-based business model
  • Is the sharing economy innately sustainable?

And more! The more we raise, the longer the series can go on. We'll keep cranking all through 2013 if you want us to. 

The funds we raise will go to cover paying writers, editors, designers to produce the series. 

Here's what you'll get: 

We've got a ton of great perks to thank you for your support.

By contributing to the campaign, you will get the opportunity to engage directly with several companies leading the sharing economy movement. For each dollar given, you'll get at least a dollar back from our partners:

  • Rent a car on Wheelz - www.wheelz.com. Wheelz is a car sharing platform that connects people who want to put their cars to work with people who want to rent them
  • Try out a bike at Liquid - www.doliquid.com
  • Catch a ride, save money and meet a new friend on a trip to your favorite destination with Zimride - http://www.zimride.com/
  • Earn money doing nothing when you list your parking spot for rent on Park at my House - www.parkatmyhouse.com ($30 listing upgrade)
  • Fill your wallet with travel money when you rent a room on Flat-Club - www.flat-club.com
  • Rent a car from your neighbour from www.carnextdoor.com.au. Available in Sydney’s eastern suburbs now, and throughout Australia by mid 2013.
  • Dress for success with T's and hoodies from couchsurfing.com
  • Educate yourself on the sharing economy with bestsellers "Share or Die" and "The Mesh"
  • And more! 

Where does the money go?

Journalism is expensive. We've got a pack of writers to take care of, website and design costs, research costs, travel, and in this case quite a bit of marketing overhead.  The big win here isn't just to make our readers smarter, it's to spread the idea of the sharing economy far and wide, bring in new readers, and make sharing mainstream.

The Impact

Many Indiegogo users probably understand the opportunities of the sharing economy already. As leaders in this new economy, this is your chance to bring the message to a wider audience. TriplePundit and Shareable Magazine have a combined readership of over 300,000 readers per month. By exposing our audiences to the stories above, you'll be helping to spread the message far and wide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to tell your friends about the campaign! 

Who are we?

TriplePundit.com is one of the most widely read websites on sustainable business - aka green, responsible, good business that makes a difference in the world. Shareable is the online magazine that tells the story of sharing.  Together we reach more than 300,000 people a month and intend to reach many more with your help!

For our original intro video:  WATCH HERE.

story:
Sigurd is Strength

Thor, Woden, Indra, Perun, Arthur, Aragorn, Robin Hood, Volsung, Sigurd...what do these heroes and gods have in common? What do all heroes have in common? Prodigious strength, internal and external, and the passion to secure their goals, by whatever means. This is the path of the warrior, the path which we tread tentatively, following the steps of the ancestors, of the martial cultures of this bright planet. 

The aim of religion, with the method of powerlifting. The goal of the warrior through the prism of strongman. We lift heavy stuff, we wrestle, we fight, we make bonds of brotherhood, we eat pork, drink mead and fuck maidens, but above all we see the power and mystery of the myth and its recurrent influence on our daily lives.

This book will tell you about yourself, and why your strength matters.

Keeping Power in Our Hands

This book has been in the making for a thousand years, the men of old knew its truths, but they are truths which have been lost or obscured, hidden in the recesses of the minds of the peasants. 

Men tested each other once, in the name of Thor and thunder gods around the world, they lifted heavy stuff, sang songs of old heroes, shared their food and wine, wrestled and danced together under the immoveable stars. 

We invoke that tradition.

  • We need £250-£500 to produce a good healthy first run of the Sigurd Book
  • With the sales of the book we will fund local projects, strongman contests, wrestling contests and the reading and display of folk art projects and the reading of sagas and poems

A Spark in Dry Wood

For millennia across the world martial cultures invoked the name of their gods and heroes to challenge death itself. A hero was made by his people and the people around him. He ate, drank and lived within the era in which he was born, but his soul and his name would live forever. 

The dry tinder of our spiritual stagnation has now come to an end, across the world people feel the need for a spiritual rebirth, a reawakening of what it means to be a warrior, to be strong, to be loud and defiant in protection of what you hold dear.

  • The Book of the Heroic Outlaw is but the first step in a long line of projects which the founders have in store
  • We are a transparent and earthy people, our goal is the re-wilding of our souls, not just the immersion in old ways and customs, but the invoking of old ways and customs in a new light, the light of the dawning Aeon

Sound in the Deep One Last Time

If you're unable to contribute by buying one of the Sigurd Books, you are still able to help the evolution of this idea:

  • Start a strongman contest, amateurs and first timers are the lifeblood of any community; get friends together and lift something heavy, share in the feeling of martial wakefulness and hit each other with things. Drink, make merry, celebrate your life and sing the old songs in the old ruins of the old temples.
  • You can share all of this information with the people around you, invoke your god, become a living archetype in memory of who you once were, let Indra ride roughshod over the stagnant pools of your self-doubt, awaken Agni, ignite!

story:
Una mano por la PAZ

Ayúdanos a sanar las heridas de la violencia

Solicitamos tu contribución para que el Centro de Ayuda ALAPÁS continúe ofreciendo servicios gratuitos a las víctimas de delito en Puerto Rico. Lo recaudado en esta campaña servirá para costear las oficinas del Centro, particularmente el salón donde se brindan las terapias de los niños y niñas y se realizan las reuniones del Grupo de Apoyo.

El propósito del Centro de Ayuda ALAPÁS es ofrecer, en forma gratuita, apoyo, orientación y psicoterapia individual y grupal a los que perdieron un ser querido víctima de asesinato u homicidio, carjacking, accidentes automovilísticos por causa de conductor ebrio o intoxicado y por negligencia crasa al conducir. Brindamos servicios tanto a adultos como a menores.

El Centro de Ayuda ALAPÁS comenzó a ofrecer servicios a partir del 9 de enero de 2007. El Centro atiende a las víctimas desde el momento en que ocurre el delito y sin necesidad de referido, lo que facilita a la víctima acceso rápido a un servicio tan necesario. En vista de que proveemos servicios integrados y especializados recibimos participantes de todo Puerto Rico. A nuestro Centro, que ubica en Río Piedras,  han llegado familias de Utuado, Salinas, Peñuelas, Quebradillas, San Sebastián, Vieques, Loiza, Fajardo...sólo por mencionar algunos municipios.

Cuando nuestros participantes llegan, encuentran un ambiente acogedor, de paz y profesionales y voluntarios/as comprometidos/as que les proveen los siguientes servicios:

  • Intervención en crisis
  • Consejería individual
  • Consejería grupal
  • Consejería telefónica
  • Orientación legal
  • Acompañamiento al tribunal
  • Intercesoría
  • Referidos
Para nosotros/as es muy importante que, además de los servicios psicoterapéuticos que reciben los participantes, conozcan sus derechos como víctimas para que puedan hacerlos valer. El empoderamiento los/as fortalece y les ayuda enfrentar un sistema judicial que no es sensible ante las víctimas y muchas veces las revictimiza.

Una vez al mes nuestros participantes asisten al Grupo de Apoyo ALAPÁS, que se ha reunido ininterrumpidamente por 16 años. De esta manera, se complementa la terapia individual. En las reuniones del Grupo de Apoyo, los integrantes tienen la oportunidad de expresar su sentir y sus necesidades entre personas que los comprenden porque han sufrido la misma experiencia.  Aquí se desborda la empatía y se crean vínculos indisolubles.

El lema de nuestra organización es "Transformar el dolor en solidaridad y paz". Por eso, cada vez que una familia sale fortalecida de nuestro Centro de Ayuda, cada vez que puede a pesar del dolor, abrazar la paz, confirmamos la importancia de nuestro trabajo y sabemos que hacemos lo que tenemos que hacer.

Tú también puedes aportar a transformar el país. Con tu contribución garantizas nuestra presencia y nuestros servicios gratuitos para las víctimas de delito.

 Recuerda que somos:

Una organización sin fines de lucro que se constituyó en memoria de la poeta Laura Isabel Aponte Rivera, joven universitaria de 19 años, quien falleció el 22 de junio de 1997, al recibir una bala perdida mientras se encontraba en la discoteca Hollywood en el viejo San Juan. 

La misión de ALAPÁS es trabajar en favor de las víctimas de delito, promoviendo sus derechos en el marco de la justicia social y ofreciendo servicios integrados dirigidos a su sanación.

Esta misión se articula a través de proyectos que integran la educación, la prevención y la sanación. Nuestros proyectos son el Centro de Ayuda ALAPÁS, el Bosque de los Siemprevivos, ALAPÁS Educa y ALAPÁS en la Comunidad.

Algunos logros de los últimos años:

2012- Haber desarrollado junto a otras organizaciones como COPREVI, Nuestra Escuela, Pero Hoy no es el Día, Asociación de Psicología de Puerto Rico, Agenda Ciudadana, INIPRODEH y AARP, la Estrategia Nacional de Seguridad Pública Solidaria.

2011- Reconocimiento como modelo a seguir por Hablando de Filantropía.

2011- Lograr la publicación de ALAPÁS: La Revista, en la que presentamos temas sociales desde la perspectiva de la víctima.

2010 - Premio Solidaridad: Honrando lo que nos une.

2010 - Participación con el taller: La Esperanza de las Víctimas en el Torcido Camino del Derecho en el Congreso Internacional de Derecho Penal, auspiciado por El Colegio de Abogados de Puerto Rico.

2009 - Reconocimiento del Departamento de Justicia en ocasión de la Semana de los Derechos de las Víctimas.


Sala de espera Centro de Ayuda

Sala de espera Centro de Ayuda

Espacio para interacción de los participantes con nuestros especialistas psicólogos, estudiantes en práctica y intercesores de derechos a víctimas del crimen.

story:
Short Summary

In 2005, I enlisted in the United States Marine Corps. I was unwortrhy to join such an elite group. I was sent to the Physical Conditioning platoon, where nightmares awaited. There, no training takes place. No schedules, no nothing. So the Drill Instructor gets to do whatever he wants. We would be punished at random every single day for the majority of our day. I've witnessed many a suicide there, and those melancholy faces still haunt me today.

The funds reveived would help me market this book I lived, and tell the story of those who didn't survive that platoon. It will honor them, and their loved ones. People need to hear this inspiring true story.

What We Need & What You Get

I would fund it myself, but I work at a low income job and I have a wife and three kids to support. Subsequently, that idea is out the window. That's why I launched this campaign. Every little bit helps. The funds will go directly into a bank account opened under my book's title, and that money will be used solely for marketing the book, and setting up events for it in different cities. 

$1 donation= A special thanks on my fan page

$5 donation= A free copy of the book, and a special thanks on my fan page

$10 donation= Everything above, plus an autographed book poster

$25 donation= Everything above, and a short story written for you of whatever you would like

$35 donation= Everything above, including a song about you written by Ian Suhovy of The Jacktones

The Impact

So far, I have starred in several films, all scheduled to be released in the near future. Other writings of mine have been published in various books since high school, but none this insightful. many veterans write about war. That's been done over and over. I wanted to be different, so I chose a specific time in boot camp, where I found redemption, and became what I aspired to be. In war, there is no redemption, trust me I've done it. 

People have reviewed this book, saying "it changed their life", and I want to make sure that everybody has the chance to read it, and possibly change their lives as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you simply can't make a donation. That's OK with me. You can still help by sharing this link. The more people who see it, the better chances the book has to be recognized. Thank you so much for your consideration. I truly appreciate it.

"The greatest gift in life is helping others"

story:
Help Restore the 4th D.C meet our goal!

 

This campaign was created in order to help RTFDC offset the costs of needed supplies, advertising, permits, event insurance and other associated costs.

RTFDC would like to reach as many people as possible. In order to do so, we would like to take out a full page ad in the Washington Post. 

The rate for a full-run color premium broadsheet ad is $13,1912.  We most likely will have to run a smaller ad, which run anywhere from 100-1,000.00  per sqaure inch for a fun run.

 

 

We are also printing 5000 4x6 color flyers to distribute throughout the DMV region.

At this time, we are still estimating the cost of supplies, but here are some of the supplies we will need:

First Aid Supplies 

Bottled Water

Snacks

Possible Portable Toilet Rental

1st Goal: $2,000- Enough to cover the ad, permit,  event insurance, and some basic supplies.

2nd Goal $3,000- Enough to cover the ad, permit the color flyers, event insurance and basic supplies

3rd Goal $4,000- Enough to cover the ad, permit, the color flyers, event insurance, well-stocked supplies, and create some promotional items for the event, such as t-shirts, buttons, posters,etc

Long-Shot Goal: $5,000 Enough to cover all of the above, plus  allow us to donate to our chosen organization, the ACLU.

story:
Earlier this year, I was announced as the new Poet Laureate of Michigan's Upper Peninsula! It's a two-year position (2015-2017), and I am only the second person to hold it. Here’s the unfortunate thing: the UP Poet Laureate is a completely grassroots endeavor, which means NO FUNDING comes with the position. That's right: no grant money or stipend or piggy bank of coins. So in order to do the fun things I want to do over the next two years, I need YOUR help!

How will your donations be used? To help support poetry projects across Michigan’s Upper Peninsula over the next two years. I want to use the Poet Laureate-ship to help get poetry onto the streets and trails and into people’s everyday lives. 

Here's just one of my projects: my friend and amazing builder Scotty Allen is building a mobile Free Little Poetry Library using UP materials like cedar shakes! The idea behind the Free Little Library movement is to bring libraries out into the world and make their books more accessible. You walk by on the way to the grocery, you see a book you like, you take it home, and maybe you come back and donate a book later! Our Free Little Poetry Library will be stocked full of POETRY and will be mobile so I can load it into my Blue Subaru and set it up in different locations across the UP. The Free Little Poetry Library will launch in Marquette on June 20 as part of Art Week, and then continue to spread poetry love across the UP the rest of the summer. 

And did you say beer? I thought you did! How about a Poetry Hop-ping Tour with poets reading at the myriad local breweries across the UP?! Stay tuned for Summer 2016. 

And then there are less glamorous things like purchasing food for poetry receptions and printing fliers and gas money to fuel my adventures across the UP— DO YOU KNOW HOW BIG THE UP IS? 16,377 square miles, according to Wikipedia. Or about 300 miles long and 100 miles wide. That’s a lot of ground to cover. And I would love to be able to carbon offset my Poet Laureate travels so that spreading poetry doesn't needlessly harm the environment. One 120 mile roundtrip--say from Marquette to the Escanaba Public Library where I'll be doing a reading in September--can be offset with your $15 donation! 

Two years of poetry projects + zero funding = your help needed! 

Once you factor in the Free Little Poetry Library building cost ($400), the reading and reception to honor the outgoing UP Poet Laureate Russell Thorburn ($150), flier printing and distribution costs ($100 for each event), gas money ($2.50 a gallon X 30 miles per gallon = a lot of gas money). . . well, you can see where this is going. So please help! Your donation will help bring stellar poetry projects all across Michigan's Upper Peninsula!

story:
Short Summary

Warrior Writers is hard at work putting together our fourth anthology and now we need your help to publish it! If you believe that the stories of our veterans should be heard, their poetry read, and their artwork contemplated, please support this project! This anthology will include work from over 70 veterans and service members from all walks of life, including veterans who served in conflicts as early as the Vietnam War. More than 20 veteran and civilian volunteers have helped with the production process. Participation in Warrior Writers has transformed the lives of many veterans and service members, breaking down the walls of isolation and providing focus, purpose, and a creative community. 

Veterans supporting other veterans is a powerful force! Writing and artwork generated in the workshops has served as a bridge between veterans and civilians, increasing the insight and understanding of the general public while also helping veterans communicate their experiences in the military and after service to friends and families. Warrior Writers has published three anthologies already: Move, Shoot and Communicate (2007), Re-Making Sense (2008), and After Action Review (2011), and we can't wait to get our next book out to the public! 


What We Need

We will need $10,000 to publish this anthology and get it into the hands of the public and our community. Your generous donation will help us to cover costs associated with publication, including printing 2,000 copies of the book, making it available as an e-book, obtaining an ISBN number and bar code, and covering costs for shipping and book release events in cities where we have active chapters. Warrior Writers depends on the support of our donors to offer free programs for veterans and service members. Since our founding, we have hosted more than 150 workshops and events across the United States. Your donation will help us to cover the additional cost of publication, ensuring that we can continue to provide copies of our books to veteran contributors and workshop participants at no cost. If we raise more than $10,000, you will empower us to do even more public performances and book release events.


The Impact

For some of our new writers, this anthology marks a turning point in their lives. This book is an opportunity for them to share their stories honestly with their community for the first time. For our long-time participants, the book will be a reflection of how their writing and they themselves have changed throughout the years. For you, our allies, supporting this publication is an important step that you can take to help us further bridge the gap between veterans and civilians. By taking these veterans’ art into your life, you add texture and truth to your understanding of their experiences. 


What You Get

We are excited to send you awesome perks for supporting our campaign! With your donation, you can receive copies of our fourth anthology and other books, signed books, handmade Warrior Writers bookmarks, Warrior Writers stickers and t-shirts, DVDs with recorded performances, special edition copies of the new anthology with covers made by veterans out of combat paper, and more! We may even arrange to come to your city to do a performance in exchange for your generosity! We encourage you to pool your money together with your friends and share some of the bigger perks. If you can't donate, there are other ways you can help!

  • Make some noise and get the word out about our campaign. We know you know people who need this book in their lives! Please share this campaign with your networks.
  • Join us at events near you! For a full list of events, visit our website.
  • Purchase copies of our last three anthologies.
  • Follow and engage with us on social media! By interacting with us online, you help our posts reach more supporters.
  • Have another idea? Get in touch with us at info@warriorwriters.org.

Warrior Writers is a project of CultureTrust Greater Philadelphia, which operates under the fiscal stewardship of CultureWorks Greater Philadelphia. We provide opportunities for community and artistic exploration and expression among veterans through welcoming workshops and retreats. Our mission is to create a culture that articulates the experiences of veterans. By providing a creative community for artistic expression and bearing witness to the lived experiences of warriors we help to bridge the gap between veterans and civilians.

story:
Our mission is simple: Reach the Rez 

and empower through art!

As/Us: A Space for Women of the World is a creation of daughters, wives, sisters, and lovers who participate in the evolution of journal publication for Indigenous women and women of color. As artists, we exercise our craft and creativity to address the challenges in the publishing realm and the lack of diversity that exists within the literary world. As/Us is the beginning, the beginning of a journal to honor voices by publishing the multiple realities in which we exist to reflect and create discourse by challenging perceptions. 

  • To include our allies, as well as men of color and supporters, we provide opportunities to include publication for supporting artists. 
  • It is our commitment as artists to promote each other. Within each publication, we feature a young artist or writer. 

You can learn more about our journal at http://asusjournal.org 

Help As/Us "Reach the Rez."

Our "Reach the Rez" campaign helps As/Us to reach out to the youth, as well as the community, by promoting art and literature. 

The campaign aligns with progressive empowerment within the future of our nations. By reading and experiencing relatable familiarities, a voice is created with inspiration—art becomes a medium, a voice, to express themselves through their creation. Anything, then, becomes possible.

In exchange for a monetary donation, issues will be sent to schools, libraries, community/or reservations of your choice. Each donation will help As/Us promote empowering writers and artists of the world by supplying classrooms, schools, and communities with journals throughout the nation(s).

Our goal is $3,000. This allows As/Us to continue production on a regular and continual basis.

Funds will go to production costs (InDesign), shipping (sending issues to your selected school), marketing (logo and brand), and the continuation of providing copies to contributors. All funding goes to costs.  

Suggested Schools/Communities for Donations: 

  • Cache High School, Cache OK
  • Boone-Apache High School, Apache, OK
  • Jemez Valley HS, Jemez Pueblo NM
  • Walatowa Charter, Jemez Pueblo, NM
  • Lumberton HS, Lumberton, NC
  • Fairmont HS, Fairmont, NC
  • Purnell Swett HS, Pembroke NC
  • Red Springs HS, Red Springs, NC
  • South Robeson HS, Rowland, NC
  • Rock Point Community School, Rock Point, AZ
  • Red Mesa HS, Red Mesa, AZ
  • Shiprock HS, Shiprock, NM
  • Tohatchi HS, Tohatchi, NM
  • White Horse HS, Montezuma Creek, UT
  • San Juan HS, Blanding, UT
  • Little Wound HS, Kyle SD
  • Oelrichs HS, Oelrichs, SD
  • Red Cloud Indian School, Pine Ridge, SD
  • Pine Hill HS, Pine Hill NM 
  • Ignacio HS, Ignacio, CO
  • Pendleton HS, Pendleton OR
  • Nixyaawii Charter School, Pendleton, OR
  • Native American Community Academy, Albuquerque, NM
  • Wanbli Wiconi Tipi, juvenile detention center, Rosebud, SD
  • Metropolitan Detention Center, Albuquerque NM 
  • Bernalillo High School, Bernalillo NM 
  • Bernalillo County Juvenile Detention Center, Albuquerque NM

If you want to send books to a school/community NOT on the list that is completely fine and we welcome it. Just make sure you provide us with the correct shipping address and a contact person to send it to. You can also contact us via email at as.us.journal@gmail.com


We believe in creating these spaces in the world.

Through art and imagination, an artist can re-imagine themselves by showing artistic communities truths and changes, plus evolutions of growth. 

 As/Us invents a journal with accessibility, publishing four issues: two online, two hardcopies. Our voice began in August 2012. Each voice containing stories of shared threads and demonstrations of not only being an empowered woman, but being human in this world. Our voice is heard in over 125 countries, worldwide.

In 2012 and 2013, As/Us provided readings at Stanford University, Harvard Boston: Rise Up, the Milton Conference in South Dakota, multiple venues in Albuquerque NM, and Santa Fe. Upcoming readings and panel discussions in 2014 include the Native American Literature Symposium (NALS) in Minnesota, and the Indigenous Book and Authors Festival at the University of New Mexico. 

Art is a vehicle for transformation 



If you selected a reward/perk for your donation:

You should receive it by March 30th. All books/issues should be sent to the schools, communities, reservations, or libraries of your choice by March 30th. Make sure you provide us with the address where you would like the issues sent. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family
  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.
  • Share the journal with family and friends.

story:
So what is Grim, anyway?

Grim is a brand new horror magazine published by rabid female horror fans: it includes essays, reviews, analyses, interviews, humour content, and short fiction contributed by a variety of talented and enthusiastic writers. We especially want to showcase the voices of women, POC and LGBTQ+ people -- our first issue celebrated women in horror (and was released during Women in Horror month, naturally!)

Grim is the first digital magazine project by anatomyofascream.com. This ongoing crowdfunding campaign will help cover the costs of producing the magazine. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are truly grateful for every donation or pledge we get -- every dollar goes towards the costs of publishing the magazine
  • In exchange for their much-appreciated help, donors will be given perks including early access to the digital magazine and copies of the print magazine (and maybe even stickers!)

The Impact

  • With Grim, we want to promote the voices of women and LGBTQ+ folks in the horror community, which has had a reputation for being a boy's club. We think that we offer some great perspectives on the films that we all love!
  • We want to interview and profile women who work in film, from producers to directors to composers to makeup artists and more! 
  • We want to offer new analyses and frameworks through which to appreciate the horror genre, shifting perspectives and deepening understandings!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that money is tight for a lot of us (hence this campaign existing in the first place). Maybe you just can't contribute -- that's totally okay! You can still help us out by spreading word of the campaign, maybe by sending a link to your horror-loving friend or sharing it on Twitter or Facebook.

Every share counts! <3
