story_txt:
So what is Grim, anyway?
Grim is a brand new horror magazine published by rabid female horror fans: it includes essays, reviews, analyses, interviews, humour content, and short fiction contributed by a variety of talented and enthusiastic writers. We especially want to showcase the voices of women, POC and LGBTQ+ people -- our first issue celebrated women in horror (and was released during Women in Horror month, naturally!)
Grim is the first digital magazine project by anatomyofascream.com. This ongoing crowdfunding campaign will help cover the costs of producing the magazine. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

We are truly grateful for every donation or pledge we get -- every dollar goes towards the costs of publishing the magazine
In exchange for their much-appreciated help, donors will be given perks including early access to the digital magazine and copies of the print magazine (and maybe even stickers!)


The Impact

With Grim, we want to promote the voices of women and LGBTQ+ folks in the horror community, which has had a reputation for being a boy's club. We think that we offer some great perspectives on the films that we all love!
We want to interview and profile women who work in film, from producers to directors to composers to makeup artists and more! 
We want to offer new analyses and frameworks through which to appreciate the horror genre, shifting perspectives and deepening understandings!

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that money is tight for a lot of us (hence this campaign existing in the first place). Maybe you just can't contribute -- that's totally okay! You can still help us out by spreading word of the campaign, maybe by sending a link to your horror-loving friend or sharing it on Twitter or Facebook.
Every share counts! <3
Thank you!

story:
Hi. My name is Michael Tullberg, and I’m one of the longest-running electronic music photojournalists in North America. During the 1990s and 2000s, I worked for most of the major dance music magazines in this country, covering the hottest and most controversial music scene in the land: the rave scene.

That’s right, the rave underground. The secret dance music network. The parties that were so intense, they became instant classics as their growing legions of fans raved happily well into the morning. And now you can go back and experience those heady and fantastic days for yourself by contributing to fund my new upcoming book, The Raver Stories Project.

The Raver Stories Project is about the rave scene as it exploded worldwide like wildfire. It zooms in on the incredible and amazing moments experienced by the people in the rave scene itself. It’s not written by journalists, academics or critics who have no first-hand knowledge of this culture...but rather, by the people on the dance floor. The ravers, DJs and promoters themselves. This has never been done before in this country, which makes this volume both unique and important, on top of being richly entertaining. The Raver Stories Project is the first book to tell what raving was (and is) really like, from the point of view of those who were actually there, as opposed to the outside pundits and press who never truly understood what was really going on.

When I began covering the rave scene years ago, I was immediately struck by the unique sense of participation in the scene by the fans themselves, unlike any other social group I'd witnessed before. The rave scene was different, in that the fans were just as important part of this pop culture equation as the artists were. It allowed the near-total freedom of self-expression, in terms of fashion, musical taste, and of course, dance. You could literally do anything on the dance floor. You could be anything on the dance floor, and you wouldn't be judged or belittled. The rave scene eliminated the barriers of class, social status, race and sexuality. It was a glorious example of celebrating life through dance.

However, traditionally the voice of the fans of electronic music has been overlooked by the mainstream media, who have instead chosen to focus mostly on the controversies associated with the scene, usually in a very negatively slanted fashion. I personally consider this to be deeply unfair, because it is the fans who are the backbone of any scene or movement. It is the memorable moments that the fans are experiencing on the dance floor that make the scene go forward, grow and evolve. You can have the best DJs in the world at a party, but if no one is there dancing to their music, all those DJs are doing is playing for each other.

Back in the day, magazines like URB and Lotus performed the function of letting the fans share their views and experiences with the rest of the planet. Sadly, those magazines are no more, and the mainstream has since failed to provide a fair and open forum for these fans. A group that has grown and evolved as successfully as the rave scene has over the last twenty-five years (for example, the Electric Daisy Carnival festival now takes in nearly 150,000 people per day) does not deserve to be dismissed by those who do not understand why these people do what they do. Yet, this is exactly what has happened.

This is why in the winter of 2016, I put out a Call For Submissions to the global electronic music community, asking them to write their best stories down and send them to me. The response I received was phenomenal. I was inundated with stories from all over the world, and the majority of the authors had dug deep inside themselves and came up with accounts that were at times truly mind-blowing.

The range and variety of the stories proved to be fantastic. There's material about Burning Man, Electric Daisy Carnival and Ministry Of Sound, to name just a few. There are tales of events at warehouses, nightclubs, deserts, mountains, houses, mansions and stadiums. They start in England in the late 80s and finish up in present-day America, chronicling the growth of this worldwide dance movement.

Some stories are of one night. Others cover years of their author’s life. Both are legitimate, for they show how peoples’ lives are affected by the rave scene, both in the short-term and lifelong. Most are uplifting, but we've also got a few from the underbelly as well.

More than anything, The Raver Stories Project is about the diversity of experience that comes with being part of the global dance culture. It's not just partyers on the dance floor throwing their hands up and being silly. It's people coming together in a unique, embracing, tight-knit community that touches something deep inside of them.

Both the old-school rave and today's EDM generations are represented here, because both are part of the greater history of this scene, and therefore each must be represented. From Josh Wink and Paul Oakenfold to the Chainsmokers and Skrillex, from vinyl to CDs to laptops, from warehouses to stadiums…it’s all part of the same overall story, and the individual tales are the bricks that make up this big, beautiful house.

WHAT ARE YOU PAYING FOR? The printing of the book. Getting lots of books printed up isn’t exactly cheap, as you might expect. Thus, this is where the money is going—the making of an unforgettable collection of rave stories that would be at home on the bookshelf of any electronic music or pop culture fan.

And as you can see, we've got a bunch of cool rewards for those who choose to support this project. Of course, the biggest reward is the book itself, which you can reserve for yourself with a donation, below the book’s retail price. And, this campaign is the ONLY way that you can reserve your copy ahead of publication! California residents get a special bonus: NO SALES TAX!  And that's not all! You can also receive CUSTOM PHOTO PRINTS of several of the images appearing in my earlier book DANCEFLOOR THUNDERSTORM, in 5"x7", 8"x10" and 11"x14" sizes! You can even get a copy of DANCEFLOOR THUNDERSTORM for yourself as well, also below the retail price!

If we exceed our target donation amount, we're certainly open to stretch goals.  We definitely want to meet the demands of the fans of the music, so if we take in enough to expand the initial printing beyond our planned amount, that becomes a distinct possibility.

So come take part in electronic music history, by contributing to The Raver Stories Project!  Yes, it really is all good.

 

***UPDATE***!!!

Check out this time-lapse of Michael shooting one of the candidates for the book's cover!

story:
Short Summary



Join me in helping 1,000 of our nation’s neediest youth conquer the mindset that poverty often brings, all while getting into the success mindset to achieve your goals at the same time!

I'm Andrew McDonald, author, speaker, and founder of my company Possess Your Success, which helps helps those in high school, college, and beyond to achieve success in their personal development goals.

The youth I’m targeting don’t often have the loving environment at home that some experience. They don’t have people telling them that they can achieve their goals.

And certainly, no one is breaking down the exact steps they need to take to reach their goals in simple language that is easy to understand and implement. 

I've seen the results firsthand--in my own family, in fact--of the unfortunate decisions and actions of misguided youth. I'm committed to ensuring these students find a better way to live their lives and possess their success with my upcoming book, Possess Your Success: Mastering the Limitless Success Method.


Why do we need this money?



There are a lot of costs that go into creating a well designed, inspiring book like Possess Your Success. Luckily, we know how to stretch a dollar! The best thing is that I’ve contributed my energy free of charge to collect the research and write the 10 chapter book. I’ve completed the book and the manuscript is already ready for print!

Your money will also contribute to the funds we already have to help cover:

  • inspiring 1,000 of our nation’s neediest high school youth across the nation with a message of inspiration by giving them a copy of Possess Your Success
  • creating two (2) $500 scholarships to rising seniors of the 2017 class for the school of their choice
  • collecting inspiring stories from the students who wish to submit an entry to our essay contest about how they've possessed their success using a certain chapter of my book
  • publication and book printing costs
  • distribution to the 1,000 youth across our nation, and
  • travel costs associated with speaking at the beneficiary schools

Anything collected beyond our goal will go toward providing even more books and scholarships to students, as well as compensating the many strategic partners who are donating their time and resources to this project.

To give a copy of this book to 1,000 students across the nation, run a strong essay contest to get them engaged with the material, and to launch our national campaign, we need $15,000.


The Impact

Why do we want to work with this population of our nation’s youth?

    a.   The youth we’re targeting don’t often have the loving environment at home that many of us may have experienced.

    b.   They don’t have people telling them that they can achieve their goals.

    c.   And certainly, no one is breaking down the steps they need to take to reach their goals in simple language that is easy to understand and implement.

    d.   It’s on us--me and you--to bring inspiration to these loving souls.


Will I want this book even if I’m a grown up and not in school?



The short answer--YES, absolutely!

Grace Conyers, CEO of Insanitek said this about my book:

“It's not often you find a motivational book that makes you want to stop reading and just start living your dream. Possess Your Success does just that while provoking “what if” thoughts and challenging you to be a better you. McDonald has a way of motivating you while getting you to think about all the possibilities that lie before you.”

Possess Your Success is perfect for any age group, and there are a lot of powerful life lessons for anyone who wants to get in the right frame of mind to achieve the things in your life.

Years of observation reveals that the secret to success is not a secret at all, but instead the result of deliberate actions and methods towards progress that the average person overlooks.

With this book, you’ll learn my 3-step method to perform beyond your limits and achieve your goals. I show you this remarkable process, how it works, and why it works.

This book also equips you with the tools necessary to fend off threats to your success, such as negative emotions, dream-killers, fear, and failure in a simple-to-understand manner.


You also learn:

  • The difference between the Limited and the Limitless
  • How to use fear and failure to your advantage
  • The Five Forces the world-changers use to impose their will on the world
  • How to form a strong, three layer base of supportive individuals to help push you forward
  • How to renew your mind to prevent negative thoughts and emotions from taking control of your life
  • The factors to consider before you make a leap of faith


Here’s what others are saying about my book:

"I think your book is a gem. I have read many success books and yours brings a fresh perspective and genuineness. The mentor section is phenomenal. I also like how you incorporated the mindset of giving. I look forward to reading the finished product and sharing it with friends." 

- Britney Clark, Finance & Accounting Analyst - Madison, MI
"From what I've read thus far, it's been an incredible read. I imagined sharing it with my team. It's thoughtful and insightful and gives real, practical advice that people can use. I look forward to reading more." 

- Martin Matthews, Investment Advisor Representative - Atlanta, GA

Still want to learn more? Download the first 2 chapters of my book FREE.


Beyond money--we need your help spreading the word

At its heart, #PossessYourSuccess is a grassroots movement driven by parents, teachers, friends, and any loving soul who cares about our youth taking ownership of their success.

Whether or not you donate to our campaign, you can still help us make history.

Anyone, anywhere can help spread the word and help us connect with the neediest school districts should get involved.

Ways you can help:

  • Do you know someone who works at one of our nation’s neediest schools? A dedicated teacher, principal, or board member? Share this page so they can submit their request for autographed copies of Possess Your Success. 
  • Recruit a local group to get involved by donating time or energy to our work.
  • Share this page for them to ask how they can get involved. This opportunity is great for Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, and any other similar organization to get involved by donating time to our movement. We’ll find really awesome ways for them to get involved!
  •  If you know a business or organization who would love to be our sponsoring donor--see our perks below about sponsorship--connect us to them! Email me directly at amcdonald@possessyoursuccess.com. They’ll get an opportunity to have a dedication page in the digital and/or printed copies of the book.
  • Stay connected. Follow #PossessYourSuccess on Facebook and on Twitter to stay up-to-date on our movement.


FAQs

How will the funds be used?

  • Funds will be used to print the books for the 1,000 youth across our nation.
  • Funds will also be used to fulfill the perks that are selected for our awesome supporters.
How will you determine which students will be given a copy of Possess Your Success?
  • We will partner closely with the beneficiary high schools to determine what method of distribution is best for each one. We feel this will increase participation and enthusiasm in the campaign by the schools.
Is this campaign international?
  • Yes! But just remember, Possess Your Success is written in English.

Can I donate from outside the USA?

  • Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, but not international bank or debit cards. Unfortunately we can’t accept PayPal, so the way to donate internationally is with a credit card.

What payment methods do you accept?

  • Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.
Can I get a copy of Possess Your Success with my donation?

  • Yes, some donor levels include a copy of Possess Your Success!

Is shipping included?

  • Yup

Does international shipping cost extra?

  • Yes, but Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is included in the suggested donation price.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, with any campaign, there are bound to be risks and challenges to our success. Here are some of the likely hurdles we will have to face:

Students may not appreciate or utilize the book.
  • We are creating the two $500 scholarships in order to provide additional incentive to get excited and read the book.
Some school districts have stringent policies on what literature can be given out.
  • We will work with the school districts and ensure Possess Your Success is in line with their policies. Every district is different, but we are confident we can find schools that will be happy to enrich their students' lives via this book.
We may not find enough high schools that are willing to accept our books.
  • Of course, this is a risk, but with the thousands of high schools across the country that could benefit from this campaign, we believe this is a small risk. In fact, we already have received initial interest from at least 3 schools!
The schools' administrators may not give the books out to the students once delivered.
  • We will work closely with the beneficiary high schools, and I plan to speak at each of them to provide additional inspiration and motivation while ensuring the books get distributed.

story:
A safe place to sleep – how important is it to your peace of mind?

At Midsouth Sober Living, we believe it’s a crucial part of achieving and maintaining long term sobriety. Since 2008, MSL has been providing sober living/transitional housing for people who are new in recovery. Your donation will help provide new bed bug resistant frames, mattresses and bed linens to all residents in our three facilities.

Our nonprofit sober living houses have served more than 115 newly sober residents in the past twelve months, from all over Memphis and Shelby County and from all walks of life. We offer safe, affordable drug- and alcohol-free housing, helping our residents reduce the risk of relapse and remain on the path to recovery.

Your donation will help us ensure that every bed we offer is truly one where folks can rest assured.

A safe bed for the start of a recovery journey

Some of our bed frames are already great, ready to withstand years of use and any creepy-crawlies that might launch an attack. Others - well, they're really ticking time bombs, given the number of folks that move through our facilities and the return of bed bugs in growing numbers.

None of our mattresses are designed to discourage these pests. Neither are our mattress covers or pillow cases.

We've already seen that bed bug infestations could potentially drain huge amounts of our time and money, which are precious resources to our small nonprofit. The more money we spend fighting these pests, the less money we have to spend on programs for our residents and growing our mission with new facilities.

To provide a safe bed from top to bottom will cost approximately $500. If the frame is already good to go, we need approximately $250 for the mattress and linens. Just the linens for one bed is approximately $100.

Why help Midsouth Sober Living?

Safe, affordable and most importantly alcohol/drug-free housing is scarce for individuals who complete inpatient alcohol and drug treatment programs. The vast majority of sober living facilities in our area are run for profit; others such as Oxford Houses are self-supporting not-for-profits.

Our nonprofit agency is unique in our area because we are a community-driven entity, with an active board of directors dedicated to providing access to recovery specific housing to all, regardless of their ability to pay.

MSL currently operates three centers – two for women and one for men. These facilities, conveniently located near the MATA bus lines, offer 48 individuals a place to live while embarking on a new start in life. Each facility has an on-site manager to provide assistance and guidance. Basic rules are in place to provide a safe, sober environment and to encourage the freedom to work, cook meals, own a car and attend to other essential needs.

Surrounded by others with the same common goal, MSL residents experience independent living within the context of ongoing support. Our residents are drawn from all areas of the county and from diverse backgrounds. They are selected solely on the basis of their willingness to stay sober and follow house rules (paying rent, chores, attending 12 step meetings, getting along with others, etc.).

Want to know more? Visit our website, where you can see our facilities and hear more from some of our other friends and collaborators.

What if we don't reach our goal?

We think we will!

But every dollar donated will help us move toward our goal of ensuring that every one of our beds is fully protected.

Other ways you can help

Do you have a recovery story, or are you moved by the journey of a loved one?

Share our campaign on social media using the tools on this page. Or just send an email with a link to this page and ask your special folks to honor that recovery journey by making a contribution in the amount of your sobriety time. Encourage them to add a zero!

story:
LAST 24 HOURS!

GREAT NEWS FOR GARNET NEWS! 

Every contribution you make will be doubled!

Now is the time to support the news that matters most. Now is the time to support women journalists and photojournalists from around the world. Now is the time to contribute garnetnews.com.


We are not a magazine.

We are a daily news site looking to shift

the news-to-you paradigm. 

Daily news by women, for everyone.


“In the current media coverage, men are still doing most of the talking. I’d like to change that. I’d like to provide women the opportunity and the means to join in the discussion, to speak for themselves. Now, more than ever, women have political, social and economic clout. It’s time we use it.”  -Danielle Bizzarro, Co-Founder

Source: WMC 2014


At garnetnews.com, we won’t have a woman’s page — we'll have a virtual newsroom full of women and front-page reporting by women, every day of the week.

And you'll have access first-rate reporting and commentary by many of the amazing women journalists and photojournalists at work in the world today — all on a single site. 



Whether it’s the economy or healthcare, politics or the latest Supreme Court decision, climate change or recent advances in technology and science, we'll cover all the top stories of the day. 



And you'll enjoy a fresh take on breaking news and events that you won't find anywhere else, rather than more of the "same, old stories" featured on other news sites.



In addition to daily news coverage, we'll introduce you to some of the exceptional women who are hard at work in their fields, with original features like our "women in science"and our "women & the arts" series.

And highlight the many worthwhile stories about women or by women that are otherwise underreported or ignored by the mainstream media today.


"Women can no longer sit on the sidelines. We must act, in order to bring about positive change. We cannot rely on the standing institutions to do if for us. I hope you'll join us in creating a powerful news site where the many voices of women can be heard."  -Janet Harrison, Co-Founder


Your contributions in action.

  • OUR GOAL:  $50,000.  With these funds, we GO LIVE in 2015!  In addition to making our website a reality, almost half of your contributions will be used to hire women writers and photojournalists so that we can start bringing you original stories that you won't find anywhere else. 

    With your support, we can promote the unique work that we are doing and bring garnetnews.com to the next level!



We have some fabulous perks!

To show our appreciation, we have chosen some unique gifts for you.

At the $100 level or $150 level, for example, you'll receive this sterling silver "gn" bookmark or this sterling silver garnet pendant designed especially for us by jewelry designer Regan Richardson.

                                



At the $225 level you will receive "Share: The Cookbook That Celebrates Our Common Humanity."  All profits from our purchase of the book will go directly to Women For Women International and the women around the world whom they directly support.

                                                             


At $500 level, you will post your very own blog on garnetnews! In addition to your very own byline and bypic, you'll receive the "gn" sterling silver bookmark designed especially for us by Regan Richardson.

At $1,000 level, you will sponsor a woman artist of the week! You'll also receive a copy of "Share: The Cookbook."

And for your generous support at the $5,000 level, you'll choose a signed print by one of the five talented women photographers who have lent their support to our endeavor! All prints will be 11" x 14" when matted, although the actual size of each image varies. (See images below.)

For your dedicated support at the $10,000 level, we will launch an investigative series on a particular topic of your choice, such as education, poverty, women's health, or voting rights, and the series will bear your name. You will also be named as an Angel on our permanent Sponsors Page.


We love a good challenge

Starting any new business is always an adventure. In the start-up world of the internet, there are so many new ideas, and it is challenging to stand out in the crowd. But here, we think, we have a unique advantage.There is no other news site, anywhere, dedicated to bringing you news from a woman's angle, every day of the week. Not one.

Is there a need for such a site? Based upon two years of market research and on our actual experience online over the past year, we can definitively say, "Yes!"

Yes! Readers want more stories by women. Yes! Readers want more news about women. Yes! Readers frequent those sites that align with their personal interests and concerns more than any others. And yes! Readers want garnetnews!

We are passionate about what we are doing and see it not only as a successful business model but also as a powerful way to connect women with information, and with one another. Women are 51% of the population and represent 85% of consumer spending. It's time that we owned that reality in a tangible way.


Other ways you can help

We would love for you to contribute, but if that isn't possible now, please spread the word. We are relying on you to help us take our fundraising to the next level! 

Share our campaign on Facebook, or tweet if you Twitter. Use the hashtag, #garnetnewslive to spread the word about our campaign. Most of all, tell your family and friends. We intend to make a difference, but this is definitely going to take a village!


About the video

We owe our snazzy video appeal to the hard work of Paul Schlott, Vincent Oppecker, Michelle Bizzarro, Dustin Harrison-Atlas and David Berman, all of whom went above and beyond the call of duty. 


Many thanks to Robin Rice of the Robin Rice Gallery and the photographers for these prints.


"Diver III, Anguilla" | 2006 | Archival Digital Print | Robin Rice 


"Namaste" | 1996 | Archival Digital Print | Victoria Goldman 


"18" | 2002 | Archival Digital Print | Kim Reierson


"Parakeets" | 1994 | Archival Digital Print | Patricia McDonough


"View" | 1998 | Archival Digital Print | Tina West

story:
Hi I’m Nana Roberts and I’m here to tell you about my new children’s book.

My Extraterrestrial Friends and I Never Complain is the first book in a series about discovery and adventure with an earth child and children from the planet Cosmonoz.

In this story,  these children celebrate the differences in their worlds. It will in turn, teach your child about understanding and accepting the differences between people and cultures. It also brings out their creative side as the first edition is a storybook they can color. 

The centerfold will feature landscape showcasing the six moons of Cosmonoz. A vivid and fanciful planet in a full color spread. The balance of the book is detailed line drawings where children of all ages can color using their own imagination.


Now at the heart of any children’s book are the illustrations, and especially a coloring storybook such as this one. 

To have a published high level illustrator is invaluable to a project like mine, and that expense is where you come in. Original artwork is not cheap and there is also the cost of layout, design, ISBN numbers and copyright registration.  I have personally contributed over $2000 as this project has progressed. Now I need YOUR help.

I have been writing children’s books for many years and am excited that I have finally made the commitment to get them published and into the hands of children everywhere.  My Extraterrestrial Friends and I Never Complain is just the first in a series that I have outlined, along with a marketing campaign that will begin at the UFO festival in McMinnville Oregon in May 2015.

I appreciate your help so much. Please select a reward level and be a part of this success story. All levels of donations are greatly appreciated. Please donate now and choose your rewards at the right.

Thank you for believing in me, these books and the imaginations of all children.

story:
About Us

Hello, we’re Celia (writer) and Sage (publisher/Sweet Candy Press). We want to tell you about Celia’s zine anthology, Ofrenda. It is set to be released in October 2014 by Sweet Candy Press.

Celia C. Pérez was born in Judy Blume’s hometown to a father from Guantanamo, Cuba and a mother from San Juan del Rio, Durango, Mexico. She grew up in Miami, Florida. When she was fourteen, she was certain her future was in professional wrestling. Instead, she grew up to be a librarian and a writer. She still makes zines, is working on a middle grade novel and writes about Latinos in children’s and YA books at all-brown-all-around.blogspot.com. While she has listened to many versions of “La Bamba,” her favorite is still the one by Los Lobos. She lives in Chicago with a couple of tall dudes.

Sweet Candy Press is run by Sage Adderley in Olympia,Washington. Sage has been running Sweet Candy Distro for over ten years, and Ofrenda: A Zine Anthology will be Sweet Candy's fifth title. Sage is no stranger to the hard work and determination it takes to pull off this exciting venture.

Other Sweet Candy titles:

Heavy Hangs the Head by Taryn Hipp

Everybody Else's Girl by Sarah Sawyers-Lovett

Invoking Nonna by Sage Adderley

The Greatest Most Traveling Circus! by Jonas

Sweet Candy Press uses a local family-owned printing company that has been going strong for thirty-seven years.


From Celia:

I'm really drawn to the idea of unconventional memoirs and autobiographies. I'm also obsessed with documenting which is probably the reason I've continued making zines all these years. The Ofrenda anthology is twenty years of life as told through my zines. This is my own unconventional memoir. This is me from stubborn and naive young adult to stubborn and jaded middle aged adult. 

The best part about working on this project is that when I gathered up and looked at twenty years of writing, I felt that I could finally put into words the things and the qualities that deeply influence me. These are the things that are always there, if not on the surface then not too far below. This is what I look for in stories, in people, in the world, in life and what I hope to convey in my own writing: humor, wonder, simplicity, magic, history, a sense of connection however small.

I like to think of Ofrenda as a big colorful piñata. There's something in here from almost all of my zines. Break it open and discover all the little treasures that fall out, all these little pieces of a life. 

Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for supporting this project. I hope you enjoy it. Here's to another twenty years of glue sticks and being totally baffled by page layout.

Sneak Peek

Pieces from the following works will be included in the zine anthology:
I Dreamed I Was Assertive #1-#7 and #9-#15
picaflor #1 and #2
To Hell in a Handbasket
Hickey Underworld #2
Atlas of Childhood #1 and #2
Ofrenda (spring 2014)
Skate Tough You Little Girls
roots & wings
Library Ghosts
Haunted Finger
The Shortest Day 2011 and 2012
Miscellaneous History of Common Experiments
Sherman Sez
38 (birthday zine)
40 (birthday zine)
Also: submission to Syndicate Product #13 (the Television Issue)

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our fundraising goal is $2,000. This money will go towards printing a few hundred copies of the anthology and promotional materials for the project!
  • Celia has put together some AMAZING perks (mixed CDs, zines, books, custom drawings, and lots more!)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Share our campaign on your social media accounts. (THANKS!)

story:
Our Story

My name is Leslie and I have been writing for many years. It is my passion. I really feel that my novel can change people's lives, and to make sense of all the things I had to go through in my life. Now that I am in the editing process I really need help to get it up and running! I am from the town of St.John's, Newfoundland and we really need some more local publications and a new generation of writers.

The Impact

So many people spend thier lives trying to make sense of hardships, and Tanked outlines some of the hardest things one would have to go through from teenage years to adulthood. Tanked touches on drug addict parents, having to support onesself from a young age, having a drug problem of your own, abusive relationships, feeling like an outsider but ultimately overcoming circumstance to follow your dreams. So many people feel as if they are alone and it would be comforting in reading the novel and knowing you are not. Tanked is truly one of a kind and groundbreaking and would be a huge loss to the world to not come into print. This is what I meant to do and I really need some help!

What We Need & What You Get

I have no other sources of funding. I am on a low income and I don't have a way to print copies of the novel to send to publishers, I don't have money for postage, for binding, copying...even a cup of coffee to keep me editing would be a big help. If I can raise even one dollar towards the publishing process I will truly feel blessed. I would be more than willing to email various excerpts from the novel if you are still not convinved. I am in an unfortuante circumstance since I have no transportation of even internet to promote my novel and I have limited connections as a first time writer. Books are my best friend and I know you probably feel the same. It is time for me to share my story, this won't happen without the support of the community both locally and abroad. Anything is appreciated so, so much!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends know about my campaign! Share this to Facebook, send out an email list, anything. I will do interviews. If you know anyone in publishing or any writers I would love to get in touch with them. Please keep this going! I love you all :) And thanks for the support!

So many people feel as if they are alone and it would be comforting in reading the novel and knowing you are not. Tanked is truly one of a kind and groundbreaking and would be a huge loss to the world to not come into print. This is what I meant to do and I really need some help!


What We Need & What You Get
I have no other sources of funding. I am on a low income and I don't have a way to print copies of the novel to send to publishers, I don't have money for postage, for binding, copying...even a cup of coffee to keep me editing would be a big help. If I can raise even one dollar towards the publishing process I will truly feel blessed. I would be more than willing to email various excerpts from the novel if you are still not convinved. I am in an unfortuante circumstance since I have no transportation of even internet to promote my novel and I have limited connections as a first time writer. Books are my best friend and I know you probably feel the same. It is time for me to share my story, this won't happen without the support of the community both locally and abroad. Anything is appreciated so, so much!


Other Ways You Can Help
Please let your friends know about my campaign! Share this to Facebook, send out an email list, anything. I will do interviews. If you know anyone in publishing or any writers I would love to get in touch with them. Please keep this going! I love you all :) And thanks for the support!

story:
A Gay Pirate Romance Novel!

Some call him the Flaming Death. Others call him the Gut Stuffer. Still others, the Most Fearsome Fruit in All of France. But one thing is for sure, if you don't watch your back, François le Foutre will come all over it!  

After consistent victory at the Combat Tournament of Sherwood, François has decided to parlay his success into the world of publishing, with the world's first ever (so far as we know it) "medieval gay pirate romance adventure novel."

It's Pirates of the Caribbean, set in the Middle Ages! But, you know, gay!

Video Sample

Here's a video of François reading a sample of There's Seamen on the Poop-Deck! Enjoy!



What People Are Saying

"I have not enjoyed a piece of writing so much in years!"

"I was laughing so hard, that the U.S. Marshalls that walk by my office (in the federal court) kept asking 'What's so funny?' " 

"Your work is clever, hilarious, and dare I say, sexy as hell."

"The right audience will absolutely love it. The writing is tremendously clever."

"I always enjoy subtle appeals to one’s intellect and broad education. Which led me to initially think that your story was going to be a Gilbert and Sullivan musical, except there they only polished up the handle on the big front door."

François' Booty!

You know you want a piece of François' booty! Well here's what you can get:

  • A kiss from François
  • Digital download
  • Physical book
  • Signed 8x10 photo
  • T-shirt (will say "The Flaming Death", not "The Gut Stuffer")

  • Mug: "I Taste François from the tip of my tongue ..." (and then, when you drink from it) "... to the back of my throat." 

  • Tickets to Sherwood Forest Faire
  • Selection as a distinguished marshal
  • A private boudoir photo shoot at Whimsy's Muse
  • Get your name and likeness in the book!
  • Take hold of my big, hard sword on the last day of the festival!

Budget

Here's what the money is going toward:

  • $300 - cover design  
  • $250 - interior layout design
  • $100 - copyediting
  • $100 - proofreading
  • $400 - printing  

The rest of the money goes to cover fulfillment of the other prizes.

Sample Chapter

The Raging Queen had two openings—one in the front, at the mouth of the ship, and a smaller opening at the rear. The rear entrance had always been my favorite. The passage was long and narrow, with a smooth finish. I am not the largest of men, but even so it was always a tight fit, which made it quite the experience. It was as if, as I entered her, she was squeezing me tight, willing me never to let me go.

I ran my hands along her through the length of her corridor, fingering her delicately in a loving embrace. My Raging Queen moved up and down underneath me in undulating waves, almost shuddering under my touch. She creaked and moaned, screamed and gyrated, and though she was for now under the control of my seamen, it was I, only I, whose every order she followed. She submitted to me first, always to me, and I liked it that way.

Yes, it is safe to say that every time I entered the Raging Queen, I fell in love with her all over again.

I took a few steps and then paused a moment. Never wanted to go in too far at once. Better to do it slowly, a lit bit at a time. Build up the anticipation, tease her, almost. She moaned louder. Bucked harder. Screamed with more fury. I had her right where I wanted her.

I began to hear the mutterings of the men above me. That might distract a lesser man, but to me it only made me want to go slower. I never shied away from being caught with my Raging Queen.

Finally, with deeper penetration on every step, I reached the poop cabin.

Most men are proud of their poops. How large they are, how beautiful they are upon close examination. Why, every Rear Admiral I meet within minutes would ask me if I wanted to see his poop. Of course I would accept—you never decline a man’s invitation to show you his poop—and whether it was a clean poop or a messy poop, we’d spend the next several hours examining every inch of it, even playing games in it from time to time. Poker was a popular one. I’ve lost count of the number of times I’ve pokered in a man’s poop.

But while every man is proud of his poop, I happened to think mine was especially delightful. It was larger than most, and I boasted that over one hundred different kinds of woods had been inside it—dark woods and light woods, hard woods and soft woods, rough woods and smooth woods, tight woods and loose woods. There were traces of each all throughout my poop, most of which had been acquired during my various world travels: an Akan Fertility Doll, dark brown with a large round head, given to me by a long, thin Indian; a trunk of African ebony; dozens of light, softwood rodents which still tickle my fancy; and a massive horse-hair rope that hung from the ceiling and seemed to impress all with its girth. I’d grown to love the darker, harder, rougher woods the best, so those were the ones I invited into my poop the most, but really I’d put anything strong or unique in there if it would fit.

My poop, of course, was where I took my meals, so all my food would end up there eventually. I brought all different kinds of nuts, and meats, and the odd vegetable when I was in the right mood. And all of these would combine to give it a wonderful, oaky aroma, which filled my nostrils in a musky bouquet.

Yes, I loved my poop, and I spent as much time in there as possible.

The shelf just inside my poop contains books, so coming in this evening I selected one at random and took it to my seat—a narrow object of porcelain, which the Chinese say is a seat for the gods. I sat proudly and opened the tome, resting it on my widened my knees, to carry its massive weight. Presently, there was a knock at the door.

He was early.

story:
Welcome to Prepper Central Mag, a division of PrepperCentral.com.  Our top rated website offers preparedness tips, along with relevant news, that help you stay in the know for your life.  As a complement to our website, we are launching an opportunity to get a more in-depth look at the preparedness lifestyle.  Preparedness knows no boundaries-from North America and Europe, to Australia and beyond, we share a common goal to be ready when challenges present themselves.  So many sources out there call themselves preparedness sites, but their information lacks credibility, and at times, can border on the comical.  With several well known and respected names in the prepper community, such as Survivor Jane, Tara Dodrill, and Ron Foster joining us as staff writers, we feel we can give both the beginning and experienced prepper deeper knowledge of how to make both the time and money they invest well spent.  

This campaign is important to us because we want to break many of the stereo types that come along with 'prepping' or 'preparedness.'  We want to show everyone from the average family to the experienced survivalist that there are practical every day things you can do to be prepared in any given situation.  This magazine will help us share that information in a more detailed manner than our website can do.  Our goal is to make sure that average people can take care of themselves and their families, in natural disasters or man made catastrophies.

Our goal is raise a minimum of $5,000.  In order to make this magazine a reality, we need to purchase the software to deliver a digital magazine to your inbox on a monthly basis.  This will not be an email, but an actual electronic magazine, where you can turn the pages as you would any physical magazine.  Prepper Central Mag will contain high quality designs and graphics.  As an added bonus, you will be able to download and print any issue at your convenience to use as a reference tool.  We require a secure server to maintain the website and subscription database.  We also have to compensate the writers for their professional services.  Prepper Central Mag will be purchasing and providing unique giveaways on a monthly basis that are only available to our subscribers. Finally, we are looking to go beyond the average magazine and offer unique experiences to our readers such as on location reviews of preparedness training facilities and courses, video reports from trade shows, and in-depth reviews of services you would not have otherwise heard of.

If we do not reach our goal, we plan to still move forward in a limited aspect. Possibilities could include fewer contributors, fewer issues, etc.  We will need to assess at that time what we will be able to provide.

This project is important because we see time and again situations where, if people had been better prepared, it would have mitigated the impact of the devastation.  From having enough food and water, making sure medical needs are met, or knowing what to do or where to go in case of an emergency, we hope that we can positively make an impact, or even save, people's lives.  Spreading the word about, and supporting this magazine means you know that you and your loved ones will be ready to face life's challenges.

Your $15 contribution will get you 12 issues (one per month), and automatic entry for special prizes and drawings each month.  Additionally, you will get special discounts and coupon codes from various businesses.  After the crowd funding ends, prices will go up.  $15 is a mere $1.25 a month for up to the date information on what will help you make the most of being prepared.  Whether you contribute $1 to help (and yes, every single $1 donation helps), $15 for a subscription, or a higher donation to subscribe, get one of our perks, and show your support, your money will be going to a great cause.  Don't forget, you can also give a subscription as a gift to a friend or family member for the holidays. And if you can't afford to donate, please help us spread the word about this cause.  We know your support is important to the success of this campaign, and we appreciate all of you helping us move forward. 

*International orders are subject to your country's customs regulations, and we cannot guarantee delivery of all special perk items.

story:
My name is Trenace' Carter. I am an author, speaker, mother, daughter, sister, aunt and friend.  It is because I wear all of these hats that this campaign is important.  I released my first book, Wanted Womanhood, August 1,2013.  I am currently in the process of writing 2 book. Diamond Commitment is a book for woman and #QUEENRULES Extraordinary Girls to Extraordinary Women is my first book for girls.
The funding is going towards a fund raiser to pay for editing,cover design,photography and publishing of both books.
The Purple Soiree' Book Signing event will be held in my hometown, Chicago in the month of March.
There are some AWESOME perks;
$3.00 personally autographed postcard and pdf version of Wanted Womanhood
$15.00 personally autographed copy of Wanted Woman on top of the former awards
$25 .00 A call from the Author, 1 Authentic Woman branded wristband on top of the former awards
$100.00 video chat with the Author, three autographed copies of Wanted Womanhood on top of the former awards
$250.00 mention in both new books as a supporter, 1 Authentic Woman t-shirt on top of the former awards
$500.00 Exclusive autograph of at least 5 women that were interviewed, A picture of the author along with the participants at the event, an invitation to the Purple Soiree on top of the former
 In the event that I don't reach my goal fund will go cover design and editing. Those are the most expensive part of the publishing process.

The project is valuable for both the you and the world because both books will be influential to bring women back to living a life of happiness, commitment and the love that they deserve. For girls this is a chance to protect and prevent them from straying too far away from the women that they are divinely created to be.
I have been working with the Communities in School program in Charleston, SC and the girls that I interact with are so hungry for what it takes to be a successful, happy,  real and productive woman. They are watching what is going on in the world and they want more HOPE then the life they are seeing in their environments.

If you can't contribute, share with your friend, family and your enemies. Let's show our girls we love and support them. Let's show women that we can love, support, dream, thrive and be successful women without breaking eachother down.

story:
Short Summary

  So, as some of you may know, my name is Lucinda Grange, I'm a young photographer based in the North of England. Having been going on adventures and taking photos throughout for the past six years, I've decided I aught to put it down on paper, in my first book, to share with you! From walking the dirtiest sewers under London, to sporting clothes last seen in Paris Fashion Week on top of the Pyramids of Giza, the last six years has been incredible, and I'd like to share much of what I've seen and felt with you!

What We Need & What You Get

  I'm making a limited run on 50, numbered and signed large books, 28 pages, of glossy images and a few stories in there too, sadly with limited numbers with printing comes a greater cost, and so the unit price of the books is to be £50 (50x50 making the total I'm wanting to raise: £2500). But this will also include shipping! All donations will be appreciated, big or small, the name of any person donating will go in the book.
  If you're feeling generous and are able to donate £100 or more, you will also receive a limited edition print! Also numbered and signed one of 25.

The Impact

  This project will have a big impact on me, it will cause me to focus on my writing, getting things on paper before my next book, a written book of adventures, as well as sharing my work being where I find the most enjoyment. I'd like to think the images and stories will have a positive effect on any reader too!

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't afford the book, or even a small donation, please feel free to help motivate me, look at my work here and post on my adventure blog if you have the time:

www.theeyeofsilence.com

story:
Last August I participated in the Postcard Poetry Fest organized by Paul Nelson and Brendan McBreen. The idea of the festival is to challenge poets around the globe to handwrite and mail a postcard-sized poem a day throughout the month of August. Last year, I composed and mailed nearly 70 little 6-line centos to fellow writers. I composed my poems completely from found text in front of me each morning: My dissertation reading on digital and new media, my friends’ Facebook status updates, my horoscope, the novels at the top of my reading list, as well as songs I was listening to on Spotify. It was a blast. I loved how the physical constraints of handwriting affected the length and placement of the lines, which in turn pushed me toward open field composition strategies as well as visual and concrete forms. I’m now putting the finishing touches on a full-length book collection of these poems, which I hope to find a publisher for sometime this fall.

This past year, since the postcard fest ended, has been a tough one for me. I’ve had to deal with the stress of underemployment, the loss of stable housing, and the death of my mother. I want to tap into the emotional energy of those trials, so this year I plan to add another layer to the process by incorporating personal and somewhat sentimental writing to the mix of materials. To do this, I am spending July working on 2 separate notebooks that I’m calling my daybook and my nightbook. In the daybook, I am doing my best to meditate on the past, reflecting on specific, little memories. My nightbook, on the other hand, will focus on the future as each evening/night, I will consult the tarot, using the daily reading to meditate on the future. These notebooks will then become a part of the collage material for the postcards. As I did last year, I will again be using custom ordered postcards, this time in 6” squares instead of the 5” squares that caused postal issues last August. These square cards will incorporate my own visual art pieces (you can see samples of my work at http://instragram.com/busylittle1way) that will serve as thematic prompts for the poems and their titles.

At this point, I’d like to invite each of you into the process as contributors, but also as recipients. Each person who donates will receive a handwritten postcard poem. Those who donate at least $20 will receive a postcard poem each week during the fest. Since $50 donations will help me to offset the cost of printing new postcards specifically for the fest, contributors at this level, will not only receive weekly postcard poems, but also a set of postcards for their own use. Donors at the $100 level will also receive a set of 8”x8” prints of the images used for the postcards. Because $150 donations will practically cover the entirety of the basic costs of postcards and postage, for donors at this level, I plan to hand-make a very limited edition chapbook of poems from this year’s fest, and donors of $200 or more will receive that plus my eternal gratitude along with free signed copies of any books I publish over the next decade.

Thanks to each of you who donated last year, and to those who will participate in this year’s project.
story_txt: Last August I participated in the Postcard Poetry Fest organized by Paul Nelson and Brendan McBreen. The idea of the festival is to challenge poets around the globe to handwrite and mail a postcard-sized poem a day throughout the month of August. Last year, I composed and mailed nearly 70 little 6-line centos to fellow writers. I composed my poems completely from found text in front of me each morning: My dissertation reading on digital and new media, my friends’ Facebook status updates, my horoscope, the novels at the top of my reading list, as well as songs I was listening to on Spotify. It was a blast. I loved how the physical constraints of handwriting affected the length and placement of the lines, which in turn pushed me toward open field composition strategies as well as visual and concrete forms. I’m now putting the finishing touches on a full-length book collection of these poems, which I hope to find a publisher for sometime this fall.This past year, since the postcard fest ended, has been a tough one for me. I’ve had to deal with the stress of underemployment, the loss of stable housing, and the death of my mother. I want to tap into the emotional energy of those trials, so this year I plan to add another layer to the process by incorporating personal and somewhat sentimental writing to the mix of materials. To do this, I am spending July working on 2 separate notebooks that I’m calling my daybook and my nightbook. In the daybook, I am doing my best to meditate on the past, reflecting on specific, little memories. My nightbook, on the other hand, will focus on the future as each evening/night, I will consult the tarot, using the daily reading to meditate on the future. These notebooks will then become a part of the collage material for the postcards. As I did last year, I will again be using custom ordered postcards, this time in 6” squares instead of the 5” squares that caused postal issues last August. These square cards will incorporate my own visual art pieces (you can see samples of my work at http://instragram.com/busylittle1way) that will serve as thematic prompts for the poems and their titles.At this point, I’d like to invite each of you into the process as contributors, but also as recipients. Each person who donates will receive a handwritten postcard poem. Those who donate at least $20 will receive a postcard poem each week during the fest. Since $50 donations will help me to offset the cost of printing new postcards specifically for the fest, contributors at this level, will not only receive weekly postcard poems, but also a set of postcards for their own use. Donors at the $100 level will also receive a set of 8”x8” prints of the images used for the postcards. Because $150 donations will practically cover the entirety of the basic costs of postcards and postage, for donors at this level, I plan to hand-make a very limited edition chapbook of poems from this year’s fest, and donors of $200 or more will receive that plus my eternal gratitude along with free signed copies of any books I publish over the next decade.Thanks to each of you who donated last year, and to those who will participate in this year’s project.

story:
HI, WE'RE SMOKING GLUE GUN.

We're an independent small press and online magazine based in Austin, Tx. We publish innovative, experimental art & writing four times a year online and as print chapbooks. In the last three years we’ve published over 150 writers and artists on smokinggluegun.com, as well as two chapbooks: Pattern Exhaustion (Nate Pritts) and Sunburn / Freezer Burn (Colleen Barry).

This year we bring you two more print titles: 

DANDELION FARM and THROWN: 
FULL-COLOR COLLECTIONS OF ART & POETRY

Both chapbooks are collaborative art books: Dandelion Farm is a playlet by Darcie Dennigan interspersed with drawings & collage by Carl Dimitri. thrown is a collection of poems by j/j hastain set to collages by Marthe Reed. Both will be printed in full-color, and we're excited as ever to show them off. 

Dandelion Farm, Darcie Dennigan & Carl Dimitri

"Dandelion Farm unfolds at once in the darkened jewel-box theater of the skull and on an expanse of lawn as full of green promise as the vowels in the name Mahalia. This series of cycling sketches recalls at once a score, a play, a novelette, a collage, a net for remembering, a spell for calling back. Like a dandelion or a player piano, it plays its delicate song on the points of its golden teeth."  

-Joyelle McSweeney

thrown, j/j hastain & Marthe Reed

"j/j hastain and Marthe Reed depict a visual and auditory change in personal reality and definition. Their stunning reflection upon gender shifts, through combined visual and auditory art, offers a geometric and social music that spares neither cacophony nor pain." -Sheila E. Murphy

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THINGS HAPPEN.

Smoking Glue Gun is run by two young poets dedicated to putting new voices (and art!) into the world. We believe in putting exciting collections like these into print, and into people's hands. 

We're an independent organization, so we're independently funded. Most of the costs of running Smoking Glue Gun come out-of-pocket or are generated by chapbook sales, but our largest expense by far is the cost of printing & distributing our chapbooks.

We need to raise $2,000 to publish Dandelion Farm and thrown. When you support this campaign, your dollars will go directly to pay for the costs of printing, publishing, and distribution. 

CHAPBOOKS FOR EVERYBODY!

Yep, every donor will receive a chapbook (or more) in exchange for their support. You can also snag a copy of last year's chapbooks, Pattern Exhaustion (Pritts) and Sunburn / Freezer Burn (Barry), or a broadside from Dandelion Farm orThrown. A few will be lucky enough to receive a phone call from j/j hastain with a personal poetry & song performance.



[broadside from Dandelion Farm]

[broadside from thrown]

WHY DONATE NOW?

Your contribution not only ensures the printing of our 2015 catalogue, it also supports the work of Darcie Dennigan, Carl Dimitri, j/j hastain & Marthe Reed. You'll be aiding Smoking Glue Gun’s effort to showcase poetry & art and supporting small press publishing. Also, the chapbooks are printed on a limited run, so hurry up!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP :)

Some of you won't be able to donate, and we understand that. But we'd love if you would share this campaign with friends--on social media, via email, or simply by word of mouth. Every share helps us reach more readers and supporters, and that's worth a lot.

We hope you'll take a moment to support this campaign and get some chapbooks & other neat stuff in the process. We can't wait to share Dandelion Farm and thrown with you, in print!

Sincerely,

Blake Lee Pate & Taylor Jacob Pate

Editors, Smoking Glue Gun

story:
I plan on self-publishing some of my books and professionally publishing some others, but the costs can add up—especially because I want to do it well. I need to invest in professional editing, custom cover design, interior layout, printing books, distribution, marketing, and the myriad of other details involved in producing and publishing my books. All funds raised here will be used for these reasons.

I'm an author entrepreneur in San Francisco Bay area, California. I can say humbly and without ego that I'm not your average writer. In 1997 I started my writing at the age of 27 but it only lasted a mere 6 months because of, well...life.Then in 2011 I started up again and it's going pretty well. I have 22 books in various stages of writing and 3 of those are rather close to publication. Tea in the Tree is the first book I will publish.

This is a 'feel good read' that brings you back in time, it brings back those memories of yesteryear, those thoughts you have long forgotten, the smells that seemed to have faded away never to return, those innocent feelings you thought were gone forever. This is 'Tea in the Tree'.

Remember what it was like to curl up with your favorite book as a child, completely absorbed in the world of the story? I write stories for children, among other genres, to teach them lessons that I have learned. To provide them with sources of delight and inspiration - and perhaps to reawaken those feelings in myself  too. Four of my books are for younger readers, so I include a lot of artwork that attempts to complement my writing. But there are some other books I am writing like Mirlaak and Girls with Shinny Shoes that have no pictures at all and are geared more towards young adults, veracious readers, and readers of everything possible. All of these books include a positive message, ranging from simple standards, like “share with others,” to more complex life lessons on topics like handling the death of a loved one or how to think about big issues like caring for the environment or respecting other cultures. ​I try to write something silly, strange, nerdy, dreamy, and fantastical. The things that inspired me as a child. But these are not some wacky for no good reason plots or twists. There’re just feelings that are sincere and actions that make sense for my characters. 
Writing has become my life but my funds are tight and I need help to cover some of these costs so I can follow my creativity and get these books out to the public.

story:
Spende, wenn es nicht zum Kotzen reicht

Die kranken Perversen aus Clausnitz sollten nicht das Deutschland-Bild der Flüchtlinge prägen. Überhaupt gehört Clausnitz in kein Deutschland-Bild. Wir wollen den Flüchtlingen vor Ort einen zweiten, würdigeren Empfang geben und sie im nächstgelegenen 5 Sterne Hotel ankommen lassen.

Hintergrund

Im April 2015 übten Unbekannte einen Brandanschlag auf ein in Bau befindliches Flüchtlingsheim in Tröglitz aus. Wir von Schlecky Silberstein sammelten daraufhin im Rahmen der Aktion Luxus statt Tröglitz 1700 EUR für die ersten Flüchtlinge, die in Tröglitz untergebracht werden sollten, damit diese erstmal in der entspannten Atmosphäre eines 5-Sterne-Hotels ankommen können.

Ein halbes Jahr später war klar, dass es aus Angst vor weiteren Anschlägen nie ein Flüchtlingsheim in Tröglitz geben wird – der Anschlag aus dem April war somit ein Erfolg auf ganzer Linie. 

Angesichts der jüngsten Ereignisse in Clausnitz haben wir uns entschlossen, die Aktion Luxus statt Tröglitz in die Aktion Luxus statt Clausnitz zu überführen. Hier besteht ein ein konkretes Trauma und wir wollen die 20 Männer, Frauen und Kinder die in Clausnitz von geisteskranken Vollidioten niedergebrüllt wurden, gerne im nächsten First Class Hotel unterbringen. Und das aus zweierlei Gründen:

  1. Diese Menschen haben eine Kompensation verdient. 
  2. Mit einer Spende kann jeder zeigen, dass 100 Wahnsinnige nicht Deutschland sind. 

Ablauf

Momentan sind wir noch auf der Suche nach einer Organisation in Sachsen, die sich in unserem Auftrag um Logistik und Dolmetscher kümmert. Ebenso freuen wir uns über Angebote von Hotels aus der Umgebung, haben aber nach ersten Telefonaten verstanden, dass wir eher nicht von Offerten überrollt werden. Drauf geschissen: Wir kommen als zahlende Gäste und lassen ordentlich Trinkgeld da.

Disclaimer

Wir wissen, dass vor allem Hass-Touristen aus dem sächsischen Umfeld für die schlimmen Bilder gesorgt haben. Falls sich friedliche Clausnitzer in Sippenhaft genommen fühlen, bedauern wir das im Voraus.

story:
In this war between two wolves, which Wolf will win?

I started writing Wolf’s WAR during my first semester of college when I was having a hard time deciding who I was, and who I wanted to be.  I’ve always had an active imagination, but I had never thought of writing a story down until this one came back to me, and became so much more.  I knew then I had to share it.  Anyone who has been through a struggle in his or her life will identify with the main character in this book.  My dream is that readers will find meaning in my novel the way I have.   

The Novel:  A woman named Wolf has unique abilities as the result of experimentation by a scientist. She escapes his facility, and ventures out into the world.  The story is of her struggles to find who she really is

Kayla King: I’m a 20-year-old college student in my 3rd year.  I’m pursuing a degree in Psychology at Old Dominion University.  I’ve been playing both upright and electric bass for about 8 years.  I’m the daughter of banjo player Jody King, so I’ve been around Bluegrass music my entire life.  I’m working with my father on a soundtrack of music inspired by my novel.  It will be released with the book, or soon after. 


What your donation pays for:

  • Text formatting
  • Cover design
  • ISBN numbers
  • ebook formatting
  • Printing of 100 copies of the book


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can still help by spreading the word through social media.  


All perks will be sent after the products are released (flexible release date).

story:
Humo blanco

  • Soy escritor. Soy católico. Soy moderno. Cuando escribí este libro, pensé que mi destino era llegar a ser una especie de G.K. Chesterton en lengua española. A la fecha, creo que, en lo que más he logrado parecerme a Chesterton, es en que puedo responder como él, cuando le hicieron la pregunta: "¿Qué está mal en el mundo?". Mi respuesta también podría ser: "Yo." Con las cosas que he vivido, podría ser más parecido a Graham Greene, pero quizá mi tradición religiosa, más parecida a la de Ramón López Velarde, me lo impide. 
  • Humo blanco es el primer libro después de que ocurrió el gran cataclismo que cambió mi vida para siempre: mi conversión a la fe católica. La primera edición vendió como 4000 ejemplares. Lo escribí con libertad recién descubierta, aventurándome en el mundo de la fe y de la religión y de la antigua cultura de Occidente. Cuando lo escribí, soñaba con que fuera un libro que ayudara, a quienes lo leyeran, a sentir aquello que yo estaba sintiendo, a conocer a quien yo estaba empezando a conocer.
  • No soy yo quien pueda decir que este es un libro que puede cambiar algunas vidas para bien, cambiarlas como cambiaron mi vida Thoreau o C.S. Lewis. Pero me atrevo a hacer este intento por algunos comentarios que he recibido, de un hombre que cuidaba una bodega, de otro que abordó el taxi que en algún momento de su vida manejó mi papá. Creo que este libro ha suscitado pensamientos y sentimientos felices en desconocidos que lo leyeron. Soy lo suficientemente cristiano como para seguir creyendo que una sonrisa y un suspiro ya cambiaron el mundo para mejor.

Necesito fondos para publicar Humo blanco

  • No voy por mucho. Estoy buscando el dinero suficiente para pagar la publicación y distribución del libro. No he encontrado editor que quiera correr el riesgo. No quiero engañar a nadie. Si consigo lo suficiente, el editor me pagará regalías a mí, como $5000 en un año. Escribir libros no es negocio.
  • Los fondos que se recauden se dedicarán a pagar la formación e impresión del libro. Si después queda algo, se dedicarán a financiar la publicación de los libros que tengo formados en la cola.

El impacto de Humo blanco

  • En un mundo podrido de tristeza, creo que es importante decir que yo he podido encontrar alegría. El libro dice dónde empecé a encontrarla, aunque todavía no acabo.

Otras maneras de ayudar

Si no les es posible contribuir por ahora, podrían ayudarme comprando el libro, si alguna vez se lo encuentran en una librería. Si no lo compran, me ayudarían todavía más pidiéndolo prestado en el lugar donde se lo lleguen a encontrar. Incluso mejor sería si no lo devolvieran.

story:
The What


This is the campaign for my new erotic adventure novel Call of the Crimson Empire.  Doing something different this time and going for a pulp space opera mixed with swashbuckling - a kind of The Clone in the Iron Mask

In a distant future, across the starry reaches of space, the far-flung Zor Empire lies in chaos. The Empress is dead, murdered by rival claimants to the throne, and opportunists, traitors, and schemers vie for control of the succession.

All Kasar Kell Calyx wanted was to escape her dull life on a backwater moon, but when she travels to Zor Prime to join the Imperial Guard, she discovers they are outlawed, hunted by the dead empress’s enemies. She quickly finds herself arrested—her mouth once again getting her into trouble—but imprisonment yields vital and potentially deadly information: a true heir to the throne is hidden on a far-off, desolate planet.

Suddenly embroiled in murder and intrigue, Kasar must decide who to trust as multiple factions seek what she knows. She joins forces with three renegade Guardsmen intent on finding the true Empress and restoring her to the throne: Shirda, a former assassin hiding her past behind the Guard’s red cloak; Rel, a disgraced nobleman with Psionic powers; and Tor, a giant from a distant planet who has vowed to serve the crown.

Together, they must race find the hidden heir before a pretender can seize the throne and forever take control of the Crimson Empire!

So why should you contribute today? What makes The Call of the Crimson Empire amazing?

  • Genre-crossing adventure! The Call of the Crimson Empire combines the swashbuckling politics of The Three Musketeers with the lavish space opera of Jupiter Ascending.

  • Action galore! Swordfights, gunfights, psionic duels, spaceship battles--The Call of the Crimson Empire has it all. If you like your books quick-paced and action-packed, this is the story for you.

  • Ass-kicking female leads! Adventurotica strives to let the ladies shine, and this book is no different, with a diverse set of female leads in addition to the traditional butt-kicking dudes.

  • Great perks! Perks for this campaign include ebooks, print books, and unique, handmade jewelry, cameos or bonus scenes, even your own complete short story adventure starring yourself, the Crimson Empire character of your choice, or your own original character.

  • And, of course, the best erotica in the business! Just the right amount of steamy, hot, nothing-hidden sex that you know to expect from an Adventurotica novel.

I’m really excited about this book, which I know will appeal to both sci-fi fans and readers who haven’t taken the sci-fi plunge before. Please donate today, so that I can continue to write the kind of character-driven, genre-based erotica that you can’t find anywhere else.

What I Need & What You Get

  • Funds go to pay my rent, bills, etc.  This is it, this is my livelihood.  I don't have a day job, so this is what I do.
  • All perks are fulfilled by me, by hand.  You will get to see the book written almost in real time, as it posts on www.adventurotica.com chapter by chapter.  Once it is done, the ebook will follow almost immediately, and then the print book.
  • Even if I don't reach goal, everyone gets what they paid for, no matter what.

The Impact

Here's where I'm supposed to talk about how this project is important to the world.  Which probably seems silly, only I think this project - and others like it - are very important.  This is the cutting edge of the publishing business, and here I am trying to prove by example that a writer can make a living at what they want to do.  And I don't mean be one of the one-in-a-million longshots we all read about.  I mean being able to be good at what I do and with that carve out a career that can support my life.

  • Here I am dismantling the gatekeepers and the idea of the arts as a lottery.
  • I have run 12 campaigns to success before this one.
  • You help keep me alive, and I entertain you.  That's what I do here.

Risks & Challenges

I am worried about being able to do this on my own.  I have done so many of these as a team, and now I have to take it all on myself.  This campaign is even more nerve-wracking for me because I am striking out on my own this month, and I need this to work.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help spread the word, that is always fantastic!  Tweets, posts, reblogs, Facebooking - all of it helps!

story:
Összefoglaló

Három évvel ezelőtt két lelkes Moly-lány úgy döntött, hogy álmodik egy nagyot, és összeállít egy antológiát a Moly.hu könyves közösség tagjainak írásaiból. Az álom valóra vált, az antológiának már készül a harmadik kötete.

A kötet publikálási lehetőséget biztosít induló és a Moly olvasóközönsége által már ismert alkotók számára egyaránt.

A Moly.hu közösségének ismét a kezébe adhatunk egy magas színvonalat képviselő, sokszínű kötetet, amely folytatja, ugyanakkor meg is újítja az első kötet által megkezdett hagyományt.

Amire szükségünk van, és amit te kapsz

A befolyt pénzösszeg a kötet nyomdai és egyéb költségeit (grafikus, tördelő honoráriuma, tiszteletpéldányok) fedezi.

A támogatók a hozzájárulás mértékétől függően megkapják a kötet egy példányát, illetve kisebb mértékű hozzájárulás esetén egy egyedi tervezésű könyvjelzőt.

A kötetről

  • Terjedelme kb. 200 oldal;
  • próza és líra vegyesen;
  • gyönyörű illusztrációkkal.

Hogyan segíthetsz

Ha személyesen nem is tudsz hozzájárulni a költségek fedezéséhez, kérünk, add tovább a hírt ismerőseidnek!

Bátran használd a megosztási lehetőségeket!

story:
Be part of Lesotho's literary revolution

Ba re e ne re was founded in 2011 when local visionary Liepollo Rantekoa hosted the first Ba re e ne re Literature Festival. Liepollo passed away tragically in 2012, though since then, we, her friends with the support of her family, have rallied together to strive for her vision of a more literate and creative Lesotho.

To expand the opportunities writers in Lesotho have to share their stories, this year we set out to design and publish a book of all new writing, which we plan to launch on the opening night of our literature festival in December. This essential book, which we’re calling “Likheleke tsa puo”, meaning “wordsmiths” in Sesotho, contains 23 original stories that have never been published before. They are written in both English and Lesotho’s original brand of Sesotho, because it’s incredibly important for us to promote indigenous language and allow writers to express themselves how they are most comfortable.

Though some of the earliest southern African literature came from Lesotho, such as Thomas Mofolo’s Chaka, there’s not a lot of publishing of non-academic fiction happening in Lesotho these days. And that’s exactly what makes this short story collection so special. Having hosted our literature festival in Lesotho for the last few years, we can tell you that Basotho writers are hungry for opportunities to get their stories out there and revive our nation’s literary tradition. We can’t wait to share their voices with you.

When people think of Lesotho, they might imagine mountains, horses, woven hats and sadly, HIV, but we’re determined to break the stereotypes of Lesotho by presenting new diverse narratives created by talented Basotho writers telling their own stories. These stories in particular, tackle the nuance of relationships, dreams, religion, sex, and culture in exciting new ways.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help in bringing this book to life. When this project is funded, not only will contributors to this campaign be able to earn a copy of the book, you will also have been an important part of igniting Lesotho’s literary revolution. At the different reward levels you can earn a signed copy of the book, get your name printed in the book, and be an official sponsor of Ba re e re's book launch event!

Our goal is to raise $900 to cover the book's design, editing, printing and registration. We're doing as much of the work as possible in house to keep costs low. Here's the breakdown of what we're asking for:

  • $520 will go to the book printing
  • $100 will go to book editing
  • $100 will go to the book's design
  • $100 will go to the book's registration
  • $80 will cover transaction fees

Impacting Lesotho's literary future

All sales of the book will go into a BA RE E NE RE BOOK FUND to support the production of future books published by Ba re e ne re so that we can continue to provide a platform to Lesotho’s talented writers. So your contribution will continue to multiply!

 The more books we produce, the more Basotho youth can be inspired by local voices, further developing the cultures of reading and writing in Lesotho, and restoring Lesotho’s incredible literary tradition.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can share our campaign with anyone who you think would be interested
  • Connect with us via email to share ideas for future projects: barelitfest@gmail.com
