story:
My Story

Hey there! I'm Gwendolyn Valerius and I'm an author and editor. I'm also a southern girl with a penchant for accents, Korean dramas, and steaming bowls of Ramen. With two novels already under my belt, I was well into the third when a different kind of third materialized: a baby!

Suddenly, I went from an established routine that included hours to develop ideas and write (aka stare at a blank word document) to barely having time to open the computer. 

Then one night, my then 3 year old asked me to tell her a story. After spinning a tale that left her giggling instead of snoozing, I realized I didn't have to stop creating! I just needed a shift in focus. One that would allow me to do what I loved, while also giving me space to see and be grateful for the good changes kiddos bring. Instead of writing long (but juicy) novels, I decided to try crafting short, fun stories about the wild and wacky adventures of my three kids! 

Why self-publish... 

My first children's book, Queen Baby, is the story of how baby #3 rules our household, with a medieval twist! I chose to publish this through my company, Dash and Keys Publishing, because I wanted to retain creative control, and also get the book to you in a few months as opposed to the years it could take via traditional publishing. 

 

How You Can Help!

Though self-publishing allows me to be in charge of all things related to my book, its an expensive undertaking as it means I'm in charge of all things related to my book (haha!). Between illustrating, formatting, and marketing, the costs add up quickly. My goal is to raise $5,000 which will give my finished manuscript the initial boost needed to ready it for the shelves of your favorite bookstores. 

If the goal is not reached, funds will be put towards the illustration/formatting costs for the book. 

If I exceed the fundraising goal, (insert praying hands emoji) the money will go towards an additional print run, vendor fees for book conferences, and mock-ups for my next children's book, Super Mimi and the T-Rex!

The Rewards!

Along with the satisfaction of knowing your contribution supports small businesses and independent creators, you'll also get to choose from a combination of exciting perks including an early copy of Queen Baby, a handmade plush doll based on the main character, and custom illustrated coloring pages. Select the perk you want to see what extras it comes with!

If you'd like to make a perk-free donation, select the pink "Back it" button at the top of the page and enter an amount of your choice!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge will be raising the full amount. Though I plan to publish the book no matter what, the production timeline will be delayed.  Print runs might also pose a challenge if problems arise at the facility. I've planned for this by preparing a list of alternate printers to use in case issues arise. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know a financial contribution might not be possible for everyone, but another powerful way you can help is by spreading the word. Please take a moment (or two, or three) to post a link to this page, or use the Indiegogo share tools (at the top of the page) to tell your family and friends about my campaign!  

Also if you have connections to any local media outlets, or people you think I should connect with, please don't hesitate to reach out and let me know! 

Thank you so much for all your support, no matter how big or small!

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Sheunesu E Kasiamhuru-Mutembwa and I am the author of The Art of Decisive Leadership. I wrote this book because i have always had a fixation with great figures of the past and their relevancy in shaping our professional lives. With this book showing key interest primarily in the era of enlightenment and its relevancy to our society.

From Nelson to Alexzander I of Russia the leading individuals of this age did a lot to shape our societal landscape and influence every facet of our professional lives. These principles have been subsequently put into play over the years and the example of these individuals has gone on to inspire some of the greatest leaders over the last 250 years. And in a time where division and ineffective leadership has become the norm across the world the lessons from this era in history could be crucial in alleviating the problems we face in our current predicament. Providing a manual to emerging leaders in being able to act swiftly and decisively in times of both peace and war. Ensuring that all problems are remedied before they morph into conflict that instead of bringing progress in society pulls us back towards the problems of days passed.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance of principled and purposeful leadership in decisive outcomes abounding. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for history as ultimately "memory is what reason is based on to deny it is to deny reason itself."

In this book, you'll learn about effective and efficient means of leadership. With 5 of the 9 principles of the Art of Decisive leadership explored in detail. Belief, health, meritocracy, attention to detail and unity of purpose will all be in the spotlight. With riveting stories from scientists, monarchs, captains of industry, sportsmen and women, those in governance, musicians, women leadership, and military officials to name but a few.

You will love this book if you are:

  • An emerging leader looking to establish a purposeful and well guided principle based leadership model.
  • If you are a man or woman of action who is looking for a way to be able to maximize the potential of yourself and those around you
  • If you are an avid lover of literature with an affinity towards highly descriptive and vivid story telling.

The Art of Decisive Leadership is a nonfiction book that speaks to professional audience and avid reader alike who want to look at history and its influence on leadership in a enlightened way.

The Book - The Art of Decisive Leadership

The book is written in 7 parts.

Part 1 - The introduction highlights the pillars of principle and traits in character pivotal to a man or woman of a decisive nature. Whilst also profiling the era to which many of our dazzling and astonishing tales will stem from. That of the Enlightenment.

Part 2 - Focuses on the first pillar of decisive leadership that of belief. Impossible is a word belonging only in the dictionary of fools. And through the lively and graphic tales of some of our many men and women of a decisive nature. We show the importance of a can-do spirit in erasing the cloud of doubt that brings hesitance into our action. Fostering the faith in our God-endowed abilities to act without second thought. Whilst also channeling our inner strength to allow us to soldier through in trying times.

Part 3 - Focuses on the pillar of decisive leadership which focuses on health. Its importance in any action never mind decisive action is clear for all in sundry as we stand in the midst of a global pandemic. And throughout history the importance of health in decisive action cannot be understated. From the last great age of sailing in the 1800s to the present day. A healthy mind, body, and soul is crucial in decisively settling any dispute in one's favor. Allowing us to think and execute clearly and conclusively. With perfect synergy between mind and body.

Part 4 - Focuses on the pillar of meritocracy and the importance of reward in allowing decisive outcomes to abound. Reward is motivation as it gives incentive to the beings one leads which triggers their will power to want to give more to the cause. Merit is the fuel which drives the vehicle of our ambitions down the path of destiny’s avenue. As it gives impulse to the spirt of man to want to innovate and create solutions that decisively solve trials we face on a day to day.
.
Part 5 - Profiles the pillar of attention to detail. Always prepare or be prepared to be washed asunder by the enemy. Detail is important in ensuring that you have all the necessary tools in executing your mission as an organisation. And undergoing strenuous drill and practice is pivotal in mastering any craft. Ensuring that one's actions are seamless in their execution and branded onto their very essence.

Part 6 - Focuses on the pillar of principle that is unity of purpose detailing the importance of cohesiveness and coordination in fostering decisive outcomes. This would not mean that there is a need to always agree. But compromise’s importance in realizing decisive action towards our shared goals is crucial. Aiding us in avoiding the purposeless gridlock that slows down our progress in society. Bringing conflict and calamity abounding.

Part 7 - Will provide conclusion to the first part of the art of decisive leadership. Detailing the second part and the riveting tales to be told through the lenses of the last four pillars of decisive leadership. Those of a keen first impression, perception, legacy and initiative.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 paperback copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

The Art of Decisive Leadership enlightens the reader to understand the traits and principles of decisive leadership. He also seeks to look back in time to help solve the issues that lay ahead of us.

With this book showing key interest primarily in the era of enlightenment and its relevancy to our society.From Nelson to Alexzander I of Russia the leading individuals of this age did a lot to shape our societal landscape and influence every facet of our professional lives. These principles have been subsequently put into play over the years and the example of these individuals has gone on to inspire some of the greatest leaders over the last 250 years. And in a time where division and ineffective leadership has become the norm across the world the lessons from this era in history could be crucial in alleviating the problems we face in our current predicament. Providing a manual to emerging leaders in being able to act swiftly and decisively in times of both peace and war. Ensuring that all problems are remedied before they morph into conflict that instead of bringing progress in society pulls us back towards the problems of days passed.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance of principled and purposeful leadership in decisive outcomes abounding. Ensuring that one's actions are seamless in their execution and branded onto their very essence.Part 6 - Focuses on the pillar of principle that is unity of purpose detailing the importance of cohesiveness and coordination in fostering decisive outcomes. This campaign has ended! Thank you so much to everyone who contributed. I was able to reach my campaign goal through outside funding. I am now fundraising for a hardcover edition of my book, which you can support here. If you'd like to stay in touch with future updates on Think Outside the Odds, you can subscribe to my weekly newsletter here or follow me on Instagram and Twitter. If you're interested in pre-ordering a copy, please send me an email.

Think Outside the Odds is a book that tells the stories of 13 underdog entrepreneurs whose disadvantages fueled their innovation. It’s your toolkit for achieving the impossible.

My name is Vedika Dayal and I am the author of Think Outside the Odds. I wrote this book because I’ve always felt like a bit of an underdog. When I looked to entrepreneurs I resonated with for inspiration, many of them had come from unconventional paths or had rocky starts to what became explosive successes. A lot of them are still growing and remember the time not too long ago that they were struggling to innovate. I found that there was a gap for me in their stories. How did they go from being the underdog to being fueled by it? This led me on a journey of personally interviewing these people. Now, I’m sharing what I learned with you.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will feel empowered to diverge. A lot of times in life, we feel like we have to follow a certain path or stick to a certain goal. But things don’t have to be that way. I want you to see this book as your plan for living outside the lines and exploring the unlimited possibilities of the world.

In this book, you'll learn how to embrace being the underdog. You'll hear stories of...

  • A woman who nearly flunked out of high school and then went on to become an engineer at NASA and start her own company.
  • A man who escaped serving in the Israeli military by joining startup accelerator Y Combinator as the youngest ever accepted at the time.
  • A woman who started her own restaurant at the age of 27 with no culinary experience and became one of the most influential chefs in America.
  • A man who immigrated to the US from Kenya and went on to start a global movement and make millions off of selling bracelets made out of shoelaces.

You will love this book if you are trying to figure out what’s next in your life. You could be someone who’s fascinated by big ideas and the people behind them. You could also be at a point in your life where you need a boost of inspiration or a toolkit for the future.

This is a book that speaks to students, dreamers, creatives, the marginalized, story-lovers, builders, entrepreneurs, and anyone who’s ever felt like their dreams are out of reach.

 

The Book - Think Outside the Odds

The book contains research, insights, and 13 stories of underdog innovators I have spoken with throughout the course of this book. It is written in 4 parts. Each part is about a different area in our lives that we can be more intentional about in order to foster innovation.

Part 1 is called Intentional Environment. It describes how we can optimize our environment, position ourselves within it, and use it to complement our perceived disadvantages.

Part 2 is called Intentional Conversation. It's about how we can better engage with those around us, both through dialogue and listening.

Part 3 is called Intentional Movement. It explains how to choose opportunities to pursue and navigate the different curveballs life throws at us.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish next spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive stickers and bookmarks personalized to the themes of the book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Vedika Dayal is a sophomore at UC Berkeley studying Data Science and Business Administration at the Haas School of Business as part of its Global Management Program (GMP). She is the Director of Marketing for GMP, the Entrepreneurial Lead for Berkeley’s annual venture capital competition, and a consultant for the Association for Socially Responsible Business.

Vedika decided to write this book in order to inspire those who are feeling “stuck” in their lives. She is passionate about diversity in entrepreneurship, so she wanted to use her book’s platform to tell the stories of a diverse group of innovators who started out with the odds against them. In doing so, and in being a mere student herself, she hopes to help readers find a voice in the book that they resonate and connect with.

In her free time, Vedika can be found making duct tape wallets, singing to herself, or trying to be a plant mom. She loves exploring, whether it’s across continents or across the street to a new coffee shop.

For more information, you can connect with Vedika at vedikadayal@gmail.com and at @vedika.world on Instagram. You can also subscribe to her newsletter here.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ThinkOutsidetheOdds and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Forever grateful,
Vedika

story:
The Story of My Book

At the Helm: The Young Widow’s Journey from Struggle to Strength is a book about young widows’ experiences coping with life after loss and their strategies for growth and healing.

My name is Audra O’Neil, and I am the author of At the Helm: The Young Widow’s Journey from Struggle to Strength. I wrote this book in hopes of reaching other young widows who are searching for a hand to hold, a story to relate to, and a pathway back towards strength and happiness. 

I hope that you are comforted by the stories and patterns that you see in this book, and that you are able to gain strategies to help you heal and feel whole again. I also share my newfound belief that wisdom and growth can emerge from struggle, sadness, and the loss of a partner. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you flourish.

Within the stories, you will hear other widows’ views about the hard parts of life after loss, and what they do to make themselves feel more centered and complete. You'll hear widows talk about topics such as:

  • What to do with a loved one’s belongings after they pass
  • How to make holidays tolerable (and maybe even joyful)
  • Ideas for helping children survive the loss of a parent

You will love this book if you are looking to relate to other widows, are interested in forward thinking about loss and growth, or are hoping to find strategies to help you heal.

 

The Book

My book is divided into 4 parts:

Part 1 is called Charting the Course.  It is about the history of widowhood and the current situation of widows in countries around the world. It also delves into grief theory and how grief, at times, can be restorative.

Part 2, Turbulence, has to do with many of the issues that make being a young widow so difficult- ranging from dealing with the fears and anxiety associated with widowhood to managing life as a me vs. a we.

Part 3 deals with The Crew.  It focuses completely on young widows with children. It counts the many ways that solo parenting is exhausting and heartbreaking, while offering advice from multiple widows on helping your children heal and be resilient.

Part 4, entitled Surviving the Storm, is packed with strategies that have helped me and fellow young widows survive and grow stronger, such as connecting with other widows, creating rituals to help ease the pain of loss, and insight on dating after loss.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring!


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8000), I will publish an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #atthehelm and tag me as well as my publisher, #newdegreepress, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Love,
Audra 

 

About the Author

Audra O’Neil is a widow herself and a mother of twin tween boys. Audra and her boys live in the suburbs outside of Washington, DC with their Beagle, Lily. Audra’s husband, Chad, passed away from cancer in 2015 at the age of thirty-nine. As a reading and writing teacher, and coach of elementary students and teachers, Audra felt called to use the gift of writing to share her story and hopeful outlook.

After five years of maneuvering through life without a partner and solo parenting, meeting countless other young widows, and absorbing their stories along the way, she is eager to share what she has learned about struggle, loss, and love. Audra’s hope in writing this book is that she will connect with young widows who are reaching out for a hand to hold, a story to relate to, and a pathway back towards strength and happiness. 

For more information, you can connect with Audra at audraoneil@gmail.com and on Instagram @audraoneil

You will love this book if you are looking to relate to other widows, are interested in forward thinking about loss and growth, or are hoping to find strategies to help you heal. The BookMy book is divided into 4 parts:Part 1 is called Charting the Course.  It is about the history of widowhood and the current situation of widows in countries around the world. It also delves into grief theory and how grief, at times, can be restorative.Part 2, Turbulence, has to do with many of the issues that make being a young widow so difficult- ranging from dealing with the fears and anxiety associated with widowhood to managing life as a me vs. a we.Part 3 deals with The Crew.  It focuses completely on young widows with children. It counts the many ways that solo parenting is exhausting and heartbreaking, while offering advice from multiple widows on helping your children heal and be resilient.Part 4, entitled Surviving the Storm, is packed with strategies that have helped me and fellow young widows survive and grow stronger, such as connecting with other widows, creating rituals to help ease the pain of loss, and insight on dating after loss. What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring!
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8000), I will publish an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!
 Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #atthehelm and tag me as well as my publisher, #newdegreepress, so that we can help amplify your efforts.You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Love,Audra  About the AuthorAudra O’Neil is a widow herself and a mother of twin tween boys. Audra and her boys live in the suburbs outside of Washington, DC with their Beagle, Lily. Audra’s husband, Chad, passed away from cancer in 2015 at the age of thirty-nine. As a reading and writing teacher, and coach of elementary students and teachers, Audra felt called to use the gift of writing to share her story and hopeful outlook.After five years of maneuvering through life without a partner and solo parenting, meeting countless other young widows, and absorbing their stories along the way, she is eager to share what she has learned about struggle, loss, and love. Audra’s hope in writing this book is that she will connect with young widows who are reaching out for a hand to hold, a story to relate to, and a pathway back towards strength and happiness. For more information, you can connect with Audra at audraoneil@gmail.com and on Instagram @audraoneil

story:
The Book I Never Knew I Wanted To Write

I have been making and using sigils (magickal symbols) for over a decade. A couple of years ago I really wanted to do something creative, but I had no idea what to do. So I made a sigil to manifest creativity and prosperity. That inspired me to set up an on-line sigil making tutorial. One of the sections of the tutorial was about how to go beyond the original purpose of the sigil and use it to inspire a creative adventure. I created a visual sample and I so enjoyed that process that I kept making more artwork inspired by sigils.

As I made more pieces the idea for the book began to take shape. It occurred to me that I could help people understand that Creative does not always mean Artistic and show them how to use sigils to inspire their dormant creativity!

 

Your Support Matters!

This self publishing odyssey is quite a learning experience! Two of the things I've discovered are that I can't do it on my own and it isn't free. I don't have some of the skills needed to get the book published and promoted. I can learn these skills, and have plans to do so, but they're not things I can learn overnight and I'd like to publish the book this year.

Although I can design the print version of the book I don't have the skill (yet) to format it for e-readers so I will have to hire someone to do that. I will need to get an ISBN number, publishing accounts and ads to publicize the book among other things. Full disclosure: Even if I don't get fully funded I still plan to publish the book and send out perks, it will just take a lot longer!

 

What You Get

 In addition to getting a warm, fuzzy feeling for supporting a fellow human being, you can choose from these perks:

  • The Art of Sigils hardbound printed book

  • The Art of Sigils E-book

  • Prints from the book

  • Canvas Prints from the book

  • A real world or virtual sigil making party/workshop!

You can even let me know if there's a perk you don't see but would be interested in.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know people don't always have money to support a project they think is worthwhile. If that's you, here are other ways you can help that are every bit as supportive :

  • Ask people to sign up for my newsletter at http://eepurl.com/dh918v
  • The Art Of Sigils is on social media: Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Twitter. Make some noise about this campaign. To make it easy you can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Once a month I post inspiration sigils on Facebook, Instagram and my monthly newsletter. Create something inspired by the sigil, post it on your social media with the hashtag #theartofsigilsbook and I'll share it on The Art of Sigils social media and newsletter.

Keep In Touch

Sign up for my monthly newsletter at https://fb.us16.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=e2bb2adfff1178026bc840f14&id=bb193aa178

Twitter: @theartofsigils

Instagam: @theartofsigils

Facebook: @GinaLeslieAuthor

YouTube: Gina Leslie Author

Please note that all the images in this campaign are representational mock-ups. The actual product you receive may vary slightly from the images.

This is my first campaign so thanks for being patient and understanding if anything is amiss.

story:
Una entrevista para narrar todo sobre "raydg" 

- Cuéntanos un poco de ti Aarón... Danos un breve resumen de tu historia.

- AS: Hola, un placer me llamo Aaron Salazar, antes que hablarte sobre mí, debo agradecerte por tomarte el tiempo de saber sobre este proyecto. Soy un joven arquitecto, enteramente caraqueño, graduado en la Universidad Central de Venezuela (UCV) hace poco más de dos años, de la cual fui colaborador y luego profesor en la Facultad de Arquitectura y Urbanismo (FAU) en las áreas de expresión arquitectónica, viendo la representación técnica como un proceso artístico, y habilidad del pensamiento creativo, donde la imaginación misma es comprendida y aplicada. Puedo decirte de mi que siempre he tenido tres pasiones: dibujar, aprender y enseñar, por eso durante mi período como docente fui un profesional satisfecho, feliz por la dicha y el placer de dar clases a las jóvenes generaciones, siendo parte de la misma y, por supuesto, aprender en el proceso. A la vez trabajaba en una oficina de arquitectura a distancia, vivía lejos de la capital por lo que debía trasladarme en tren y sistema metro por dos horas, las cuales aprovechaba para dibujar y organizar mis clases. Esta era mi vida hasta que el ambiente inestable de mi amado país, me empujó  a alejarme de ese sueño materializado, dejándome un vacío en la existencia misma. 

 

La realidad que le toca a muchos. ¿Y que sucedió estando afuera?

AS: Bueno hoy, lejos de mis seres queridos, y llamo a así a mis profesores, estudiantes, y claro está, familia y amigos, tengo una oportunidad de retomar mis pasiones. Tuve la fortuna de ser admitido en la Universidad Complutense de Madrid, para realizar una Maestría en Diseño (grito de enhorabuena!) y después de procesar la emoción que me produjo esa noticia, decidí que dedicaré el trabajo final de ese postgrado a los que me formaron, a los que pude enseñar, y a todos los que están en proceso de aprendizaje. 

 

Y ¿Por qué un crowdfunding? ¿Por qué llegaste a la conclusión de usar este medio para lograrlo?

AS: Honestamente había escuchado sobre los crowdunding para lograr metas de ayuda médica, incluso venezolanos que lo usan para salir del país, pero cuando recibí la aceptación de la Complutense, tuve que detenerme y pensar ¿Cómo pago la matrícula?. El calendario no me daba para reunir lo suficiente con mi trabajo, pero si tenía algo claro al postularme: quería hacer un libro sobre Expresión gráfica.

Siempre he creído en la fuerza del trabajo en equipo, lo que puede ser alcanzado con la suma de manos y mentes. Soy una persona plenamente orgullosa de lo que mis estudiantes y yo logramos en la universidad, cuando al exponer los dibujos realizados en clase exaltamos el resultado de horas de trabajo en maravillosas presentaciones.

Con esta maestría en puerta, y la oportunidad de transformarla en un bien colectivo, no quiero que el dinero sea un impedimento, confío en que el más mínimo aporte, ya sea monetario o compartiendo este proyecto, impulsará cada página que, al final, le pertenecerá a esos colaboradores y tendrán la potestad de decir: "yo ayude en la producción de este libro". 

Puede que suene un poco obvio, pero ¿Cuál es el objetivo concreto de este crowdfunding?

AS: Este crowdfunding tiene un único objetivo: superar las barreras económicas para generar un libro que brinde la oportunidad a otros de aprender, reflexionar y crear. RA&DG (siglas de Representación Arquitectónica & Diseño Gráfico) es el nombre que quise darle a este proyecto que, bajo mi perspectiva, comprende a la expresión gráfica de proyectos de arquitectura como un puente para dotar de sensibilidad ese dibujo técnico y transformarlo en un material artístico que se nutre de los conocimientos de la comunicación visual. 

RA&DG, se escribe de con "i" inglesa y con g al final pero se pronuncia "rayd", cuéntanos un poco de ese material con nombre de persona.

AS: Si, correcto, se pronuncia así. RA&DG será un ebook (libro digital) que contendrá técnicas y herramientas para el manejo de software con las cuales presentar coherentemente y con un espíritu artístico esos dibujos técnicos, gráficos e imágenes de proyectos de arquitectura y diseño de interiores. Basándose en los componentes gráficos necesarios para que un proyecto sea entendido, RA&DG estará dividido en cinco temas: Planos e Isometría, Diagramas y Esquemas, Iconos e Isotipos, Perspectiva y Collage, y por último Retícula y Maquetación, los cuales explicarán, ejemplificando con edificaciones contemporáneas construidas y no construidas, como funciona la expresión gráfica en las diferentes escalas en la arquitectura.

 

Arquitectos y diseñadores, como profesionales multidisciplinarios, se enfrentan diariamente a la inversión de horas en diversas actividades, que se despliegan desde la investigación, el proceso creativo y desarrollo de una idea hasta la producción de dibujos técnicos y modelos tridimensionales de sus proyectos. Con frecuencia se encuentran obstáculos donde los minutos parecen jugar en contra, ya sea por falta de conocimientos, estrategias o técnicas que agilicen el procedimiento, y esto se refleja, en la mayoría de los casos, en el uso de las herramientas digitales donde se realiza el producto final.

Suena diferente. ¿Qué importancia consideras que tiene este proyecto?

AS: Su importancia gira en torno a sensibilizar la representación arquitectónica y optimizar un recurso, cuya escasez se transforma en un problema para estudiantes y profesionales: el tiempo. Por esta razón, RA&DG a modo de guía contendrá una recopilación no solo de teorías sobre la presentación de proyectos, sino de técnicas y estrategias para un mejor uso de las horas de trabajo y obtener resultados de alta calidad. Cada tema tendrá una sección de consejos sobre el manejo de software como Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator y Adobe Indesign, y cual es la mejor manera de utilizar cada uno.

Sería un éxito total invertir semanas de trabajo para que centenares de profesionales y estudiantes saquen provecho de cada valioso minuto, mejoren sus destrezas en el uso de herramientas digitales, incrementen su sensibilidad plástica y otorguen un espíritu artístico a sus diseños. 

Quiere decir que está dirigido para dibujantes y profesionales afines ¿no?

AS: RA&DG está dirigido a estudiantes de arquitectura, diseño gráfico, diseño de interiores y también a arquitectos y diseñadores que, como colectivos, estudios u oficinas, requieran de técnicas y material de referencia para participar en concursos de arquitectura o presentación de sus propios proyectos.

Hablemos de números ¿Cuánto necesitas y para qué? 

AS: El monto se divide para ser usado en tres fines puntuales, el pasaje aéreo idea y vuelta de Quito (ciudad donde resido hoy día) a Madrid, cuyo monto asciende a 1250 $ por la fecha de salida, la cual es septiembre de este año. Un seguro de viaje que solicita la embajada de España para conceder la visa de estudio, por 750$, y el costo de la maestría 6500$ (5050 euros). A esto se le suma un 5% de interés por parte de Indiegogo, resultando en 8500$ + 5% = 8925$. El resto de los gastos de estadía durante el año académico correrán por mi cuenta y la producción de este libro será el trabajo final que estaré desarrollando desde mi llegada para presentarlo en una primera instancia digital. Quizás, posteriormente, intente apostar por una editorial que tenga interés en su producción física, pero por el momento no está planteado. 

Llegas en septiembre a tierras Europeas ¿Cuándo culminarías ese trabajo final de maestría que será RA&DG? 

AS: La presentación final de RA&DG será en mayo del 2019, pero todos los que contribuyan con el proyecto estarán recibiendo cada mes, a partir de septiembre, los avances del mismo, es decir crearemos una bitácora web. Con este libro nacerá una comunidad y un contacto online constante donde quiero que se sientan parte de su inicio, desarrollo y su final, porque cada semilla colocada irá creciendo, y todos serán testigos de ello.  

Si te apoyo ¿Qué ofreces a cambio de mi aporte?

AS: Pues, hay distintos niveles de productos que puedes obtener dependiendo de tu aporte. Por ejemplo en el escalafón más bajo, puedes obtener una carpeta con más de 100 archivos de diferentes proyectos y representaciones gráficas que serían muy útiles para inspirarte al momento de escoger el estilo con el cual expresar tu diseño.

Pensando en un monto accesible para estudiantes, el libro en pdf puede obtenerse desde los 10$, donde evidentemente incluirá tu nombre en la sección de agradecimientos. Con 25$ el libro viene con una carpeta de iconos en vectores y las imágenes en formato PNG usadas en los Collages de RA&DG, árboles en alta resolución, personas, autos, cielos, texturas, paletas de colores, todas listas para que sean aplicadas directamente sobre tus propios proyectos. En las aportaciones de 50$ habrá, además de todo lo anterior, un manual más especializado para niveles avanzados de edición y producción en Photoshop e Illustrator respectivamente, perfectos para proyectos complejos o de escala urbana.

En los peldaños superiores, tenemos las aportaciones de 100$ y 250$. La primera te coloca como patrocinador oficial del libro, con la oportunidad de darle promoción a tu estudio, oficina o tu propio nombre en la portada, que visualizarán cientos de personas. En la última recompensa (esta es mi favorita) adicional al patrocinio, podrás enviar algún proyecto de tu autoría, ya sea académico, experimental, construido o en proceso, solo los planos en AutoCAD y su modelo tridimensional el cual, entendiendo su uso y proceso de idea, será trabajado dentro de los cinco temas de RA&DG, y estará incluido como uno de los referentes a ser consultados.

Me han dicho que eres bueno dibujando, si quisiera algo diferente a ese material ¿Tengo alguna opción?

AS: Existe un segundo grupo de recompensas especiales que pueden ser de gran interés para quienes deseen obsequiar un detalle o regalarse a sí mismos. El primero de ellos es un calendario personalizado del 2019, donde cada mes expone fotografías de atardeceres, albas, ciudades, naturaleza, momentos que he tenido la oportunidad de capturar en alta resolución. Pueden apreciar algunas de ellas en mi página web:

https://aaronsalazarsite.wordpress.com/2017/03/27/cielo-temperamental/

Este será enviado vía mail en formato pdf, listo para imprimir por tan solo 5$. 

Es cierto (risas) desde que tengo uso de razón he dibujado, por eso me gustaría usar este don para agradecerle a todas esas personas cuyo ámbito profesional es diferente al diseño y la arquitectura, pero que aún así se animan a contribuir. A partir de 10$ puedes enviarme una fotografía de ti o de alguien a quien quieras sorprender con un detalle simpático y humorístico, de la cual realizaré una caricatura que recibirás en formato digital para que imprimas en el tamaño que desees. Con 25$ y 50$ el detalle se materializa con una técnica que he desarrollado los últimos 5 años, retratos a bolígrafo sobre papel glasé, o cartulina de acabado brillante, como el de las fotografías. En mi página web se pueden apreciar algunos ejemplos
https://aaronsalazarsite.wordpress.com/2018/04/18/musas-retratadas/

Con el primer monto accedes a recibir en tu ciudad uno de 20cm x 20cm, y en el valor más elevado uno de 32x32 cm, listo para enmarcar y obsequiar a esa persona especial o, porque no, regalarte a ti mismo.

Siguiendo ese hilo de obsequios especiales ¿Crees que este proyecto puede hacer algún cambio en el mundo? 

AS: Dijo una vez Steve Jobs: "sólo quienes están lo suficientemente locos para creer que pueden cambiar el mundo son quienes lo logran". Soy creyente de que todo es posible, pero más allá de eso, mi aspiración es ayudar a que las personas sean su mejor versión, que sientan pasión por lo que hacen, y eso es lo que quiero que revele RA&DG, que con los conocimientos necesarios, disfrutes tu profesión, que te enamores de lo qué produzcas y veas la cosas maravillosas que pueden surgir de tu creatividad. 

¿Has logrado eso en el pasado? Sacar la mejor versión de una o varias personas.

AS: Mmmmm... Siento que, cuando eres docente, tienes una responsabilidad muy grande sobre ti: nada más y nada menos que el futuro de un país. En la familia se forman los valores y principios, pero es en los centros de educación donde esto se ponen en práctica y se fomentan. No soy quien para decir si logré sacar lo mejor de alguien, porque así como creo que todos los días se aprende algo, también todos los días podemos ser mejores personas. Como profesor fui muy exigente, o al menos eso considero, porque era mi trabajo encontrar las fortalezas y debilidades de mis estudiantes para impulsar y corregir lo que fuese necesario. Y si por mi lista pasaron personas que hoy recuerdan lo que pude enseñarles, son ellos quienes pueden decir si son mejores o no. 

¿Qué es lo mejor que puedes sacar de ti mismo para lograr este proyecto? 

AS: Aunque mi alma máter esté físicamente deteriorada, el espíritu de quienes aún hacen vida en ella sigue luchando por mantener viva una luz, la luz de la casa que vence a la sombra. Lo mejor que puedo sacar de mí es todo lo que aprendí en ella, siento que me respaldan siete años entre estudio y docencia, de aprender y enseñar, de aciertos y equivocaciones, de teorías y experimentos, de contenidos y evaluaciones que en la práctica profesional me hicieron ver el mundo de otra manera. Lo mejor que puedo sacar de mí es lo enseñado y lo aprendido, porque RA&DG será precisamente eso, el resultado de todo lo que la maestría pueda enriquecerme y todo lo que yo pueda aportar al gremio. 

De verdad que se escucha con mucha profundidad tu compromiso, con toda esa pasión por delante no dudo que esta meta se materialice y en unos meses te veamos en foros hablando sobre el éxito de RA&DG en el mundo. Recuérdanos como podemos contribuir con esta campaña por favor.

AS: Muchas gracias por tu confianza, y por el tiempo que te has tomado para conocer sobre mí y RA&DG, como te podrás haber dado cuenta, considero los días, las horas y los minutos como tesoros de cada ser humano, vivimos sólo una vez, y a veces nos olvidamos de disfrutarla y vivirla apasionadamente. 
Contribuir es muy sencillo, puedes seleccionar la recompensa que mejor se adapte a tus necesidades, hacer click en Obtener recompensa e ingresar los datos que Indiegogo te solicite para concretar el aporte. Recibirás un correo con el cual pasarás a formar parte de la comunidad RA&DG para que sigas de cerca el proceso, y por esa misma vía te informaré sobre la entrega de tu recompensa.

Y por su puesto, sería de muchísima ayuda que compartieras esta campaña en tus redes sociales, las cuales encontrarás al lado del botón respaldar, porque aunque no lo parezca, haciendo eco del proyecto también le concedes un inmenso aporte. 
Te invito a formar parte de este gran proyecto que está en pista de despegue, porque cuando tome vuelo, tu estarás en él, serás protagonista y testigo de su altura, su alcance, su éxito. 


Nuevamente gracias de todo corazón.

AS: Bueno hoy, lejos de mis seres queridos, y llamo a así a mis profesores, estudiantes, y claro está, familia y amigos, tengo una oportunidad de retomar mis pasiones. Tuve la fortuna de ser admitido en la Universidad Complutense de Madrid, para realizar una Maestría en Diseño (grito de enhorabuena!) y después de procesar la emoción que me produjo esa noticia, decidí que dedicaré el trabajo final de ese postgrado a los que me formaron, a los que pude enseñar, y a todos los que están en proceso de aprendizaje. 

 
Y ¿Por qué un crowdfunding? ¿Por qué llegaste a la conclusión de usar este medio para lograrlo?
AS: Honestamente había escuchado sobre los crowdunding para lograr metas de ayuda médica, incluso venezolanos que lo usan para salir del país, pero cuando recibí la aceptación de la Complutense, tuve que detenerme y pensar ¿Cómo pago la matrícula?. El calendario no me daba para reunir lo suficiente con mi trabajo, pero si tenía algo claro al postularme: quería hacer un libro sobre Expresión gráfica.
Siempre he creído en la fuerza del trabajo en equipo, lo que puede ser alcanzado con la suma de manos y mentes. Soy una persona plenamente orgullosa de lo que mis estudiantes y yo logramos en la universidad, cuando al exponer los dibujos realizados en clase exaltamos el resultado de horas de trabajo en maravillosas presentaciones.

Con esta maestría en puerta, y la oportunidad de transformarla en un bien colectivo, no quiero que el dinero sea un impedimento, confío en que el más mínimo aporte, ya sea monetario o compartiendo este proyecto, impulsará cada página que, al final, le pertenecerá a esos colaboradores y tendrán la potestad de decir: "yo ayude en la producción de este libro". 
Puede que suene un poco obvio, pero ¿Cuál es el objetivo concreto de este crowdfunding?
AS: Este crowdfunding tiene un único objetivo: superar las barreras económicas para generar un libro que brinde la oportunidad a otros de aprender, reflexionar y crear. RA&DG (siglas de Representación Arquitectónica & Diseño Gráfico) es el nombre que quise darle a este proyecto que, bajo mi perspectiva, comprende a la expresión gráfica de proyectos de arquitectura como un puente para dotar de sensibilidad ese dibujo técnico y transformarlo en un material artístico que se nutre de los conocimientos de la comunicación visual. 
RA&DG, se escribe de con "i" inglesa y con g al final pero se pronuncia "rayd", cuéntanos un poco de ese material con nombre de persona.
AS: Si, correcto, se pronuncia así. RA&DG será un ebook (libro digital) que contendrá técnicas y herramientas para el manejo de software con las cuales presentar coherentemente y con un espíritu artístico esos dibujos técnicos, gráficos e imágenes de proyectos de arquitectura y diseño de interiores. Basándose en los componentes gráficos necesarios para que un proyecto sea entendido, RA&DG estará dividido en cinco temas: Planos e Isometría, Diagramas y Esquemas, Iconos e Isotipos, Perspectiva y Collage, y por último Retícula y Maquetación, los cuales explicarán, ejemplificando con edificaciones contemporáneas construidas y no construidas, como funciona la expresión gráfica en las diferentes escalas en la arquitectura.






 
Arquitectos y diseñadores, como profesionales multidisciplinarios, se enfrentan diariamente a la inversión de horas en diversas actividades, que se despliegan desde la investigación, el proceso creativo y desarrollo de una idea hasta la producción de dibujos técnicos y modelos tridimensionales de sus proyectos. Con frecuencia se encuentran obstáculos donde los minutos parecen jugar en contra, ya sea por falta de conocimientos, estrategias o técnicas que agilicen el procedimiento, y esto se refleja, en la mayoría de los casos, en el uso de las herramientas digitales donde se realiza el producto final.
Suena diferente. ¿Qué importancia consideras que tiene este proyecto?
AS: Su importancia gira en torno a sensibilizar la representación arquitectónica y optimizar un recurso, cuya escasez se transforma en un problema para estudiantes y profesionales: el tiempo. Por esta razón, RA&DG a modo de guía contendrá una recopilación no solo de teorías sobre la presentación de proyectos, sino de técnicas y estrategias para un mejor uso de las horas de trabajo y obtener resultados de alta calidad. Cada tema tendrá una sección de consejos sobre el manejo de software como Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator y Adobe Indesign, y cual es la mejor manera de utilizar cada uno.
Sería un éxito total invertir semanas de trabajo para que centenares de profesionales y estudiantes saquen provecho de cada valioso minuto, mejoren sus destrezas en el uso de herramientas digitales, incrementen su sensibilidad plástica y otorguen un espíritu artístico a sus diseños. 
Quiere decir que está dirigido para dibujantes y profesionales afines ¿no?
AS: RA&DG está dirigido a estudiantes de arquitectura, diseño gráfico, diseño de interiores y también a arquitectos y diseñadores que, como colectivos, estudios u oficinas, requieran de técnicas y material de referencia para participar en concursos de arquitectura o presentación de sus propios proyectos.
Hablemos de números ¿Cuánto necesitas y para qué? 
AS: El monto se divide para ser usado en tres fines puntuales, el pasaje aéreo idea y vuelta de Quito (ciudad donde resido hoy día) a Madrid, cuyo monto asciende a 1250 $ por la fecha de salida, la cual es septiembre de este año. Un seguro de viaje que solicita la embajada de España para conceder la visa de estudio, por 750$, y el costo de la maestría 6500$ (5050 euros). A esto se le suma un 5% de interés por parte de Indiegogo, resultando en 8500$ + 5% = 8925$. El resto de los gastos de estadía durante el año académico correrán por mi cuenta y la producción de este libro será el trabajo final que estaré desarrollando desde mi llegada para presentarlo en una primera instancia digital. Quizás, posteriormente, intente apostar por una editorial que tenga interés en su producción física, pero por el momento no está planteado. 
Llegas en septiembre a tierras Europeas ¿Cuándo culminarías ese trabajo final de maestría que será RA&DG? 
AS: La presentación final de RA&DG será en mayo del 2019, pero todos los que contribuyan con el proyecto estarán recibiendo cada mes, a partir de septiembre, los avances del mismo, es decir crearemos una bitácora web. Con este libro nacerá una comunidad y un contacto online constante donde quiero que se sientan parte de su inicio, desarrollo y su final, porque cada semilla colocada irá creciendo, y todos serán testigos de ello.  
Si te apoyo ¿Qué ofreces a cambio de mi aporte?
AS: Pues, hay distintos niveles de productos que puedes obtener dependiendo de tu aporte. Por ejemplo en el escalafón más bajo, puedes obtener una carpeta con más de 100 archivos de diferentes proyectos y representaciones gráficas que serían muy útiles para inspirarte al momento de escoger el estilo con el cual expresar tu diseño.
Pensando en un monto accesible para estudiantes, el libro en pdf puede obtenerse desde los 10$, donde evidentemente incluirá tu nombre en la sección de agradecimientos. Con 25$ el libro viene con una carpeta de iconos en vectores y las imágenes en formato PNG usadas en los Collages de RA&DG, árboles en alta resolución, personas, autos, cielos, texturas, paletas de colores, todas listas para que sean aplicadas directamente sobre tus propios proyectos. En las aportaciones de 50$ habrá, además de todo lo anterior, un manual más especializado para niveles avanzados de edición y producción en Photoshop e Illustrator respectivamente, perfectos para proyectos complejos o de escala urbana.
En los peldaños superiores, tenemos las aportaciones de 100$ y 250$. La primera te coloca como patrocinador oficial del libro, con la oportunidad de darle promoción a tu estudio, oficina o tu propio nombre en la portada, que visualizarán cientos de personas. En la última recompensa (esta es mi favorita) adicional al patrocinio, podrás enviar algún proyecto de tu autoría, ya sea académico, experimental, construido o en proceso, solo los planos en AutoCAD y su modelo tridimensional el cual, entendiendo su uso y proceso de idea, será trabajado dentro de los cinco temas de RA&DG, y estará incluido como uno de los referentes a ser consultados.

Me han dicho que eres bueno dibujando, si quisiera algo diferente a ese material ¿Tengo alguna opción?
AS: Existe un segundo grupo de recompensas especiales que pueden ser de gran interés para quienes deseen obsequiar un detalle o regalarse a sí mismos. El primero de ellos es un calendario personalizado del 2019, donde cada mes expone fotografías de atardeceres, albas, ciudades, naturaleza, momentos que he tenido la oportunidad de capturar en alta resolución. Pueden apreciar algunas de ellas en mi página web:
https://aaronsalazarsite.wordpress.com/2017/03/27/cielo-temperamental/
Este será enviado vía mail en formato pdf, listo para imprimir por tan solo 5$. 
Es cierto (risas) desde que tengo uso de razón he dibujado, por eso me gustaría usar este don para agradecerle a todas esas personas cuyo ámbito profesional es diferente al diseño y la arquitectura, pero que aún así se animan a contribuir. A partir de 10$ puedes enviarme una fotografía de ti o de alguien a quien quieras sorprender con un detalle simpático y humorístico, de la cual realizaré una caricatura que recibirás en formato digital para que imprimas en el tamaño que desees. Con 25$ y 50$ el detalle se materializa con una técnica que he desarrollado los últimos 5 años, retratos a bolígrafo sobre papel glasé, o cartulina de acabado brillante, como el de las fotografías. En mi página web se pueden apreciar algunos ejemploshttps://aaronsalazarsite.wordpress.com/2018/04/18/musas-retratadas/
Con el primer monto accedes a recibir en tu ciudad uno de 20cm x 20cm, y en el valor más elevado uno de 32x32 cm, listo para enmarcar y obsequiar a esa persona especial o, porque no, regalarte a ti mismo.
Siguiendo ese hilo de obsequios especiales ¿Crees que este proyecto puede hacer algún cambio en el mundo? 
AS: Dijo una vez Steve Jobs: "sólo quienes están lo suficientemente locos para creer que pueden cambiar el mundo son quienes lo logran". Soy creyente de que todo es posible, pero más allá de eso, mi aspiración es ayudar a que las personas sean su mejor versión, que sientan pasión por lo que hacen, y eso es lo que quiero que revele RA&DG, que con los conocimientos necesarios, disfrutes tu profesión, que te enamores de lo qué produzcas y veas la cosas maravillosas que pueden surgir de tu creatividad. 
¿Has logrado eso en el pasado? Sacar la mejor versión de una o varias personas.
AS: Mmmmm... Siento que, cuando eres docente, tienes una responsabilidad muy grande sobre ti: nada más y nada menos que el futuro de un país. En la familia se forman los valores y principios, pero es en los centros de educación donde esto se ponen en práctica y se fomentan. No soy quien para decir si logré sacar lo mejor de alguien, porque así como creo que todos los días se aprende algo, también todos los días podemos ser mejores personas. Como profesor fui muy exigente, o al menos eso considero, porque era mi trabajo encontrar las fortalezas y debilidades de mis estudiantes para impulsar y corregir lo que fuese necesario. Y si por mi lista pasaron personas que hoy recuerdan lo que pude enseñarles, son ellos quienes pueden decir si son mejores o no. 

¿Qué es lo mejor que puedes sacar de ti mismo para lograr este proyecto? 
AS: Aunque mi alma máter esté físicamente deteriorada, el espíritu de quienes aún hacen vida en ella sigue luchando por mantener viva una luz, la luz de la casa que vence a la sombra. Lo mejor que puedo sacar de mí es todo lo que aprendí en ella, siento que me respaldan siete años entre estudio y docencia, de aprender y enseñar, de aciertos y equivocaciones, de teorías y experimentos, de contenidos y evaluaciones que en la práctica profesional me hicieron ver el mundo de otra manera. Lo mejor que puedo sacar de mí es lo enseñado y lo aprendido, porque RA&DG será precisamente eso, el resultado de todo lo que la maestría pueda enriquecerme y todo lo que yo pueda aportar al gremio. 

De verdad que se escucha con mucha profundidad tu compromiso, con toda esa pasión por delante no dudo que esta meta se materialice y en unos meses te veamos en foros hablando sobre el éxito de RA&DG en el mundo. Recuérdanos como podemos contribuir con esta campaña por favor.
AS: Muchas gracias por tu confianza, y por el tiempo que te has tomado para conocer sobre mí y RA&DG, como te podrás haber dado cuenta, considero los días, las horas y los minutos como tesoros de cada ser humano, vivimos sólo una vez, y a veces nos olvidamos de disfrutarla y vivirla apasionadamente. Contribuir es muy sencillo, puedes seleccionar la recompensa que mejor se adapte a tus necesidades, hacer click en Obtener recompensa e ingresar los datos que Indiegogo te solicite para concretar el aporte. Recibirás un correo con el cual pasarás a formar parte de la comunidad RA&DG para que sigas de cerca el proceso, y por esa misma vía te informaré sobre la entrega de tu recompensa.
Y por su puesto, sería de muchísima ayuda que compartieras esta campaña en tus redes sociales, las cuales encontrarás al lado del botón respaldar, porque aunque no lo parezca, haciendo eco del proyecto también le concedes un inmenso aporte. Te invito a formar parte de este gran proyecto que está en pista de despegue, porque cuando tome vuelo, tu estarás en él, serás protagonista y testigo de su altura, su alcance, su éxito. 
Nuevamente gracias de todo corazón.

story:
My new romance novella is ready for action and I've decided to self-publish this gem. I'm looking for a few awesome supporters who will contribute towards the costs of publishing the eBook version of "Catch A Falling Star." Things like cover design, professional editing and promotional materials.

I've put together a few fun incentives for contributors. Additionally, funds raised over my publishing costs will be donated to the Golden Rule Services' Cycling team participating in 2017s NorCal AIDS Cycle - raising money to help the fight the end HIV/AIDS.

Here's a description of the new book:
A therapist once told Martin Stevens that being gay was the only thing that saved him from being the most boring man alive. He spends his daytime working a dead-end job and his nights still pining after the ex-fiance who left him five years ago. When his older brother, Daniel, takes him to see a touring musical, a mishap sends superstar performer Alec Jameson flying off the stage right into Martin’s lap. It’s love at first sight. But can that love withstand the scrutiny of the press, a shock-jock radio personality bent on causing trouble, and the return of Martin’s overbearing ex-fiance?

story:
IMPORTANT:

To get your copy of "The Shnoos and Panoos", be sure to select the perk "Get the Book!" on the menu to the right!

This way, we can get your shipping information and customization preferences before you complete your donation :)

 

The story behind the story ...

"The Shnoos and Panoos" was written while I was feeling - you guessed it - lost and confused. I found myself focusing on what was wrong with the world instead of what was working. In an effort to reconnect with the things that made me happy, I limited the amount of time spent on the internet and began spending more time daydreaming, exploring nature, and creating art. Many wonderful creative projects emerged from this brief period of time - this book, for one thing - but most importantly, my inner sense of joy and peace returned and I was able to easily access happiness and positivity again!

Once the basic concept of my book was down in written form, I had so much fun illustrating it. Several watercolor and pencil illustrations were generated in the beginning. Eventually, I settled on a color palette and aesthetic I believed supported the world of the story, and created the final illustrations in Photoshop. There is nothing like getting lost in a world of your own making, especially when it's a world of silly creatures and made-up places. 

Accessing joy is natural for children, and I believe it is just as natural for adults. However, by the time we're grown, we've developed habits of abandoning our own inner joy in order to please others. I believe that we can take better care of our children by empowering them to own their uniqueness and pursue the things that truly bring them joy. My hope is that "The Shnoos and Panoos" will serve as a silly, but important, reminder for kids and adults to listen to our hearts when times are tough. 

I've learned a ton through the making of this book. It's truly been a rewarding experience for me creatively and I can't wait to share it with others!

$600 will get my book into people's hands and make it available for online purchase by September. 

Meeting my funding goal will jumpstart the self-publication process and allow contributors of $25 or more to get their hands on a signed copy of the book before it's made available to the general public. Funds raised beyond $600 will go straight towards printing fees for additional hard copies of the book. 

Thanks for checking out my page!

Your support means the world to me. Please consider sharing this campaign with friends and family who you think might appreciate its message, and thanks for playing an essential role in this exciting endeavor. Be sure to stay tuned for updates!

Watercolor rendering of marshmallows.

 

Early illustration drafts and Archer, studio pup and sweetest buddy.

 

Winds of Confusion taking shape ... they used to be PINK!

 

Showing a mock-up of the book to Faith, age 5, before we auditioned for a commercial together.

 

Early character design for the shnoos and panoos. They've come a long way!

story:
About the Book

A Gunslinger's Reckoning is about an outlaw who is broken out of prison along with two hundred of his fellow inmates to join the army of a sinister and evil man they call warlock.  But the gunslinging outlaw is betrayed by warlock and inflicts his own brand of hell upon him.

My name is Juvencio (JS) Castro and I am the author of A Gunslinger's Reckoning. I wrote this book because I have always wanted to write a horror, a western, and a thriller wrapped up in one book.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a page-turner filled with excitement and adventure. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from mundane reality.  Ride into the wild west alongside Tuck the outlaw as he combats the forces of a man they call Warlock.

A Gunslinger's Reckoning takes place in 1875, inside America's Wild West.  We follow the story of Clyde Tuck, an outlaw gunslinger who is broken out of a remote barren prison that resides in the middle of a lifeless and barren desert.  His breakout, along with two hundred of his fellow inmates, is orchestrated by a man they call Warlock, but who is anything but.  Warlock, aka Von Onslaught, is a character possessed by evil who is motivated by wanting to become the next Napoleon Bonaparte.  He plans to turn hardened inmates into super soldiers that he can command. 

This book will take you to places that you don't expect to go to in a Western.  You'll be thrust into World War II and the battle of Kasserine Pass, and travel back in time to 1066 and the Battle of Hasting's.  You'll find yourself in the Sierra Madre on top of a hidden valley where the residents that live there are trapped by spells and forces cast on them by the evil that resides there.

You will love this book if you are the type of person who likes living on the edge of your seat.  If you are someone who enjoys scary fun, or who just loves to read a good adventure novel.

A Gunslinger's Reckoning speaks to thrill-seeking adrenaline junkies and those who go to movies just to be in a tense and suspenseful situation.  There are those who want to grapple with a good western and darkness in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that A Gunslinger's Reckoning  entertains the reader to the point of not being able to put it down. 

 

I am Juvencio (JS) Castro, an ex-Military vet and a Third Degree Black Belt in the Martial Arts.  I have had a wonderful life with a wonderful family. My campaign hopes to raise money for Tunnels to Towers for the families of our fallen men and women in uniform and St. Judes Children's Cancer Research Hospital.  You will help create homes and pay off mortgages for those left behind with burdens they were never prepared to face alone.  You will help pay tribute to those who have made the ultimate sacrifice.  Your contribution will give a child with cancer hope, as their families will never have to pay a fee they cannot afford in order to save their children's lives. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • "Tunnel To Towers" for the families of our fallen men and women in uniform, and St Judes Children's Hospital for Cancer Research. 
  • The editor and I will work to revise and publish my manuscript in April of 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Juvencio (JS) Castro is a Radiological Control Technician with Navarro Environmental working in clean-up efforts in Nevada.  He is one of the most giving individuals you will ever meet, giving his time and efforts to teach martial arts to at risk kids at Allen Sarac's Professional Karate Centers.

Juvencio wrote this book because he has always loved thrillers, Westerns, and Horrors.  He wanted to write about all three and wrap them up into one book.  Juvencio is passionate about history, scary stuff, and adventure, but also passionate when it comes to giving back.  His hope is to help charities he knows will make a difference in people's lives.  He is curious to see just how good he can be as a writer.

Juvencio loves writing just for fun and going on adventures with his wife to out-of-the-way unique places. If he could, he would get himself lost on purpose and never come back from his travels.  Thank god for his wife! For more information, you can connect with Juvencio (JS) Castro at juvenciocastro61@gmail.com and @jscastrowriter on Twitter, Juvencio S. Castro on Facebook, and JS Castro Author on Instagram.

--------------------------------------

The risk I face in achieving my goal is not securing enough funding for my charities, as I will have to figure out a way to secure whatever funds I don't get, but I am a persistent person who seeks to fulfill and achieve his goals for goodness.  I didn't get to be a third degree black belt in martial arts by being passive.  My plan is to throw my efforts through social media, phone calls, e-mails, meetings, podcasts, and local affiliations to get me to where I need to be.  

If you are not able to support me through your treasure, please help me spread the word about "A Gunslinger's Reckoning." Help me make noise by sharing and spreading my posts on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Linkedin, or use the Indiegogo share tools to help me reach out.  Thank you all and may God bless you all.

I wrote this book because I have always wanted to write a horror, a western, and a thriller wrapped up in one book.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a page-turner filled with excitement and adventure. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from mundane reality.  Ride into the wild west alongside Tuck the outlaw as he combats the forces of a man they call Warlock.
A Gunslinger's Reckoning takes place in 1875, inside America's Wild West.  We follow the story of Clyde Tuck, an outlaw gunslinger who is broken out of a remote barren prison that resides in the middle of a lifeless and barren desert.  His breakout, along with two hundred of his fellow inmates, is orchestrated by a man they call Warlock, but who is anything but.  Warlock, aka Von Onslaught, is a character possessed by evil who is motivated by wanting to become the next Napoleon Bonaparte.  He plans to turn hardened inmates into super soldiers that he can command. 
This book will take you to places that you don't expect to go to in a Western.  You'll be thrust into World War II and the battle of Kasserine Pass, and travel back in time to 1066 and the Battle of Hasting's.  You'll find yourself in the Sierra Madre on top of a hidden valley where the residents that live there are trapped by spells and forces cast on them by the evil that resides there.
You will love this book if you are the type of person who likes living on the edge of your seat.  If you are someone who enjoys scary fun, or who just loves to read a good adventure novel.
A Gunslinger's Reckoning speaks to thrill-seeking adrenaline junkies and those who go to movies just to be in a tense and suspenseful situation.  There are those who want to grapple with a good western and darkness in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that A Gunslinger's Reckoning  entertains the reader to the point of not being able to put it down.  
I am Juvencio (JS) Castro, an ex-Military vet and a Third Degree Black Belt in the Martial Arts.  I have had a wonderful life with a wonderful family. My campaign hopes to raise money for Tunnels to Towers for the families of our fallen men and women in uniform and St. Judes Children's Cancer Research Hospital.  You will help create homes and pay off mortgages for those left behind with burdens they were never prepared to face alone.  You will help pay tribute to those who have made the ultimate sacrifice.  Your contribution will give a child with cancer hope, as their families will never have to pay a fee they cannot afford in order to save their children's lives.

About the Author
Juvencio (JS) Castro is a Radiological Control Technician with Navarro Environmental working in clean-up efforts in Nevada.  He is one of the most giving individuals you will ever meet, giving his time and efforts to teach martial arts to at risk kids at Allen Sarac's Professional Karate Centers.Juvencio wrote this book because he has always loved thrillers, Westerns, and Horrors.  He wanted to write about all three and wrap them up into one book.  Juvencio is passionate about history, scary stuff, and adventure, but also passionate when it comes to giving back.  His hope is to help charities he knows will make a difference in people's lives.  He is curious to see just how good he can be as a writer.Juvencio loves writing just for fun and going on adventures with his wife to out-of-the-way unique places. If he could, he would get himself lost on purpose and never come back from his travels.  Thank god for his wife!
